Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Description & Requirements

Electronic Arts creates next-level entertainment experiences that inspire players and fans around the world. Here, everyone is part of the story. Part of a community that connects across the globe. A place where creativity thrives, new perspectives are invited, and ideas matter. A team where everyone makes play happen.

EA SPORTS is one of the leading sports entertainment brands in the world, with top-selling videogame franchises, award-winning interactive technology, fan programs, and cross-platform digital experiences. EA SPORTS creates connected experiences that ignite the emotion of sport through industry-leading sports video games, including EA SPORTS Madden NFL, FC, NHL, NBA LIVE, PGA TOUR and UFC.

There are millions of EA SPORTS players generating billions of events every day. We are using the high-volume data streams to detect and anticipate Security threats and issues as soon as they occur. The Game Security Data Analyst will be an essential EA SPORTS Security Team member. Reporting to the Development Director - Game Security, you will support the SOC lead and the Security Data Scientists by ensuring partners can receive and understand relevant information promptly to help keep our Sports games safe and secure.This is a hybrid role that is located in Madrid.

Responsibilities


Analyse data to support business decisions and security operations
Develop business intelligence and reporting solutions
Communicate findings, issues and trade-offs to team members
Adopt a security mindset to predict the adversary's moves and ensure the right Data is available to detect them.
Think and solve complex data problems in a maintainable and scalable fashion


Required Qualifications


2 years experience
Proficiency with SQL and no-SQL databases.
Knowledge and experience with data gathering, analysis, and visualization tools
Some knowledge and experience working with Python
Experience with data visualizations in tools such as Tableau, Power BI, Looker


About Electronic Arts

We’re proud to have an extensive portfolio of games and experiences, locations around the world, and opportunities across EA. We value adaptability, resilience, creativity, and curiosity. From leadership that brings out your potential, to creating space for learning and experimenting, we empower you to do great work and pursue opportunities for growth.

We take a holistic approach with our benefits program, focusing on physical, emotional, financial, career, and community wellness to support a balanced life with paid time off and new parent leave, plus free games and so much more. We nurture environments where our teams can always bring their best to what they do.

Electronic Arts is an equal opportunity employer. All employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, national origin, ancestry, sex, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, genetic information, religion, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, marital status, family status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We will also consider employment qualified applicants with criminal records in accordance with applicable law. EA also makes workplace accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities as required by applicable law.

Title: Analista de datos
Description:
¡Estamos buscando un Experto en Data & BI! 🚀




🕒 Modalidad: 100 % Remote

🔹 Mínimo 3 años de experiencia en Data

🔹 Experto en Power BI y SQL (Nivel avanzado – requisito indispensable)

Title: Prácticas en Análisis de Datos y Power BI (Madrid) (12289)
Description:
Prácticas en Análisis de Datos y Power BI (Madrid)




Nuestro negocio de Redes de Electricidad España (UFD) está inmerso en un apasionante reto de transformación, que tiene como misión la digitalización y sensorización de nuestra red eléctrica para evolucionar de una red meramente física a una red virtual, donde el análisis de datos y la inteligencia artificial nos permitan gestionar y dar respuesta a todas las necesidades del nuevo ecosistema sostenible.




¡Queremos ser los mejores en lo que hacemos! Trabajando en equipo, haciendo más con menos y desarrollando a cada persona, para crecer juntos tanto en el ámbito de Redes Electricidad España como en el de otros negocios.




En este contexto ofrecemos una Beca en el negocio de Redes Electricidad España.




Estas prácticas te permitirán:

Participar en la elaboración de cuadros de mando en Power BI a partir de información de sistemas de UFD con el objetivo de disponer de KPIs que permitan hacer un seguimiento y análisis sobre el avance del proceso de control de calidad regulatoria.




Lo que necesitas:

Estudiante de último curso del grado en Ingeniería Industrial, Matemática, Física, Estadística o similares.
Conocimiento bases de datos
Conocimiento de PowerBI




Lo que ofrecemos:

Ayuda al estudio
Lugar de realización de las prácticas en Madrid, presencialmente en las oficinas de AV. de América 38




1) Rellena el formulario con tus datos. No olvides adjuntar tu CV actualizado.

2) Si te encuentras entre los perfiles más ajustados, contactaremos contigo para participar en las diferentes pruebas y entrevistas.

3) Si avanzas con éxito en el proceso………. ¡podrás formarte con el equipo Naturgy!

Title: Data Analyst & Reporting Specialist
Description:
Join Openbank, the 100% digital bank of the Santander Group, where innovation meets opportunity! With over 2 million customers across Spain, Germany, the Netherlands, Portugal, we're leading the way in digital banking. From loans and mortgages to a cutting-edge, fully automated investment platform, our products are transforming the industry.

At Openbank, we pride ourselves on simplicity, agility, and security, earning us the title of the most recommended Spanish bank among our customers. Technology is in our DNA and we are constantly developing new digital solutions and products. And we're not stopping there! At Openbank we are proud to be a bank that is gaining more and more international presence, we have just landed in the United States and Mexico.




If you're passionate about digital innovation, eager to make an impact, and ready to be part of a dynamic and forward-thinking company, then we want to hear from you! Join us and be part of our journey to redefine banking for the digital age!




Mission & Role:

In this role, you will be responsible for analyzing and extracting insights from large datasets from various sources in our AWS Datalake, to solve complex business problems. You will work closely with data engineers to implement scalable solutions and ensure that the data you work with is clean and reliable. You will be expected to create actionable results through statistical analysis, data visualization, and software development, enabling decision-making across different teams. You will also play a key role in supporting the team’s efforts to use data more effectively and to automate key business processes.




You will work in a transparent environment where knowledge-sharing and open communication are encouraged. As a team player, you’ll engage with others to reach common goals, making sure to balance both the big picture and fine details.




You will apply your knowledge of statistical analysis and experience with tools like Python or Spark to implement solutions and provide clear insights. Additionally, you will help design and produce efficient data pipelines, contributing to the success of the team and its projects.




To be successful in the role you must bring:

At least +3 years of experience in Statistical Analysis: Strong knowledge of basic statistical concepts and the ability to implement them in programming languages such as Python or Spark. You know when to use different statistical indicators and have experience summarizing insights from data.
Experience with Large Datasets: Familiarity with working on large datasets and implementing scalable solutions. You understand data cleaning, and you know how to collaborate effectively with data engineers.
Problem-Solving with Data: Ability to break down complex problems into manageable analytical components and reuse existing solutions from previous projects.
Software Development Knowledge: Understanding of software development practices, including using Git, writing and testing your code, and leveraging it to produce meaningful results. If you're an open-source enthusiast, we'd love to see your GitHub contributions!
Proficiency in Data Visualization: Experience with tools like ggplot, matplotlib, Tableau, or similar. Bonus points for experience with Microstrategy or QuickSight.
SQL Expertise: You are an SQL ninja, and writing both exploratory and efficient queries is second nature to you.
STEM Background: A degree in a STEM field (Science, Technology, Engineering, or Mathematics) is highly desired due to the strong software development component of the role.
Emotional resilience: You can give and take criticism well. You don’t get defensive when your ideas are challenged, and you’re polite enough to challenge others’ ideas when necessary.
Confidence without arrogance: You are confident but not arrogant. You ask for help when needed and openly admit when you don’t know something. You value and celebrate the contributions of others.
Exceptional communication skills: You explain your ideas clearly and succinctly, ask for input, and listen carefully. You build on the ideas of others, and your presentations are impactful without being overwhelming.
Transparency: You value transparency, always willing to share your knowledge and ideas with the team.
Team collaboration: You are a strong team player, supporting and collaborating with others to achieve common goals.




What do we offer?

Joining a dynamic and agile company undergoing international expansion.
Working in start-up mode with the support of the Santander Group.
Competitive remuneration and attractive benefits package.
Possibility of growth within the company and the Group.
Collaborating on international projects in different countries.
Excellent work environment, social clubs and frequent events.




Would you like to grow with us? Join our team!

Show more

  • Competitive remuneration and attractive benefits package.

  • Collaborating on international projects in different countries.
  • Excellent work environment, social clubs and frequent events.


Would you like to grow with us? Join our team!

Title: Analista de datos
Description:
Para algunas personas, la tecnología es reto, la innovación es pasión, y la posibilidad de cambiar el mundo es una oportunidad.




Somos una consultora tecnológica que ofrece soluciones globales a las necesidades complejas de las empresas desde otro punto de vista. Escuchamos para crear progreso en nuestro mundo, integrando tecnología y conocimiento.




Si estás buscando nuevos retos, buscamos incorporar a nuestro equipo un perfil de Analista de Datos.




¿Cuáles serán tus funciones?

Obtención de datos, análisis y procesamiento.
Desarrollo de procesos de extracción, transformación y carga (procesos ETL) y modelado y estructura de datos.
Definición de arquitectura y selección del ecosistema/plataforma de gestión del dato.
Generar soluciones Business Intelligence, gestionando BBDD transaccionales y programación en SQL.
Generar cuadros de mando con Power BI.




¿Qué buscamos?

Grado en Ingeniería Informática, Matemáticas, Estadística, Telecomunicaciones o similar.
Experiencia mínima de 2 años en funciones similares.




¿Qué podemos aportarte?

Contrato Indefinido. Creemos en el desarrollo a largo plazo de nuestros empleados, por eso ofrecemos estabilidad laboral desde el primer día.
Flexibilidad horaria y conciliación. Fomentamos un entorno de trabajo flexible para que puedas equilibrar tu vida personal y profesional. Además, tenemos jornada intensiva los viernes y durante los meses de verano.
Plan de carrera individualizado. Diseñamos un plan de desarrollo profesional para que puedas alcanzar tus metas y crecer dentro de la empresa.
Programa de retribución flexible (Plan de pensiones, seguro de salud, plataforma beneficios....).




Si has llegado hasta aquí... ¡Queremos conocerte!

Show more
HTML:
Para algunas personas, la tecnología es reto, la innovación es pasión, y la posibilidad de cambiar el mundo es una oportunidad.


Somos una consultora tecnológica que ofrece soluciones globales a las necesidades complejas de las empresas desde otro punto de vista. Escuchamos para crear progreso en nuestro mundo, integrando tecnología y conocimiento.


Si estás buscando nuevos retos, buscamos incorporar a nuestro equipo un perfil de Analista de Datos.


¿Cuáles serán tus funciones?

  • Obtención de datos, análisis y procesamiento.
  • Desarrollo de procesos de extracción, transformación y carga (procesos ETL) y modelado y estructura de datos.
  • Definición de arquitectura y selección del ecosistema/plataforma de gestión del dato.
  • Generar soluciones Business Intelligence, gestionando BBDD transaccionales y programación en SQL.
  • Generar cuadros de mando con Power BI.


¿Qué buscamos?

  • Grado en Ingeniería Informática, Matemáticas, Estadística, Telecomunicaciones o similar.
  • Experiencia mínima de 2 años en funciones similares.


¿Qué podemos aportarte?

  • Contrato Indefinido. Creemos en el desarrollo a largo plazo de nuestros empleados, por eso ofrecemos estabilidad laboral desde el primer día.
  • Flexibilidad horaria y conciliación. Fomentamos un entorno de trabajo flexible para que puedas equilibrar tu vida personal y profesional. Además, tenemos jornada intensiva los viernes y durante los meses de verano.
  • Plan de carrera individualizado. Diseñamos un plan de desarrollo profesional para que puedas alcanzar tus metas y crecer dentro de la empresa.
  • Programa de retribución flexible (Plan de pensiones, seguro de salud, plataforma beneficios....).


Si has llegado hasta aquí... ¡Queremos conocerte!

Title: Analista de datos
Description:
En Konecta estamos redefiniendo la experiencia del cliente y del empleado, fusionando la audacia humana con la tecnología más innovadora. New Konecta, nuestra nueva marca, nueva identidad y nueva misión, es más que una evolución: es una nueva forma de entender la operación, el liderazgo y la relación con nuestros clientes.




Apostamos por la transformación digital, impulsada por GenAI, para optimizar cada interacción y mejorar la experiencia de cliente. Queremos que formes parte de esta revolución.




Buscamos un/a Analista de datos con objetivo de analizar y dar sentido a todos los datos obtenidos a través de las diferentes herramientas y plataformas utilizadas por los diversos departamentos de la empresa.







¿Qué harás en este reto?

Serás un pilar clave de New Konecta
Recopilar y procesar datos a gran escala.
Diseñar y desarrollar aplicaciones de datos utilizando herramientas y marcos seleccionados.
Leer, extraer, transformar, poner en escena y cargar los datos en herramientas y marcos seleccionados según se requiera y se solicite.
Administrar sistemas de almacenamiento distribuido.
Desarrollar consultas con bases de datos con SQL o PL/SQL.
Desarrollar programas estadísticos, por ejemplo con Python o R.
Procesar los datos no estructurados en un formato adecuado para su análisis.
Realizar análisis del entorno y diseñar sistemas de reporting para la visualización de los datos (sobre todo en business intelligence).
Apoyar las decisiones empresariales con análisis ad hoc según sea necesario.
Desarrollar informes periódicos que resuman el análisis de los datos.
Crear visualizaciones de datos y dashboards.










¿Cómo sabemos que eres la persona que buscamos?

Tienes un nivel de inglés B2 alto o superior, que te permite comunicarte fluidamente en entornos globales.
Titulación Superior (Estadísticas, Informática, Ingeniería y Matemáticas, Dirección de Empresas y Humanidades).
Conocimientos y manejo en herramientas especializadas en análisis y reporte de datos.
Conocimientos actualizados de Matemáticas, Estadística, Big Data y Analítica web.
Experiencia con lenguajes de programación y bases de datos: Python, SQL o Cloud Computing, entre otros.
Experiencia con servicios de IA/ML en la nube (AWS SageMaker, Google AI, Azure ML) para entrenamiento y despliegue de modelos.
Conocimientos de bases de datos relacionales y no relacionales.
Experiencia en consultoría en Data Warehouse en áreas como Análisis, Diseño, ETL, Reporting y Cuadros de mando.










¿Qué te ofrecemos?

Un entorno dinámico y en transformación, donde tu rol será clave para la evolución de la compañía.
Formar parte de New Konecta, un proyecto que desafía lo establecido y apuesta por el futuro del sector.
Modalidad hibrida, buscamos talento en toda España a nivel nacional ¡No importa donde estés ubicado/a!
Un paquete retributivo competitivo, ajustado a tu experiencia y al impacto que genere.
Beneficios exclusivos en nuestro Club de Beneficios Konecta.
Crecimiento y desarrollo en una multinacional, con oportunidades reales de evolución profesional y aprendizaje continuo.




Somos una empresa comprometida con la igualdad de oportunidades entre mujeres y hombres, apostando por la equidad en todas nuestras posiciones.







Si quieres ser parte de algo grande y dejar huella en New Konecta, este es tu momento. ¿Te sumas al cambio?

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
¡Ampliamos nuestro equipo! 🔎




¿Buscas un nuevo reto donde desarrollar tu carrera y aprender nuevas tecnologías? Entonces sigue leyendo porque esto te puede interesar.




Scalian es una empresa de más de 6.000 personas con una dimensión internacional, con oficinas en Europa y América del Norte. Estamos especializados en dar servicios a diferentes clientes enfocados en Data, Cloud e Inteligencia Artificial.




¿Qué funciones realizarás?

Analizar grandes conjuntos de datos no estructurados para identificar y construir una comprensión relevante.
Diseñar y construir scripts avanzados en SQL para conectar datos desde nuestro data lake, analizar y validar mapeos de datos.
Identificar anomalías y problemas de calidad en los datos, asegurando su correcta gestión o escalado.
Aplicar técnicas analíticas y estadísticas para identificar tendencias, resolver problemas y prever el rendimiento.
Elaborar informes claros y concisos que resuman los hallazgos analíticos para distintas audiencias.




Requisitos mínimos:

Experiencia en la traducción de problemas de negocio a soluciones basadas en datos, utilizando herramientas y técnicas adecuadas.
Conocimiento sólido de conceptos empresariales de servicios financieros y métricas clave.
Dominio de conceptos matemáticos y estadísticos y su aplicación práctica.
Capacidad para construir narrativas convincentes basadas en datos para stakeholders.
Nivel de inglés alto, al menos B2.




Requisitos valorables:

Conocimientos de políticas y estándares de gobernanza y cumplimiento, incluyendo seguridad de datos y gestión de registros.
Experiencia liderando la construcción de scripts analíticos avanzados en SQL, Python, Impala/Hive, Snowflake, entre otros.




¿Qué tendrás con nosotros?

🚀 Formar parte de un equipo de alto nivel bajo tecnologías punteras en el mercado.

⛱ 25 días laborables de vacaciones

💻 100% Teletrabajo

📝 Contrato indefinido

📚 Formación continua, certificaciones, meetups y planes de desarrollo profesional personalizados para que podamos seguir creciendo juntos. Contamos con acceso a plataformas internas con contenido abierto para que lo disfrutes cuando tú quieras y a tu ritmo.

🕐 Jornada completa con horario flexible para facilitar la conciliación entre vida familiar y profesional.

🎉 Afterworks en las oficinas

🎂 La tarde del cumpleaños libre

🏋️‍♀️ Descuentos en gimnasios

💲Programas de retribución flexible: seguro médico, tarjeta restaurante, abono de transporte, cheques para escuelas infantiles.

🌏 Como parte del grupo Scalian, abrimos nuestras fronteras y crecemos internacionalmente.

♻️ En el grupo apostamos por iniciativas sostenibles.




¡Despega en tu carrera con Scalian Spain!✈

Title: Analista de datos
Description:
¿Buscas un nuevo reto?

Pues en esta ocasión, STAC amplía su equipo humano incorporando un/a Analista de Datos para trabajar de forma presencial en el complejo productivo de Padrón (A Coruña).




Funciones principales del puesto:

Colaborar con equipos multidisciplinares para recopilar requisitos y definir soluciones de business intelligence.
Definición y ejecución de los desarrollos de business intelligence en Qlik Sense.
Analizar posibles mejoras en los informe de negocio de la empresa.




¿Qué ofrecemos?

Remuneración competitiva según valía del perfil y experiencia demostrable (abiertos/as a negociación).
Cursos de idiomas internaciones (inglés y francés), softwares de diseño industrial (SolidWorks, Revit, etc.) y aplicaciones informáticas (Excel, BI, etc.); entre otras formaciones internas.
Beneficios sociales.
Plan de carrera y amplio desarrollo profesional.




¿Cuál es el perfil solicitado?

Formación profesional de FP Superior o Universitaria, en cualquier rama orientada al análisis de datos.
Al menos 2 años de experiencia en alguna de las siguientes herramientas: Qlik Sense, Qlikview, PowerBI
Necesaria experiencia en procesos ETL y lenguaje SQL.
Conocimientos de Excel avanzado.
Valorable inglés avanzado.
Valorable experiencia en el uso de ERPs de gestión comercial y producción.




¡Únete a este proyecto con ambiente joven y dinámico; y dónde poder crecer profesionalmente!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

About Us

We are a software company developing CRM solutions for the healthcare sector, trusted by top healthcare providers across Spain, Italy, Germany, Poland, Turkey, Brazil, Mexico, and beyond. Since 2019, we have been part of DocPlanner Group, Europe and Latin America's leading healthtech SaaS unicorn, dedicated to transforming healthcare and enhancing the patient experience.

For more about us, visithttps://www.tuotempo.es/

Job Description

The Role

We are looking for a Data Analyst to join our team in Barcelona!

As a Data Analyst, you will play a key role in shaping our product's data strategy, ensuring high-quality data analysis, visualization, and modeling to support data-driven decisions across the company. This position is ideal for someone passionate about data analytics, product insights, and problem-solving in a fast-paced SaaS environment.

Your Main Tasks & Responsibilities


Data Analysis (40%) – Extract, analyze, and interpret data to generate actionable insights.
Data Visualization (30%) – Build dashboards and reports using Looker, Tableau, or similar tools.
Data Quality (20%) – Ensure accuracy and consistency in data sources.
Data Modeling (10%) – Support business teams with modeling and structuring data for analysis.


You will collaborate closely with Product, DevOps, Backend, and Operations teams, working on 80% project-based tasks and 20% ad-hoc requests.

Qualifications

✨ What Will Make You Shine

Must-Have Requirements


1-2 years of experience in data analysis within a digital product start-up or SaaS company.
Degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Economics, or a related field.
Proficiency in SQL, Excel, and data visualization tools (e.g., Looker, Tableau).
Strong analytical skills – ability to translate data into insights.
Excellent communication skills – ability to present data clearly and concisely.
Fluent in English (Italian and Spanish area plus).
Attention to detail – high level of accuracy and commitment to data integrity.


Nice-to-Have Requirements


Experience with Python or other programming languages.
Familiarity with BigQuery, AWS, or other data warehousing solutions.
Understanding of machine learning techniques and their applications.
Experience in product damanagement, SaaS, or tech industry.
Strong project management and cross-functional collaboration skills.


Additional Information

Why Join Us?

What Makes This Role Exciting?


Work on end-to-end data flow, influencing key product and business decisions.
Gain visibility into all company departments, learning from a variety of business areas.
Be part of a fast-growing, international company with a strong tech focus.


Hiring Process

1️⃣ HR Interview – 60 min (in English)

2️⃣ Interview with Hiring Manager – 60 min (in English)

3️⃣ Business Case Assignment (in English)

4️⃣ Team Interview & Business Case Discussion – 60 min (in English)

Benefits Of Working With Us

✅ Dynamic, collaborative work environment

Share options plan after six months

Extra day off for your birthday

❤️ Comprehensive health insurance

Access to iFeel - mental wellbeing platform
Show more

Title: Full Stack Data Analyst - Critical Data Products
Description:
We're searching for a talented Data Analyst to join our growing Critical Data Products team. This team is pivotal in delivering and enhancing high-quality, robust data solutions that underpin Pleo’s essential data-driven products and operations. You will directly impact our customers by supporting critical business areas with insightful analytics and self-serve data tools.

You’ll be part of the broader Product Hub within the Data competence, collaborating with a multidisciplinary team across a broad range of product and operational related data initiatives.

You will thrive in this role if you:


Are an experienced Data Analyst with a strong background in analytics, data visualization, and insight generation within a fast-paced environment, preferably fintech
Possess advanced SQL skills and experience with data modeling tools, particularly dbt and BigQuery
Have extensive experience with data visualization tools, specifically Looker and LookML
Are passionate about building high-quality, robust, and user-friendly dashboards and tools for diverse stakeholders
Are committed to ensuring the reliability and accuracy of data and data products, critical in a fintech setting
Possess an understanding of business and product strategy, and how data can support it
Demonstrate a strong sense of ownership and responsibility for your work
Are familiar with CI/CD processes and understand their importance in maintaining data integrity
Have experience in financial operations, payments, credit and/or compliance.
Possess a solid understanding of data privacy principles and governance practices


What will you be doing:


Run analyses with data, present and automate insights and recommendations to business stakeholders
Empowering our internal teams at Pleo with high-quality, self-serve data through the development and maintenance of dashboards and reports in Looker
Support in the development and delivery of reporting for external purposes
Identifying opportunities to improve operational efficiencies and product performance using data and analytics
Collaborating with cross-functional stakeholders to define data requirements, uncover trends, and identify opportunities for product enhancement
Engaging with data colleagues and peers to foster a culture of cross-team learning and knowledge sharing


Your colleagues say you


Are an effective bridge-builder who creates strong partnerships across data, engineering, product, and business teams
Balance innovation and pragmatism, knowing when to go deep and when to deliver quickly
Are a trusted mentor who uplifts and develops those around you
Actively seek and share knowledge, contributing to a culture of continuous learning
Have a knack for bringing people together and aligning them towards shared goals
Are someone they’d love to have coffee with (virtual or not)


Show me the benefits!


Your own Pleo card (no more out-of-pocket spending!)
Lunch is on us - with catering in our Lisbon, Copenhagen and London offices or a monthly lunch allowance paid directly together with your salary in other markets 🍜
Private health insurance to ensure you’re fit in body and mind to do your best work
We offer 25 days of holiday + your public holidays
Flexibility/remote working options
Option to purchase 5 additional days of holiday through a salary sacrifice
We’re trialling MyndUp to give our employees access to free mental health and wellbeing support with great success so far ❤️‍🩹
Access to LinkedIn Learning - acquire new skills, stay abreast of industry trends and fuel your personal and professional development continuously
Paid parental leave - we want to make sure that we're supportive of families and help you feel that you don't have to compromise your family due to work 👶


Why join us?

Working at Pleo means you're working on something very exciting: the future of work. Our mission is to help every company go beyond the books. Pleo itself means ‘more than you’d expect’, and it’s been the secret to our success over the last 8 years. So it’s only fitting that we’d pass this philosophy onto our customers to help them make the most of their finances.

We think company spending should be delegated to all employees and teams, that it should be as automated as possible, and that it should drive a culture of responsible spending. Finance teams shouldn’t be siloed from the rest of the organisation – they should work in unity with marketing, sales, IT and everyone else.

Speaking of working in unity, our values tell the story of how we work at Pleo. We have four core values, the first of which is ‘champion the customer’, which means we address real pain points that businesses face. Next up is ‘succeed as a team’, which highlights how our strength lies in our diversity and trust in each other. We also ‘make it happen’ by taking bold decisions and following through to deliver results. Last but not least, we ‘build to scale’, creating lasting solutions that address today’s challenges and anticipate tomorrow’s needs.

So, in a nutshell, that's Pleo. Today we are a 850+ team, from over 100 nations, sitting in our Copenhagen HQ, London, Stockholm, Berlin, Madrid, Montreal and Lisbon offices —and quite a few full-time remotes in 35 other countries! Being HQ'd out of Copenhagen means we're inspired by things like a good work-life balance. If you don't work in the office with us, we'll help you set up the best remote setup possible and make sure you still have time to connect with your team.

About Your Application


Please submit your application in English; it’s our company language so you’ll be speaking lots of it if you join 💕
We treat all candidates equally: If you are interested please apply through our application system - any correspondence should come from there! Our lovely support isn't able to pass on any calls/ emails our way - and this makes sure that the candidate experience is smooth and fair to everyone 😊
We’re on a mission to make everyone feel valued at work. That’s only achievable if our team reflects the diversity of the world around us - and that starts with you, hitting apply, even if you are worried you might not tick all the boxes! We embrace and encourage people from all backgrounds to apply - regardless of race/ethnicity, colour, religion, nationality, gender, sex, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability, neurodiversity, socio-economic status, culture or beliefs
When you submit an application we process your personal data as a data processor. Find out more about how your data is used in the FAQs section at the bottom of our jobs page
Show more
HTML:
We're searching for a talented Data Analyst to join our growing Critical Data Products team. This team is pivotal in delivering and enhancing high-quality, robust data solutions that underpin Pleo’s essential data-driven products and operations. You will directly impact our customers by supporting critical business areas with insightful analytics and self-serve data tools.

You’ll be part of the broader Product Hub within the Data competence, collaborating with a multidisciplinary team across a broad range of product and operational related data initiatives.

You will thrive in this role if you:

  • Are an experienced Data Analyst with a strong background in analytics, data visualization, and insight generation within a fast-paced environment, preferably fintech
  • Possess advanced SQL skills and experience with data modeling tools, particularly dbt and BigQuery
  • Have extensive experience with data visualization tools, specifically Looker and LookML
  • Are passionate about building high-quality, robust, and user-friendly dashboards and tools for diverse stakeholders
  • Are committed to ensuring the reliability and accuracy of data and data products, critical in a fintech setting
  • Possess an understanding of business and product strategy, and how data can support it
  • Demonstrate a strong sense of ownership and responsibility for your work
  • Are familiar with CI/CD processes and understand their importance in maintaining data integrity
  • Have experience in financial operations, payments, credit and/or compliance.
  • Possess a solid understanding of data privacy principles and governance practices

What will you be doing:

  • Run analyses with data, present and automate insights and recommendations to business stakeholders
  • Empowering our internal teams at Pleo with high-quality, self-serve data through the development and maintenance of dashboards and reports in Looker
  • Support in the development and delivery of reporting for external purposes
  • Identifying opportunities to improve operational efficiencies and product performance using data and analytics
  • Collaborating with cross-functional stakeholders to define data requirements, uncover trends, and identify opportunities for product enhancement
  • Engaging with data colleagues and peers to foster a culture of cross-team learning and knowledge sharing

Your colleagues say you

  • Are an effective bridge-builder who creates strong partnerships across data, engineering, product, and business teams
  • Balance innovation and pragmatism, knowing when to go deep and when to deliver quickly
  • Are a trusted mentor who uplifts and develops those around you
  • Actively seek and share knowledge, contributing to a culture of continuous learning
  • Have a knack for bringing people together and aligning them towards shared goals
  • Are someone they’d love to have coffee with (virtual or not)

Show me the benefits!

  • Your own Pleo card (no more out-of-pocket spending!)
  • Lunch is on us - with catering in our Lisbon, Copenhagen and London offices or a monthly lunch allowance paid directly together with your salary in other markets 🍜
  • Private health insurance to ensure you’re fit in body and mind to do your best work
  • We offer 25 days of holiday + your public holidays
  • Flexibility/remote working options
  • Option to purchase 5 additional days of holiday through a salary sacrifice
  • We’re trialling MyndUp to give our employees access to free mental health and wellbeing support with great success so far ❤️‍🩹
  • Access to LinkedIn Learning - acquire new skills, stay abreast of industry trends and fuel your personal and professional development continuously
  • Paid parental leave - we want to make sure that we're supportive of families and help you feel that you don't have to compromise your family due to work 👶

Why join us?

Working at Pleo means you're working on something very exciting: the future of work. Our mission is to help every company go beyond the books. Pleo itself means ‘more than you’d expect’, and it’s been the secret to our success over the last 8 years. So it’s only fitting that we’d pass this philosophy onto our customers to help them make the most of their finances.

We think company spending should be delegated to all employees and teams, that it should be as automated as possible, and that it should drive a culture of responsible spending. Finance teams shouldn’t be siloed from the rest of the organisation – they should work in unity with marketing, sales, IT and everyone else.

Speaking of working in unity, our values tell the story of how we work at Pleo. We have four core values, the first of which is ‘champion the customer’, which means we address real pain points that businesses face. Next up is ‘succeed as a team’, which highlights how our strength lies in our diversity and trust in each other. We also ‘make it happen’ by taking bold decisions and following through to deliver results. Last but not least, we ‘build to scale’, creating lasting solutions that address today’s challenges and anticipate tomorrow’s needs.

So, in a nutshell, that's Pleo. Today we are a 850+ team, from over 100 nations, sitting in our Copenhagen HQ, London, Stockholm, Berlin, Madrid, Montreal and Lisbon offices —and quite a few full-time remotes in 35 other countries! Being HQ'd out of Copenhagen means we're inspired by things like a good work-life balance. If you don't work in the office with us, we'll help you set up the best remote setup possible and make sure you still have time to connect with your team.

About Your Application

  • Please submit your application in English; it’s our company language so you’ll be speaking lots of it if you join 💕
  • We treat all candidates equally: If you are interested please apply through our application system - any correspondence should come from there! Our lovely support isn't able to pass on any calls/ emails our way - and this makes sure that the candidate experience is smooth and fair to everyone 😊
  • We’re on a mission to make everyone feel valued at work. That’s only achievable if our team reflects the diversity of the world around us - and that starts with you, hitting apply, even if you are worried you might not tick all the boxes! We embrace and encourage people from all backgrounds to apply - regardless of race/ethnicity, colour, religion, nationality, gender, sex, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability, neurodiversity, socio-economic status, culture or beliefs
  • When you submit an application we process your personal data as a data processor. Find out more about how your data is used in the FAQs section at the bottom of our jobs page

Title: Business Data Analyst
HTML:
Are we the best-kept secret in Málaga?

We like to think so. Over the past year, our Málaga hub has grown into a thriving center of excellence, where we combine innovation, collaboration, and opportunity. We are serious about finding the right people and are confident that we have a lot to offer.


The role in a nutshell

Are you passionate about leveraging data to make meaningful business improvements? As a Business Data Analyst within the Coupa Global Reporting & Governance team, you will be instrumental in enabling datadriven decision-making and fostering continuous improvement. Your goal? To turn data insights into actionable strategies that enhance contract compliance, boost supplier performance, and streamline operational efficiency. In this role, you will collaborate closely with diverse stakeholders, acting as a vital link between business needs and technical capabilities. Your responsibilities will include gathering and validating business requirements, translating them into technical specifications, and ensuring user-friendly reporting solutions meet organizational goals. You will uphold best practices in data quality, work towards impactful reporting outcomes, and create a data-driven culture across our global Coupa landscape. With opportunities for growth in a stimulating and innovative environment, you will develop cost-saving initiatives, enhance business processes, and maintain compliance with audit requirements. If you thrive on advancing improvements through data and working in a collaborative global team, this role is your next career move!


More specifically, you will be expected to:

• Analyze trends and patterns in Power BI reports to identify areas for improvement, such as contract compliance and supplier performance;

• Monitor catalogue growth and drive initiatives to increase on-catalogue purchasing and reduce offcatalogue spend;

• Evaluate purchasing trends to enhance contract compliance and support cost-saving strategies;

• Track payment schedules to maximize early payment discounts and optimize cost efficiency;

• Implement initiatives to reduce cycle times for requisitions, invoice processing, and supplier onboarding;

• Advocate for electronic invoicing to improve accuracy and streamline processes;

• Gather, validate, and document business requirements for reporting projects;

• Support data standardization efforts to enhance reporting accuracy and consistency;

• Act as a liaison between business stakeholders and technical teams to ensure reporting solutions align with strategic goals;

• Develop training programs and user guides to empower end users in utilizing reports effectively


Do you have what it takes?

• Skilled at interpreting data and providing actionable business insights;

• Advanced skills in Power BI and Excel; SAP experience is beneficial.

• Solid interpersonal and communication skills to engage with and collaborate efficiently across teams;

• High accuracy and a focus on maintaining data quality in reporting outputs;

• Quick to identify and address operational and technical issues;

• Significant experience in increasing efficiencies and optimizing workflows;

• Experience working across procurement, finance, or accounts payable functions;

• Ability to develop and deliver clear training materials for diverse user groups.


Language : As you will be part of a global team, you are expected to communicate fluently in English (verbal and written). Knowledge of other languages such as French, German, or Spanish is favorable but not mandatory.


Travel: Some occasional travelling will be required.


Location: This role will ideally be based at our Malaga office, but we could consider other suitable locations


Wondering what’s in it for you?

🆙 Be part of a world class organization with a mandate to identify opportunities for improvement and drive performance benefits

🏠 Hybrid Work

💰 Competitive compensation structure

👨‍👩‍👧‍👦 Health Insurance coverage for you and your dependents

🛟 Life Insurance

📈 Growth Opportunities (career progression, tuition assistance, language courses, training and certifications, etc.)

🛬 Relocation assistance


If you are ready to join our diverse team, make a difference and advance your career in a global setting, we want to hear from you.

Join us and help shape the future of data-driven procurement and finance processes! Given the global nature of the role, we ask applicants to submit their resume in English and indicate their working rights status.

Glencore encourages diversity and provides an inclusive workplace.

Accommodations are available upon request for applicants with special needs.

Interviews may start prior to the closing date.

Title: Data Analyst
Place: Sant Cugat del Vallès, Catalonia, Spain
Description:
At Roche you can show up as yourself, embraced for the unique qualities you bring. Our culture encourages personal expression, open dialogue, and genuine connections, where you are valued, accepted and respected for who you are, allowing you to thrive both personally and professionally. This is how we aim to prevent, stop and cure diseases and ensure everyone has access to healthcare today and for generations to come. Join Roche, where every voice matters.

The Position

Are you passionate about transforming raw data into powerful insights? As a Data Analyst, you'll navigate through complex data ecosystems from sources like SalesForce Sales & Service and ERP systems, seamlessly integrating them to create a unified data landscape. You'll spearhead the development of scalable data processes, collaborate with cross-functional teams to incorporate cutting-edge analytics tools, and craft insightful dashboards and reports that drive strategic business decisions.

We are seeking an experienced Data Analyst with a minimum of 5 years of experience to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in Business Intelligence (BI) development within a Microsoft SQL environment.

Your role will be critical in partnering with finance, sales, service, and IT teams to align data initiatives with business goals, acting as a data management expert and effectively communicating your findings to both technical and non-technical stakeholders. Additionally, your dedication to data protection and privacy compliance will ensure our business information remains secure and trustworthy.

Your Key Responsibilities

Create, implement, and manage data integration workflows using SQL Integration Services
Develop multidimensional cubes and tabular models in SQL Analysis Services
Generate and distribute reports using SQL Reporting Services
Perform in-depth data analysis and generate insights to support business decisions
Develop and maintain reports and dashboards using Tableau
Work with large datasets and ensure data integrity and quality
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand data requirements and provide solutions
Create comprehensive documentation and reports to communicate insights and recommendations
Ensure data integrity, accuracy, and security across all BI systems
Continuously improve BI processes and methodologies to enhance efficiency and effectiveness



Who You Are

Minimum of 5 years of experience in a data analysis role
Proven experience with Microsoft SQL Server (SSAS, SSRS, SSIS)
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Ability to manage multiple projects concurrently and meet deadlines
Excellent communication and collaboration skills
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Statistics, or a related field
Preferred: Experience with Snowflake database
Preferred: Experience developing reports and dashboards using Tableau
Preferred: Familiarity with data structures in SAP


Who we are

A healthier future drives us to innovate. Together, more than 100’000 employees across the globe are dedicated to advance science, ensuring everyone has access to healthcare today and for generations to come. Our efforts result in more than 26 million people treated with our medicines and over 30 billion tests conducted using our Diagnostics products. We empower each other to explore new possibilities, foster creativity, and keep our ambitions high, so we can deliver life-changing healthcare solutions that make a global impact.

Let’s build a healthier future, together.

Roche is an Equal Opportunity Employer.
Show more

Title: Analista de datos
Description:
Descripción de la entidad




Asistencia Sanitaria Colegial, SA de Seguros es una entidad cuyo objeto consiste en el ejercicio de la actividad aseguradora directa en los ramos de enfermedad, incluida la asistencia sanitaria, y accidentes. Su actividad se desarrolla en Catalunya, principalmente en la provincia de Barcelona.




La entidad está inscrita en el Registro Administrativo de Entidades Aseguradoras de la DGSFP y, como entidad aseguradora, está obligada a cumplir con la normativa española y europea relacionada con el marco regulatorio de Solvencia II. Asimismo, Asistencia Sanitaria es la entidad dominante del grupo asegurador del mismo nombre.




En nuestra Entidad, como organización de tipo cooperativo integrada por médicos, somos conscientes y nos tomamos muy en serio el encargo de hacer posible y sostenible un tipo de medicina social que permita proporcionar, por un lado, la atención óptima al paciente y, por otra, unas condiciones justas para que los profesionales de la salud puedan ejercer su vocación.

En este sentido, nuestra entidad tiene como misión impulsar el desarrollo de un sistema sanitario de medicina social y colectiva que permita la libre elección de médico al usuario, bajo la filosofía del modelo de cooperativismo sanitario.




Descripción de la posición




La posición permite obtener una visión holística del sector asegurador de salud, al realizar tareas de análisis de datos de diferentes segmentos de la actividad aseguradora (análisis estático y dinámico de población asegurada, análisis de suficiencia de primas, análisis de gasto, seguimiento de objetivos comerciales, etc.), teniendo una experiencia mínima de 4 años en posiciones similares.




Cómo será tu día a día




Gestión y mantenimiento de bases de datos de la Entidad.
Análisis específicos de negocio.
Reporting periódico a Dirección y otros Departamentos de la Entidad.
Definición y explotación de KPI de negocio.
Apoyo en la explotación de datos en otras áreas de la Entidad.




Qué esperamos de ti




Titulación mínima de Licenciatura, Grado o Máster en Estadística, ADE u otras disciplinas relativas a la economía y / o gestión de datos.
Experiencia mínima de 4 años en posiciones similares.
Catalán y castellano nativo con un dominio perfecto tanto en escritura como en lectura.
Ofimática avanzada.
Conocimiento del lenguaje SQL (MySQL).
Conocimiento de gestión de bases de datos.
Valorable conocimiento de Tableau.
Capacidad analítica.
Capacidad de aprendizaje.
Compromiso con la empresa.
Trabajar en equipo.
Habilidades ofimáticas.
Capacidad de comunicación.
Iniciativa y autonomía en la gestión.




Qué te vamos a ofrecer




Contrato indefinido, crece con nosotros.
Horario con jornada partida de lunes a jueves (con flexibilidad de 1 hora), viernes y agosto jornada intensiva.
En Asistencia Sanitaria te ofrecemos el mejor entorno para que puedas desarrollarte profesionalmente.
Tendrás muy buen clima laboral.
Como empresa de salud, lo primero que nos importa es la tuya, para ello, tendrás póliza de salud para ti, tu pareja e hijos menores de 26 años totalmente gratuita.
Compensación económica por comida directamente en nómina o bien con tarjeta restaurante.
Seguro de Vida.
Posibilidad de acogerte a la retribución flexible y así podrás ahorrar en tus gastos.
Nos encanta que te formes, para ello, te ofrecemos clases de inglés in company.
Después de tu larga trayectoria laboral, queremos premiarte como te mereces, por ello, cuando llegue el día, tendrás un premio a la jubilación.
26 días laborables de vacaciones.
Show more

  • Tendrás muy buen clima laboral.
  • Como empresa de salud, lo primero que nos importa es la tuya, para ello, tendrás póliza de salud para ti, tu pareja e hijos menores de 26 años totalmente gratuita.
  • Compensación económica por comida directamente en nómina o bien con tarjeta restaurante.
  • Seguro de Vida.
  • Posibilidad de acogerte a la retribución flexible y así podrás ahorrar en tus gastos.
  • Nos encanta que te formes, para ello, te ofrecemos clases de inglés in company.
  • Después de tu larga trayectoria laboral, queremos premiarte como te mereces, por ello, cuando llegue el día, tendrás un premio a la jubilación.
  • 26 días laborables de vacaciones.

Title: Analista de Datos Junior_Inglés alto
Description:
¿Quieres formar parte de una de las cinco empresas más grandes de IT y procesos de negocios IT? ¿Buscas nuevos retos con clientes internacionales en una multinacional?




¡Nuestros 90.000 asociados te están esperando!




En CGI estamos buscando un Analista de Datos Junior con nivel de inglés, excel (macros) y experiencia en Google App Script.




Funciones:

Soporte al cliente en la definición, ejecución y optimización de procesos dentro del equipo de funciones delegadas. Esta posición estará encargada de automatizar y eficientar los procesos.




Requisitos:

Conocimiento entorno Google (Correo, Drive, Excel)
Macros Excel nivel programación.
Visual Basic
Google App Script
Inglés nivel C1.




Valorables.

Python
Al menos dos años de experiencia.
Capacidad analítica y autonomía en el trabajo
Administración y dirección de empresas – Económicas / Formación Técnica
Contabilidad Analítica - Análisis de Costes
Manejo herramientas de Google (Drive, Data Studio)
Presentaciones.
Valorable Reporting a alta dirección.

Ofrecemos:

Increíble equipo de trabajo
Conciliación laboral, porque tu bienestar es importante para nosotros




¡En CGI te estamos esperando!

Title: Analista Funcional Regulatorio
Description:
En OPTIMISSA tenemos claro que el éxito de nuestros proyectos se debe a las personas que forman nuestro equipo. Por eso, si tienes al menos 2 años de experiencia como Analista Funcional nos comprometemos a impulsar tu talento, satisfacer tus expectativas laborales y hacerte sentir como en casa. ¿Quieres construir hoy el mundo de mañana? ¡Sigue leyendo!




¿Qué buscamos?

Interesados/as en posición híbrida en Madrid.
Parametrización y actualización en BBDD de herramienta de reporting regulatorio (SQL y Oracle) de validaciones publicadas por los diferentes Reguladores.
Testeo y certificación de los cambios en los diferentes entornos.
Reporting de EEFF de Sucursales Extranjeras, Entidades de Pago y de Dinero electrónico.
Resolución de incidencias de clientes y usuarios.




¿Qué podemos ofrecerte?

Formar parte de una gran empresa competitiva y en continuo crecimiento.
Integración en un equipo de profesionales altamente cualificado, con un buen clima laboral, innovador y dinámico.
Formación especializada y desarrollo profesional continuo.
Beneficios sociales y plan de compensación flexible.
Retribución competitiva.
Modalidad híbrida en Madrid.




Si crees que eres talento, ¡apúntate!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Desarrolla tus competencias como Data Analyst para un gran proyecto de gran impacto.




En ALTEN tenemos claro que el éxito de nuestros proyectos se debe a las personas que forman nuestro equipo. Por eso, si tienes experiencia como Data Analyst, nos comprometemos a impulsar tu talento, satisfacer tus expectativas laborales y hacerte sentir como en casa. ¿Te unes a nuestro #WelcomeHome? ¡Sigue leyendo!




¿Qué buscamos?

Experiencia de, al menos, 4 años en posiciones como Data Analyst.
Experiencia senior con la herramienta PowerBI.
Experiencia con Python y utilizar esta herramienta para elaborar reportes.
Experiencia senior en BBDD SQL.
Valorable experiencia con Report Builder.
Valorable experiencia con Snowflake y/o Snowquery.
Valorable experiencia o conocimiento con Azure Data Factory o Azure Data Bricks.
Modalidad híbrida en Barcelona.




¿Qué podemos ofrecerte?

Formar parte de una gran empresa competitiva y en continuo crecimiento.
Integración en un equipo de profesionales altamente cualificado, con un buen clima laboral, innovador y dinámico.
Formación especializada y desarrollo profesional continuo.
Beneficios sociales y plan de compensación flexible.
Retribución competitiva.




¿Quiénes somos?

Somos un equipo. Formamos parte de ALTEN, una multinacional europea especializada en proporcionar servicios de consultoría, tecnología de la información y servicios de ingeniería a las principales compañías del mercado español.




Si te gustan las cifras, te diremos que en España tenemos una facturación de 217 millones de euros, 9 sedes y un equipo formado por 5.240 personas.




Además, en ALTEN nos enorgullecemos de ofrecer igualdad de oportunidades con independencia de género, edad, diversidad de capacidades o país de origen. Nuestro compromiso está con el talento y con las personas que lo tienen.




Si crees que eres talento, ¡apúntate!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

Who We Are

Cint is a pioneer in research technology (ResTech). Our customers use the Cint platform to post questions and get answers from real people to build business strategies, confidently publish research, accurately measure the impact of digital advertising, and more. The Cint platform is built on a programmatic marketplace, which is the world’s largest, with nearly 300 million respondents in over 150 countries who consent to sharing their opinions, motivations, and behaviours.

We are feeding the world’s curiosity!

Job Description

We are looking for a Data Analyst to support our Data Science & Analytics team in delivering high-quality insights through data exploration, analysis, and reporting. The ideal candidate is a self-starter, comfortable working with large datasets, automating processes, and supporting internal stakeholders with data-driven recommendations.

Responsibilities


Analyze large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and insights, ensuring quality and reliability of results.
Respond to ad hoc client-specific requests including performing analyses, data manipulation and producing summary results.
Generate reports and visualizations to effectively communicate findings to stakeholders to support decision making
Support campaign performance analysis and contribute to benchmark development and optimization.
Design scripts and tools to automate and streamline data extraction processes using Python, SQL, and APIs.
Develop interactive dashboards and reporting tools (such as Power BI, Tableau, Streamlit) to provide a clear overview of key metrics and insights.
Collaborate with stakeholders to enhance data collection processes.


Qualifications

Required:


Master’s degree or Bachelors in a quantitative field (e.g., Data Analytics, Statistics, Mathematics or a related discipline).
1-2 year(s) of experience in a data analysis role, preferably in market research, or advertising analytics.
Proficiency in Python (especially pandas and NumPy) for data manipulation.
Strong experience with MS Excel for analysis and reporting.
Experience working with large datasets and performing complex data transformations.
Strong analytical skills with a focus on data validation and accuracy.
Excellent communication skills to present findings and collaborate with internal teams and customers.
Self-starter with ability to work independently.


Additional Information

Nice to Have:


Experience in media measurement analytics.
Ability to write and optimize SQL queries.
Familiarity with Streamlit, Power BI, or Tableau for dashboarding.
Understanding of Databricks or similar cloud-based analytics platforms.


Our Values

Collaboration is our superpower


We uncover rich perspectives across the world
Success happens together
We deliver across borders.


Innovation is in our blood


We’re pioneers in our industry
Our curiosity is insatiable
We bring the best ideas to life.


We Do What We Say


We’re accountable for our work and actions
Excellence comes as standard
We’re open, honest and kind, always.


We are caring


We learn from each other’s experiences
Stop and listen; every opinion matters
We embrace diversity, equity and inclusion.


More About Cint

In June 2021, Cint acquired Berlin-based GapFish – the world’s largest ISO certified online panel community in the DACH region – and in January 2022, completed the acquisition of US-based Lucid – a programmatic research technology platform that provides access to first-party survey data in over 110 countries.

Cint Group AB (publ), listed on Nasdaq Stockholm, this growth has made Cint a strong global platform with teams across its many global offices, including Stockholm, London, New York, New Orleans, Singapore, Tokyo and Sydney. (www.cint.com)

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We are looking for a skilled and motivated Data Analyst to join our team. This role offers a dynamic environment where you will have the opportunity to work on diverse data analysis tasks, collaborate with international colleagues, and develop your skills within a growing organization.




ABOUT THE JOB

We are looking for a skilled and motivated Data Analyst to join our team. This role offers a dynamic environment where you will have the opportunity to work on diverse data analysis tasks, collaborate with international colleagues, and develop your skills within a growing organization




WHAT ARE YOU GOING TO DO AS A DATA ANALYST?

Collaborate daily with colleagues in Poland

Conduct both on-demand and scheduled data analyses

Create and maintain comprehensive reports

Organize and structure file systems effectively

Manage databases efficiently

Oversee internal and external data exchange processes

WHAT DO YOU BRING AS A DATA ANALYST?

Proficiency in Microsoft Excel with Power Add-ons

English language proficiency

Microsoft Access

Database management experience

University degree or ongoing studies in Mathematics, Business Analytics, Econometrics, or a related field

Travel Requirement: Visits to Poland at least four times a year (one week per visit)




ABOUT THE TEAM

If you are passionate about data, enjoy working in a collaborative environment, and seek opportunities for professional growth, we would love to hear from you!

Title: Business Intelligence Data Analyst
Description:
GROUP BNP PARIBAS

BNP Paribas Group is the top bank in the European Union and a major international banking establishment. It has close to 185,000 employees in 65 countries. In Spain we are more than 5,100 employees within 13 business lines.




Spain IT Production




Spain IT Production organization consists of CIB ITO & ITG IT Platforms and is responsible for providing IT Production services to our Clients in EMEA, ensuring a Digital Market evolution, in a secured and performant environment, and with a reliable quality. IT Production organisation includes Infrastructure services, Telecom & Workspace, Production Security and Application Production domains and associated transversal services (CTO Office, Control Tower, PMO and IT Continuity). In Spain, IT Production relies on a Platform with over 400 experts that provide full-stack support services ensuring a secure, stable, standardized, and efficient production.




ABOUT THE JOB




MISSION




For the Security Dashboard activities, we are looking for Data Security & Business Intelligence Engineer to support and coordinate the deployment of the Security Dashboard within the security productions of the BNPPARIBAS group




RESPONSIBILITIES




· Needs analysis for evolution of the current BI solution

· Provision of solutions in accordance with the company’s strategy based on (Cyber security Group requirements

· Coordinate the redesign and Dashboard transformation

· Deploy the solution within the group’s ProdSec entities of the group

· Ensure comitology with stakeholders (Technical Experts, Functional Experts, Product Owner, and customers.)

· Report to the manager and Team lead on the achievements progress.

· Ensuring the updating of the documentary heritage corpus




REQUIREMENTS




Studies




Bachelor’s in computer science or equivalent




Experience




Minimum 5 to 10 years of experience in cybersecurity and production environments




Languages




Fluent English written and spoken. Strong written, oral, and interpersonal communications skills.

French speaking is a plus.




SKILLS




Technical




o PowerBI, SQL, MS SSIS/ SSAS/ SSRS

o Python, PHP/ Symfony

o Systems: architecture, security, etc. to support monitoring and steering actions- définition, production et mise en place de KPI de pilotage et de suivi

o The methodology for monitoring Cybersecurity Control Projects;

o Vulnerability & Patch Management

o Qualys, Tanium is plus




Transversal & Behavioral




o Strong situational analysis and needs identification.

o Proposal force for the most relevant solutions

o Ability to collaborate with different types of profiles. Technical, Functional, Project Leadership. Team leader, etc.

o Ability to share and transmit.

o Rigor, organization and method with a spirit of analysis and synthesis

o Customer orientation: listening, support and understanding of needs.

o Transverse vision to anticipate data correlations / Impacts.

o Good Cyber Security Culture.




BENEFITS

• Training programs, career plans and internal mobility opportunities, national and international thanks to our presence in different countries.

• Diversity and Inclusion Committee that ensures an inclusive work environment. In recent years, several employee communities have been created to organize diversity and inclusion awareness actions (PRIDE, We Generations and MixCity).

• Corporate volunteering program (1 Million Hours 2 Help) in which employees can dedicate time out of their working hours to volunteer activities.

• Flexible compensation plan.

• Hybrid telecommuting model (50%).

• 31 vacation days.







Diversity and inclusion commitment

BNP Paribas Group in Spain is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.

Title: Junior Data Analyst – Power Platform
Description:
🚀¿Te interesa el mundo del dato, la automatización y las herramientas low-code? ¡Tenemos una gran oportunidad para ti!.




Desde Adecco, nos encontramos en la búsqueda de un perfil Junior Data Analyst con foco en Power Platform para incorporar en un entorno internacional, innovador y con proyectos punteros de visualización y automatización.




🎁 ¿Qué se ofrece?




💼 Contratación directa e indefinida por cliente final.

🏢Modelo híbrido.

📍Ubicación en Málaga.

🌍 Entorno internacional, dinámico y en crecimiento.




💡 ¿Qué harás en este rol?




🔹 Participarás en la automatización de procesos y recogida de requisitos de negocio.

🔹 Desarrollarás dashboards, KPIs y modelos de datos (estrella, copo de nieve).

🔹 Crearás flujos en Power Automate y aplicaciones con Power Apps.

🔹 Modelarás y transformarás datos para facilitar su explotación en Power BI.

🔹 Colaborarás en la definición de roles de acceso y seguridad en visualizaciones.




🎯 Requisitos clave:




✅ Grado o titulación técnica relacionada con Tecnología o Informática.

✅ Conocimiento en Power BI, Power Apps y Power Automate.

✅ Experiencia (académica o práctica) con modelos de datos relacionales.

✅ Metodologías Agile (Jira, Confluence, DevOps).

✅ Español fluido (C1) e inglés intermedio (B2).




🌟 Será un plus si cuentas con:




🔹 Conocimientos en Location Intelligence, Data Governance y visualización avanzada (D3.js, JS).

🔹 Experiencia en pipelines CI/CD (Jenkins) y gestión de calidad del dato.




Si cumples con los requisitos y quieres un nuevo reto, ¡inscríbete ahora! 📩

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About us

For more than 20 years, our global network of passionate technologists and pioneering craftspeople has delivered cutting-edge technology and game-changing consulting to companies on the brink of AI driven digital transformation. Since 2001, we have grown into a full service digital consulting company with 5500+ professionals working on a worldwide ambition. Driven by the desire to make a difference, we keep innovating. Fuelling the growth of our company with our knowledge worker culture. When teaming up with Xebia, expect in-depth expertise based on an authentic, value-led, and high quality way of working that inspires all we do.




About the Role

We are looking for a seasoned Analyst and Data Visualisation Expert to support the data science and analytics team focused on Direct To Consumer data products. The ideal candidate is a great storyteller and strong technical contributor who has experience solving business problems with data-driven tools. You will be responsible for delivering a suite of analytical products including analyses, dashboards, insights, and recommendations with especial focus on clickstream data. You will collect, analyze, and present data to improve strategic decision making and to track the benefits unlocked by the data products. You should have a high degree of curiosity about the business and the skills to discover impactful insights from data. You should be able to communicate those insights in a way that builds confidence and enables decisions that drive business value.




Responsibilities

Conduct analysis to estimate expected value of data products. Measure and track benefits created by data products, and convert them to financial or key KPI metrics
Support business stakeholders and regional data analysts by understanding their needs and providing guidance and support.
Create dashboards to track adoption and business impact of features and data product launched.
Dive deep into complex business problems and provide insights on digital features and AI model performance through hypothesis testing. Partner with cross functional teams on implementation.
Partner with data science, data analytics and product managers on planning, goal setting and prioritization.
Partner with data and engineering teams to improve instrumentation and product/models health reporting, pre/post analysis and business debugging.
Partner with A/B test team to design experiments and post-hoc analysis of results.
Bring data to life through storytelling in a clear and meaningful way to audiences with mixed levels of technical expertise and informing key strategic decisions.
Promote a culture of data driven technical excellence, ownership, collaboration.




Your background

3+ years of professional experience analysing complex data, drawing conclusions, and making recommendations.
3+ years of applied data visualization experience. Tableau and PowerBI as main visualization tools.
3+ years of experience in extracting & manipulating large data sets from various relational databases using SQL (Amazon Redshift, Oracle, Google BigQuery).
Coding skills in at least one statistical or programming language (R or Python preferred) to import, summarise, and analyse data.
Hands on experience working with big data, ideally clickstream data, in big data volume sectors such as ecommerce, gaming, social network etc. e-commerce platforms are a plus.
Ability to translate and present complex analysis in executive summaries. Clear and effective written and verbal communication and strong interpersonal skills.
Strong problem solving skills.
Bachelor's in economics, Statistics, Data, Data Science and Engineering (Masters is a plus) or equivalent experience.
Show more

About us

For more than 20 years, our global network of passionate technologists and pioneering craftspeople has delivered cutting-edge technology and game-changing consulting to companies on the brink of AI driven digital transformation. Since 2001, we have grown into a full service digital consulting company with 5500+ professionals working on a worldwide ambition. Driven by the desire to make a difference, we keep innovating. Fuelling the growth of our company with our knowledge worker culture. When teaming up with Xebia, expect in-depth expertise based on an authentic, value-led, and high quality way of working that inspires all we do.


About the Role

We are looking for a seasoned Analyst and Data Visualisation Expert to support the data science and analytics team focused on Direct To Consumer data products. The ideal candidate is a great storyteller and strong technical contributor who has experience solving business problems with data-driven tools. You will be responsible for delivering a suite of analytical products including analyses, dashboards, insights, and recommendations with especial focus on clickstream data. You will collect, analyze, and present data to improve strategic decision making and to track the benefits unlocked by the data products. You should have a high degree of curiosity about the business and the skills to discover impactful insights from data. You should be able to communicate those insights in a way that builds confidence and enables decisions that drive business value.


Responsibilities

  • Conduct analysis to estimate expected value of data products. Measure and track benefits created by data products, and convert them to financial or key KPI metrics
  • Support business stakeholders and regional data analysts by understanding their needs and providing guidance and support.
  • Create dashboards to track adoption and business impact of features and data product launched.
  • Dive deep into complex business problems and provide insights on digital features and AI model performance through hypothesis testing. Partner with cross functional teams on implementation.
  • Partner with data science, data analytics and product managers on planning, goal setting and prioritization.
  • Partner with data and engineering teams to improve instrumentation and product/models health reporting, pre/post analysis and business debugging.
  • Partner with A/B test team to design experiments and post-hoc analysis of results.
  • Bring data to life through storytelling in a clear and meaningful way to audiences with mixed levels of technical expertise and informing key strategic decisions.
  • Promote a culture of data driven technical excellence, ownership, collaboration.


Your background

  • 3+ years of professional experience analysing complex data, drawing conclusions, and making recommendations.
  • 3+ years of applied data visualization experience. Tableau and PowerBI as main visualization tools.
  • 3+ years of experience in extracting & manipulating large data sets from various relational databases using SQL (Amazon Redshift, Oracle, Google BigQuery).
  • Coding skills in at least one statistical or programming language (R or Python preferred) to import, summarise, and analyse data.
  • Hands on experience working with big data, ideally clickstream data, in big data volume sectors such as ecommerce, gaming, social network etc. e-commerce platforms are a plus.
  • Ability to translate and present complex analysis in executive summaries. Clear and effective written and verbal communication and strong interpersonal skills.
  • Strong problem solving skills.
  • Bachelor's in economics, Statistics, Data, Data Science and Engineering (Masters is a plus) or equivalent experience.

Title: Analista de Datos Junior - Power BI
Description:
¡En Grupo Oesía estamos creciendo! Nos gustaría contar contigo para nuestra siguiente oferta de empleo:

Estamos buscando un/a Analista de Datos Junior para incorporarse en un importante proyecto ubicado en Madrid en modalidad de trabajo presencial.

¿Qué buscamos?


Un/a Analista de Datos Junior con experiencia de un año en Power BI y conocimientos en bases de datos.
Haber finalizado, al menos, uno de los siguientes cursos: curso de Business Intelligence de fabricante Oracle, Microsoft o Pentaho, curso de especialista en gestión de bases de datos orientadas a aplicación de Business Intelligence, curso de Power Query, Power Map o Power View para transformación y preparación de datos en entornos Microsoft o un curso de Pentaho.
Disponibilidad para asistir de forma presencial a las oficinas situadas en Madrid centro.


Requisitos mínimos:


Título Universitario en Informática/Telecomunicaciones o Formación Profesional en la rama tecnológica.
Experiencia de al menos un año con Power BI y conocimiento de bases de datos (SQL).
Disponer de un curso de formación en Business Intelligence, Gestión de Bases de Datos o un curso de Power Query, Power Map o Power View.
Disponibilidad para trabajar en modalidad presencial en Madrid centro.


¿Cuáles serán tus funciones?


Diseño de infraestructuras robustas, escalables y distribuidas para manejo de grandes volúmenes de datos.
Desarrollo de soluciones personalizadas para el procesamiento de datos en lenguajes de programación como Python, R o Java.
Diseño, implementación y optimización de Bases de Datos SQL.
Desarrollo y mantenimiento de pipelines de datos utilizando herramientas ETL para el procesamiento y almacenamiento de Datos.
Desarrollo de paneles de visualización y análisis de datos, usando herramientas de visualización como Power BI.


¿Qué te ofrecemos? 


Trabajar en una multinacional reconocida como una de las mejores empresas para trabajar en 2024, según Actualidad Económica y Forbes.
Proyectos tecnológicos estables e innovadores para clientes punteros de ámbito nacional e internacional.
Plan de carrera: ofrecemos una atractiva carrera profesional en función de la experiencia y potencial personal dentro de una compañía en continua evolución y con un sólido crecimiento. 
Acceso gratuito a varias plataformas de formación para que tengas acceso a un amplio catálogo multidisciplinar. 
Retribución flexible.
Una compañía igualitaria, diversa y con gran Responsabilidad Social Corporativa.
Un ambiente laboral positivo, saludable y de cooperación. Trabajar en equipo es el pilar de los éxitos de los proyectos de la compañía.


¿Nos conoces?

Grupo Oesía es una multinacional española dedicada a la ingeniería digital e industrial de uso dual, que desarrolla e implementa proyectos en todo el mundo. Con más de 3.200 profesionales en 18 sedes corporativas repartidas entre España, Latinoamérica y Asia, genera empleo de calidad y ayuda a crecer a las personas en carreras técnicas.

Desde Grupo Oesía desarrollamos tecnologías y servicios con el compromiso de crear un futuro en el que la tecnología responda a los retos del planeta y sus habitantes, para crear un mundo mejor, más eficiente, seguro y sostenible.

A lo largo de casi 50 años de trayectoria, en Grupo Oesía estamos inmersos en la innovación de productos y servicios que benefician a millones de personas de todo el mundo en los ámbitos de la sanidad, la seguridad y la defensa, el espacio, las telecomunicaciones, las finanzas, la logística y el sector agroalimentario.

Title: Data Analyst - Power BI
Description:
En Claire Joster somos especialistas en la búsqueda y selección de Perfiles cualificados de Mando Intermedio y Management en el ámbito tecnológico para las principales áreas funcionales y técnicas, con un valor añadido fundamental: la captación de talento, basada en valores y ajuste cultural de nuestros clientes y candidatos.




Actualmente estamos buscando un perfil de Data Analyst para un partner tecnológico especializado en diseño y ejecución de soluciones tecnológicas en colaboración con importantes clientes, con dos pilares fundamentales: excelencia e innovación.




Requisitos:

Al menos 2 años de experiencia profesional como Analista de Datos.
Titulación en un campo cuantitativo (Informática, Ingeniería, Matemáticas, Física, etc…) o similar.
Capacidad de comunicación eficaz y capacidad para trabajar con otros departamentos.
Pensamiento lógico y resolutivo.
Dominio de SQL (SQL Server, Postgres).
Experiencia de trabajo con sistemas BI y herramientas de visualización.
2 años de experiencia en Power BI.
Usuario competente del paquete MS Office y usuario experto de Excel.




Se Ofrece:

Contrato indefinido y posibilidad de crecimiento.
Ubicación del cliente: Arturo Soria.
Modalidad Presencial.
Beneficios Sociales: Seguro médico.
