Title: Product Data Analyst
Description:
En Wetaca queremos convertirnos en un movimiento de gente que quiere vivir bien en todos los sentidos.




El ritmo de vida actual lleva a muchas personas a tener que elegir entre comer comer rico y comer sano o a priorizar la rapidez, dejando en un segundo plano la calidad y sabor de lo que comen en su día a día. Por eso en Wetaca cocinamos para que comer genial esté al alcance de todos y la comida sea un sinónimo de disfrute, bienestar y tranquilidad.




Somos la suscripción semanal de comida a domicilio líder del mercado y repartimos en toda la península. Cocinamos comida casera y real (con ingredientes naturales, sin aditivos ni conservantes y todo desde cero) para ofrecer menús variados y para todos los gustos, para que nuestros clientes coman bien y ganen tiempo para sí mismos. Nuestro objetivo es que confíen en nosotros y nos deleguen el preparar su comida, que sepan que We TAke CAre, que nosotros nos encargamos de todo.




Si eres una persona con hambre y buscas un sitio en el que crecer, tenemos una vacante para ti.




Buscamos un Product Data Analyst con 2-3 años de experiencia, capaz de entender las necesidades del producto digital y transformarlas en datos e insights accionables para mejorar la experiencia de nuestros usuarios. Formará parte del equipo de producto digital, desempeñando un rol clave en el análisis del comportamiento de los usuarios y la evaluación del impacto de nuevas funcionalidades, ayudándonos a descubrir oportunidades de negocio.




¿Qué harás?

Potencia la toma de decisiones en un equipo de producto digital.

Autonomía para plantear hipótesis e identificar qué información es clave para responder preguntas de negocio y producto.
Extraer y analizar datos directamente desde fuentes como SQL y Google Analytics con un enfoque técnico y proactivo.
Conocimientos en Python/R para procesamiento y análisis avanzado de datos.
Capacidad para procesar y estructurar consultas.
Detectar tendencias en datos históricos y proyectar futuros comportamientos para guiar la toma de decisiones.
Medir y validar hipótesis de experimentos y pruebas A/B.
Preparar informes para responder a preguntas clave utilizando herramientas como Looker, Power BI o similares.




En definitiva, colaborar de cerca con Producto, Diseño y IT para identificar oportunidades de crecimiento y mejorar la experiencia del usuario con datos.




¿Quién eres?

2-3 años de experiencia en un rol analítico, aportando insights accionables.
Formación o experiencia en disciplinas cuantitativas (Economía, Estadística, Matemáticas, Ingeniería, etc.).
Sólidos conocimientos de lenguajes de programación y herramientas de análisis y procesamiento de datos: SQL, Python, R.
Base en estadística y experimentación (A/B testing, cohort analysis, modelos de segmentación).
Habilidad para visualizar datos y comunicar insights de forma clara y accionable.
Mentalidad analítica y colaborativa, con ganas de trabajar codo a codo con Producto, Diseño y Tech.




¿Cómo estarás?

Trabajarás en un equipo donde los datos son clave para la estrategia, no un complemento.
Tendrás autonomía para explorar y proponer mejoras basadas en insights reales.
Ambiente colaborativo, con espacio para aprender y crecer en el mundo de producto digital.

Show more

  • Base en estadística y experimentación (A/B testing, cohort analysis, modelos de segmentación).
  • Habilidad para visualizar datos y comunicar insights de forma clara y accionable.
  • Mentalidad analítica y colaborativa, con ganas de trabajar codo a codo con Producto, Diseño y Tech.


¿Cómo estarás?

  • Trabajarás en un equipo donde los datos son clave para la estrategia, no un complemento.
  • Tendrás autonomía para explorar y proponer mejoras basadas en insights reales.
  • Ambiente colaborativo, con espacio para aprender y crecer en el mundo de producto digital.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Description & Requirements

Electronic Arts creates next-level entertainment experiences that inspire players and fans around the world. Here, everyone is part of the story. Part of a community that connects across the globe. A place where creativity thrives, new perspectives are invited, and ideas matter. A team where everyone makes play happen.

EA SPORTS is one of the leading sports entertainment brands in the world, with top-selling videogame franchises, award-winning interactive technology, fan programs, and cross-platform digital experiences. EA SPORTS creates connected experiences that ignite the emotion of sport through industry-leading sports video games, including EA SPORTS Madden NFL, FC, NHL, NBA LIVE, PGA TOUR and UFC.

There are millions of EA SPORTS players generating billions of events every day. We are using the high-volume data streams to detect and anticipate Security threats and issues as soon as they occur. The Game Security Data Analyst will be an essential EA SPORTS Security Team member. Reporting to the Development Director - Game Security, you will support the SOC lead and the Security Data Scientists by ensuring partners can receive and understand relevant information promptly to help keep our Sports games safe and secure.This is a hybrid role that is located in Madrid.

Responsibilities


Analyse data to support business decisions and security operations
Develop business intelligence and reporting solutions
Communicate findings, issues and trade-offs to team members
Adopt a security mindset to predict the adversary's moves and ensure the right Data is available to detect them.
Think and solve complex data problems in a maintainable and scalable fashion


Required Qualifications


2 years experience
Proficiency with SQL and no-SQL databases.
Knowledge and experience with data gathering, analysis, and visualization tools
Some knowledge and experience working with Python
Experience with data visualizations in tools such as Tableau, Power BI, Looker


About Electronic Arts

We’re proud to have an extensive portfolio of games and experiences, locations around the world, and opportunities across EA. We value adaptability, resilience, creativity, and curiosity. From leadership that brings out your potential, to creating space for learning and experimenting, we empower you to do great work and pursue opportunities for growth.

We take a holistic approach with our benefits program, focusing on physical, emotional, financial, career, and community wellness to support a balanced life with paid time off and new parent leave, plus free games and so much more. We nurture environments where our teams can always bring their best to what they do.

Electronic Arts is an equal opportunity employer. All employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, national origin, ancestry, sex, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, genetic information, religion, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, marital status, family status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We will also consider employment qualified applicants with criminal records in accordance with applicable law. EA also makes workplace accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities as required by applicable law.

Title: Analista de datos
Description:
Somos Métrica, una consultora de negocio, integración de sistemas, servicios y soluciones IT, comprometida con la Sociedad de la información y el desarrollo tecnológico.




Desde Métrica, estamos buscando un Data Scientist o Analista de Datos con al menos 2 años de experiencia para un proyecto de un importante cliente.




El candidato ideal deberá contar con los siguientes conocimientos:

Experiencia en análisis de datos y desarrollo de algoritmos que automaticen el procesamiento para mejorar predicciones.
Manejo de herramientas BI como Tableau, Power BI.
Lenguajes de programación y análisis como Python, R, Scala y SQL.
Deseables conocimientos en Snowflake.
Inglés medio deseable.

Title: Prácticas en Análisis de Datos y Power BI (Madrid) (12289)
Description:
Prácticas en Análisis de Datos y Power BI (Madrid)




Nuestro negocio de Redes de Electricidad España (UFD) está inmerso en un apasionante reto de transformación, que tiene como misión la digitalización y sensorización de nuestra red eléctrica para evolucionar de una red meramente física a una red virtual, donde el análisis de datos y la inteligencia artificial nos permitan gestionar y dar respuesta a todas las necesidades del nuevo ecosistema sostenible.




¡Queremos ser los mejores en lo que hacemos! Trabajando en equipo, haciendo más con menos y desarrollando a cada persona, para crecer juntos tanto en el ámbito de Redes Electricidad España como en el de otros negocios.




En este contexto ofrecemos una Beca en el negocio de Redes Electricidad España.




Estas prácticas te permitirán:

Participar en la elaboración de cuadros de mando en Power BI a partir de información de sistemas de UFD con el objetivo de disponer de KPIs que permitan hacer un seguimiento y análisis sobre el avance del proceso de control de calidad regulatoria.




Lo que necesitas:

Estudiante de último curso del grado en Ingeniería Industrial, Matemática, Física, Estadística o similares.
Conocimiento bases de datos
Conocimiento de PowerBI




Lo que ofrecemos:

Ayuda al estudio
Lugar de realización de las prácticas en Madrid, presencialmente en las oficinas de AV. de América 38




1) Rellena el formulario con tus datos. No olvides adjuntar tu CV actualizado.

2) Si te encuentras entre los perfiles más ajustados, contactaremos contigo para participar en las diferentes pruebas y entrevistas.

3) Si avanzas con éxito en el proceso………. ¡podrás formarte con el equipo Naturgy!

Title: Data Analyst & Reporting Specialist
Description:
Join Openbank, the 100% digital bank of the Santander Group, where innovation meets opportunity! With over 2 million customers across Spain, Germany, the Netherlands, Portugal, we're leading the way in digital banking. From loans and mortgages to a cutting-edge, fully automated investment platform, our products are transforming the industry.

At Openbank, we pride ourselves on simplicity, agility, and security, earning us the title of the most recommended Spanish bank among our customers. Technology is in our DNA and we are constantly developing new digital solutions and products. And we're not stopping there! At Openbank we are proud to be a bank that is gaining more and more international presence, we have just landed in the United States and Mexico.




If you're passionate about digital innovation, eager to make an impact, and ready to be part of a dynamic and forward-thinking company, then we want to hear from you! Join us and be part of our journey to redefine banking for the digital age!




Mission & Role:

In this role, you will be responsible for analyzing and extracting insights from large datasets from various sources in our AWS Datalake, to solve complex business problems. You will work closely with data engineers to implement scalable solutions and ensure that the data you work with is clean and reliable. You will be expected to create actionable results through statistical analysis, data visualization, and software development, enabling decision-making across different teams. You will also play a key role in supporting the team’s efforts to use data more effectively and to automate key business processes.




You will work in a transparent environment where knowledge-sharing and open communication are encouraged. As a team player, you’ll engage with others to reach common goals, making sure to balance both the big picture and fine details.




You will apply your knowledge of statistical analysis and experience with tools like Python or Spark to implement solutions and provide clear insights. Additionally, you will help design and produce efficient data pipelines, contributing to the success of the team and its projects.




To be successful in the role you must bring:

At least +3 years of experience in Statistical Analysis: Strong knowledge of basic statistical concepts and the ability to implement them in programming languages such as Python or Spark. You know when to use different statistical indicators and have experience summarizing insights from data.
Experience with Large Datasets: Familiarity with working on large datasets and implementing scalable solutions. You understand data cleaning, and you know how to collaborate effectively with data engineers.
Problem-Solving with Data: Ability to break down complex problems into manageable analytical components and reuse existing solutions from previous projects.
Software Development Knowledge: Understanding of software development practices, including using Git, writing and testing your code, and leveraging it to produce meaningful results. If you're an open-source enthusiast, we'd love to see your GitHub contributions!
Proficiency in Data Visualization: Experience with tools like ggplot, matplotlib, Tableau, or similar. Bonus points for experience with Microstrategy or QuickSight.
SQL Expertise: You are an SQL ninja, and writing both exploratory and efficient queries is second nature to you.
STEM Background: A degree in a STEM field (Science, Technology, Engineering, or Mathematics) is highly desired due to the strong software development component of the role.
Emotional resilience: You can give and take criticism well. You don’t get defensive when your ideas are challenged, and you’re polite enough to challenge others’ ideas when necessary.
Confidence without arrogance: You are confident but not arrogant. You ask for help when needed and openly admit when you don’t know something. You value and celebrate the contributions of others.
Exceptional communication skills: You explain your ideas clearly and succinctly, ask for input, and listen carefully. You build on the ideas of others, and your presentations are impactful without being overwhelming.
Transparency: You value transparency, always willing to share your knowledge and ideas with the team.
Team collaboration: You are a strong team player, supporting and collaborating with others to achieve common goals.




What do we offer?

Joining a dynamic and agile company undergoing international expansion.
Working in start-up mode with the support of the Santander Group.
Competitive remuneration and attractive benefits package.
Possibility of growth within the company and the Group.
Collaborating on international projects in different countries.
Excellent work environment, social clubs and frequent events.




Would you like to grow with us? Join our team!

Show more

  • Competitive remuneration and attractive benefits package.
  • Possibility of growth within the company and the Group.
  • Collaborating on international projects in different countries.
  • Excellent work environment, social clubs and frequent events.


Would you like to grow with us? Join our team!

Title: Data Analyst Trainee
Description:
Ecolab Company has an opening for an Data Analyst Trainee in our Procurement Analytics and Digital Solutions (ADS) team located in Barcelona, Spain. If you are a passionate professional that is seeking opportunity, advancement, and a rewarding learning chance and career we invite you to apply. This is a fantastic opportunity to join a highly recognized global growth company offering competitive compensation and benefits in addition to career growth.

Job Overview

As a part of the Data Operations team in the Global Supply Chain Analytics and Digital Solutions group you will be responsible for continuous improvements in digital capabilities and advanced analytics. You will lead the development of new digital products providing critical insights that help solve business challenges. The successful candidate will lead efforts to improve the chemical data understanding across the organization through improved process, governance, and data management.

Candidates must display a passion for systems, data, operational reporting & advanced analytics. The strong performer can expect further career advancement opportunities with Ecolab and will have the chance to move into other roles within Procurement or the organization, with increasing leadership opportunities. This is an exciting opportunity to advance your career with a stable growing company!

Main Responsibilities


Serve as a liaison among stakeholders to analyze, document, and validate requirements for reporting and changes to business processes
Develop and maintain data products
Develop, test, and operationalize new standardized reporting
Develop and maintain business intelligence dashboards
Lead automation of processes and analyses
Train other teams in systems, tools, and processes owned by ADS
Proactively make recommendations and identify opportunities to solve business problems through new business intelligence reporting
Interface with IT to specify and implement improvements to our data pipelines


Basic Qualifications


Masters in Data Science or Statistics or Computer Science or equivalent advance degree.
Interest in an Artificial Intelligence (AI) and business intelligence (BI) role
Experience with AI and BI data modeling and presenting insights to key stakeholders.
Exceptional analytical and problem-solving abilities.
Proficient in Python, PySpark, SQL, Azure AI, Tenserflow, Streamlit, Flask, Power Apps, Power BI, Snowflake, Azure SQL Database.
Intermediate SQL skills, or willingness to learn.
Fluent English
Full-time availability.
To be eligible for the Traineeship contract you must have completed your bachelor's or master's degree studies.
Work permit in Barcelona.


Preferred Qualifications


Experience designing and building standard reports and dashboards
History of managing and delivering projects, tasks, and initiatives
Ability to create, implement, document, and continuously improve processes in a changing environment
Training or experience in data science areas such as time series analysis, forecasting, classification, and regression analysis
Experience with data analytics tools such as Python, R, SPSS, MATLAB, Stata, and SAS
Experience working with global cross-functional teams and demonstrated ability to work well with people from different disciplines with varying degrees of technical expertise
Microsoft PowerBI experience
Project management experience
Experience in the petrochemical industry a plus
Enrolled in or recently completed degree with emphasis in Chemistry, Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Information Technology, or Engineering preferred


Ecolab’s commitment to diversity, equity and inclusion (DE&I) reflects our longstanding value of working together to integrate diverse perspectives to challenge ourselves, reach our goals and do what’s right. Disability certificate will be an asset.

Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

Ecolab is committed to fair and equal treatment of associates and applicants and furthering the principles of Equal Opportunity to Employment. Our goal is to fully utilize minority, female, and disabled individuals at all levels of the workforce. We will recruit, hire, promote, transfer and provide opportunities for advancement based on individual qualifications and job performance. In all matters affecting employment, compensation, benefits, working conditions, and opportunities for advancement, Ecolab will not discriminate against any associate or applicant for employment because of race, religion, color, creed, national origin, citizenship status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and expressions, genetic information, marital status, age, or disability.

Title: Analista Funcional Regulatorio
Description:
En OPTIMISSA tenemos claro que el éxito de nuestros proyectos se debe a las personas que forman nuestro equipo. Por eso, si tienes al menos 2 años de experiencia como Analista Funcional nos comprometemos a impulsar tu talento, satisfacer tus expectativas laborales y hacerte sentir como en casa. ¿Quieres construir hoy el mundo de mañana? ¡Sigue leyendo!




¿Qué buscamos?

Interesados/as en posición híbrida en Madrid.
Parametrización y actualización en BBDD de herramienta de reporting regulatorio (SQL y Oracle) de validaciones publicadas por los diferentes Reguladores.
Testeo y certificación de los cambios en los diferentes entornos.
Reporting de EEFF de Sucursales Extranjeras, Entidades de Pago y de Dinero electrónico.
Resolución de incidencias de clientes y usuarios.




¿Qué podemos ofrecerte?

Formar parte de una gran empresa competitiva y en continuo crecimiento.
Integración en un equipo de profesionales altamente cualificado, con un buen clima laboral, innovador y dinámico.
Formación especializada y desarrollo profesional continuo.
Beneficios sociales y plan de compensación flexible.
Retribución competitiva.
Modalidad híbrida en Madrid.




Si crees que eres talento, ¡apúntate!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

Who We Are

Cint is a pioneer in research technology (ResTech). Our customers use the Cint platform to post questions and get answers from real people to build business strategies, confidently publish research, accurately measure the impact of digital advertising, and more. The Cint platform is built on a programmatic marketplace, which is the world’s largest, with nearly 300 million respondents in over 150 countries who consent to sharing their opinions, motivations, and behaviours.

We are feeding the world’s curiosity!

Job Description

We are looking for a Data Analyst to support our Data Science & Analytics team in delivering high-quality insights through data exploration, analysis, and reporting. The ideal candidate is a self-starter, comfortable working with large datasets, automating processes, and supporting internal stakeholders with data-driven recommendations.

Responsibilities


Analyze large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and insights, ensuring quality and reliability of results.
Respond to ad hoc client-specific requests including performing analyses, data manipulation and producing summary results.
Generate reports and visualizations to effectively communicate findings to stakeholders to support decision making
Support campaign performance analysis and contribute to benchmark development and optimization.
Design scripts and tools to automate and streamline data extraction processes using Python, SQL, and APIs.
Develop interactive dashboards and reporting tools (such as Power BI, Tableau, Streamlit) to provide a clear overview of key metrics and insights.
Collaborate with stakeholders to enhance data collection processes.


Qualifications

Required:


Master’s degree or Bachelors in a quantitative field (e.g., Data Analytics, Statistics, Mathematics or a related discipline).
1-2 year(s) of experience in a data analysis role, preferably in market research, or advertising analytics.
Proficiency in Python (especially pandas and NumPy) for data manipulation.
Strong experience with MS Excel for analysis and reporting.
Experience working with large datasets and performing complex data transformations.
Strong analytical skills with a focus on data validation and accuracy.
Excellent communication skills to present findings and collaborate with internal teams and customers.
Self-starter with ability to work independently.


Additional Information

Nice to Have:


Experience in media measurement analytics.
Ability to write and optimize SQL queries.
Familiarity with Streamlit, Power BI, or Tableau for dashboarding.
Understanding of Databricks or similar cloud-based analytics platforms.


Our Values

Collaboration is our superpower


We uncover rich perspectives across the world
Success happens together
We deliver across borders.


Innovation is in our blood


We’re pioneers in our industry
Our curiosity is insatiable
We bring the best ideas to life.


We Do What We Say


We’re accountable for our work and actions
Excellence comes as standard
We’re open, honest and kind, always.


We are caring


We learn from each other’s experiences
Stop and listen; every opinion matters
We embrace diversity, equity and inclusion.


More About Cint

In June 2021, Cint acquired Berlin-based GapFish – the world’s largest ISO certified online panel community in the DACH region – and in January 2022, completed the acquisition of US-based Lucid – a programmatic research technology platform that provides access to first-party survey data in over 110 countries.

Cint Group AB (publ), listed on Nasdaq Stockholm, this growth has made Cint a strong global platform with teams across its many global offices, including Stockholm, London, New York, New Orleans, Singapore, Tokyo and Sydney. (www.cint.com)


Show more
HTML:
Company Description

Who We Are

Cint is a pioneer in research technology (ResTech). Our customers use the Cint platform to post questions and get answers from real people to build business strategies, confidently publish research, accurately measure the impact of digital advertising, and more. The Cint platform is built on a programmatic marketplace, which is the world’s largest, with nearly 300 million respondents in over 150 countries who consent to sharing their opinions, motivations, and behaviours.

We are feeding the world’s curiosity!

Job Description

We are looking for a Data Analyst to support our Data Science & Analytics team in delivering high-quality insights through data exploration, analysis, and reporting. The ideal candidate is a self-starter, comfortable working with large datasets, automating processes, and supporting internal stakeholders with data-driven recommendations.

Responsibilities

  • Analyze large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and insights, ensuring quality and reliability of results.
  • Respond to ad hoc client-specific requests including performing analyses, data manipulation and producing summary results.
  • Generate reports and visualizations to effectively communicate findings to stakeholders to support decision making
  • Support campaign performance analysis and contribute to benchmark development and optimization.
  • Design scripts and tools to automate and streamline data extraction processes using Python, SQL, and APIs.
  • Develop interactive dashboards and reporting tools (such as Power BI, Tableau, Streamlit) to provide a clear overview of key metrics and insights.
  • Collaborate with stakeholders to enhance data collection processes.

Qualifications

Required:

  • Master’s degree or Bachelors in a quantitative field (e.g., Data Analytics, Statistics, Mathematics or a related discipline).
  • 1-2 year(s) of experience in a data analysis role, preferably in market research, or advertising analytics.
  • Proficiency in Python (especially pandas and NumPy) for data manipulation.
  • Strong experience with MS Excel for analysis and reporting.
  • Experience working with large datasets and performing complex data transformations.
  • Strong analytical skills with a focus on data validation and accuracy.
  • Excellent communication skills to present findings and collaborate with internal teams and customers.
  • Self-starter with ability to work independently.

Additional Information

Nice to Have:

  • Experience in media measurement analytics.
  • Ability to write and optimize SQL queries.
  • Familiarity with Streamlit, Power BI, or Tableau for dashboarding.
  • Understanding of Databricks or similar cloud-based analytics platforms.

Our Values

Collaboration is our superpower

  • We uncover rich perspectives across the world
  • Success happens together
  • We deliver across borders.

Innovation is in our blood

  • We’re pioneers in our industry
  • Our curiosity is insatiable
  • We bring the best ideas to life.

We Do What We Say

  • We’re accountable for our work and actions
  • Excellence comes as standard
  • We’re open, honest and kind, always.

We are caring

  • We learn from each other’s experiences
  • Stop and listen; every opinion matters
  • We embrace diversity, equity and inclusion.

More About Cint

In June 2021, Cint acquired Berlin-based GapFish – the world’s largest ISO certified online panel community in the DACH region – and in January 2022, completed the acquisition of US-based Lucid – a programmatic research technology platform that provides access to first-party survey data in over 110 countries.

Cint Group AB (publ), listed on Nasdaq Stockholm, this growth has made Cint a strong global platform with teams across its many global offices, including Stockholm, London, New York, New Orleans, Singapore, Tokyo and Sydney. (www.cint.com)

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We are looking for a skilled and motivated Data Analyst to join our team. This role offers a dynamic environment where you will have the opportunity to work on diverse data analysis tasks, collaborate with international colleagues, and develop your skills within a growing organization.




ABOUT THE JOB

We are looking for a skilled and motivated Data Analyst to join our team. This role offers a dynamic environment where you will have the opportunity to work on diverse data analysis tasks, collaborate with international colleagues, and develop your skills within a growing organization




WHAT ARE YOU GOING TO DO AS A DATA ANALYST?

Collaborate daily with colleagues in Poland

Conduct both on-demand and scheduled data analyses

Create and maintain comprehensive reports

Organize and structure file systems effectively

Manage databases efficiently

Oversee internal and external data exchange processes

WHAT DO YOU BRING AS A DATA ANALYST?

Proficiency in Microsoft Excel with Power Add-ons

English language proficiency

Microsoft Access

Database management experience

University degree or ongoing studies in Mathematics, Business Analytics, Econometrics, or a related field

Travel Requirement: Visits to Poland at least four times a year (one week per visit)




ABOUT THE TEAM

If you are passionate about data, enjoy working in a collaborative environment, and seek opportunities for professional growth, we would love to hear from you!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Capitole Consulting is growing, and we want you to be part of it!

We are looking for a Tableau Data Analyst




Requirements:

Experience Level: minimum 2 years in an analytical role and proficiency in English.




Technical Skills:

Tableau proficiency: experience in creating dashboards and visualizations, including advanced features like calculated fields, parameters, and actions.
Strong SQL skills: ability to query, manage, and analyze large datasets.
Solid understanding of data structures, relational databases, and ETL processes.
Experience with scripting languages such as Python or R (a plus).
Excellent communication and collaboration skills.




Daily Responsibilities:

Use SQL to query databases, extract and prepare clean datasets for analysis and reporting.
Update and enhance Tableau dashboards to ensure accuracy, functionality, and relevance for stakeholders.
Generate and distribute automated reports, perform ad-hoc analyses, and provide data-driven insights to support business decisions.
Validate data accuracy in dashboards and reports, troubleshoot issues, and ensure reliability across all outputs.
Collaborate with teams to understand their data needs, provide insights, and deliver actionable recommendations.
Continuously refine SQL queries, Tableau workflows, and reporting processes while staying up to date with industry best practices and new tools.




Why Join Us?

We are amazing, but with you, we’ll be even better! 😊

Benefits:

€1,200 training budget to use on tech events, books, certifications, or courses of your choice.
Monthly team check-ins for continuous feedback.
Flexible working hours to balance your professional and personal life.
Private health insurance, fully covered by Capitole.
Flexible compensation options (meal vouchers, transport, daycare).
Andjoy (Gymforless) membership.
Exclusive employee discounts at top brands through Club Capitole.

Team Culture & Social Perks:

Team buildings every two months – don’t miss our Summer Party or Christmas Dinner!
Capitole-sponsored football team.
Tech communities to share knowledge and ideas across teams – internal knowledge sharing is key! 😃

Want to know more about us?

🌐 Check us out: https://capitole-consulting.com/ ⭐ See what employees say: Glassdoor Reviews

Don’t hesitate to send us your profile – we’re excited to meet you! 🚀

Title: Business Intelligence Data Analyst
Description:
GROUP BNP PARIBAS

BNP Paribas Group is the top bank in the European Union and a major international banking establishment. It has close to 185,000 employees in 65 countries. In Spain we are more than 5,100 employees within 13 business lines.




Spain IT Production




Spain IT Production organization consists of CIB ITO & ITG IT Platforms and is responsible for providing IT Production services to our Clients in EMEA, ensuring a Digital Market evolution, in a secured and performant environment, and with a reliable quality. IT Production organisation includes Infrastructure services, Telecom & Workspace, Production Security and Application Production domains and associated transversal services (CTO Office, Control Tower, PMO and IT Continuity). In Spain, IT Production relies on a Platform with over 400 experts that provide full-stack support services ensuring a secure, stable, standardized, and efficient production.




ABOUT THE JOB




MISSION




For the Security Dashboard activities, we are looking for Data Security & Business Intelligence Engineer to support and coordinate the deployment of the Security Dashboard within the security productions of the BNPPARIBAS group




RESPONSIBILITIES




· Needs analysis for evolution of the current BI solution

· Provision of solutions in accordance with the company’s strategy based on (Cyber security Group requirements

· Coordinate the redesign and Dashboard transformation

· Deploy the solution within the group’s ProdSec entities of the group

· Ensure comitology with stakeholders (Technical Experts, Functional Experts, Product Owner, and customers.)

· Report to the manager and Team lead on the achievements progress.

· Ensuring the updating of the documentary heritage corpus




REQUIREMENTS




Studies




Bachelor’s in computer science or equivalent




Experience




Minimum 5 to 10 years of experience in cybersecurity and production environments




Languages




Fluent English written and spoken. Strong written, oral, and interpersonal communications skills.

French speaking is a plus.




SKILLS




Technical




o PowerBI, SQL, MS SSIS/ SSAS/ SSRS

o Python, PHP/ Symfony

o Systems: architecture, security, etc. to support monitoring and steering actions- définition, production et mise en place de KPI de pilotage et de suivi

o The methodology for monitoring Cybersecurity Control Projects;

o Vulnerability & Patch Management

o Qualys, Tanium is plus




Transversal & Behavioral




o Strong situational analysis and needs identification.

o Proposal force for the most relevant solutions

o Ability to collaborate with different types of profiles. Technical, Functional, Project Leadership. Team leader, etc.

o Ability to share and transmit.

o Rigor, organization and method with a spirit of analysis and synthesis

o Customer orientation: listening, support and understanding of needs.

o Transverse vision to anticipate data correlations / Impacts.

o Good Cyber Security Culture.




BENEFITS

• Training programs, career plans and internal mobility opportunities, national and international thanks to our presence in different countries.

• Diversity and Inclusion Committee that ensures an inclusive work environment. In recent years, several employee communities have been created to organize diversity and inclusion awareness actions (PRIDE, We Generations and MixCity).

• Corporate volunteering program (1 Million Hours 2 Help) in which employees can dedicate time out of their working hours to volunteer activities.

• Flexible compensation plan.

• Hybrid telecommuting model (50%).

• 31 vacation days.







Diversity and inclusion commitment

BNP Paribas Group in Spain is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
About ExoClick:




ExoClick is an innovative and global ad company serving 20 billion daily geo-targeted ads to web and mobile advertisers & publishers. We are part of EXOGROUP, a set of companies made up of +200 talents and offering a wide range of services within the digital business landscape with headquarters in Barcelona and offices in Dublin, Porto, Valencia, Tarragona, and Buenos Aires.




Role




As a Junior Data Analyst you will be part of the Analytics team at EXOGROUP, which is a highly skilled and qualified department that has diverse responsibilities.




Together with the Director of Analytics & Data Science and the Analytics team you will develop and maintain data reports that provide critical business visibility on key revenue and profit trends, by product, market, vertical and traffic sources. Additionally, you will collaborate with IT and Product teams to identify potential improvements in the platform by analysing and designing algorithms.




Tasks




Structure masses of information, identify data-driven trends and understand what really matters and why.
Collect KPIs and design/define visualizations.
Deliver insights and analytics across the company's operation and advertising departments.
Ability to identify and escalate issues and opportunities ahead of time helping to reduce impact and improve financial / performance implications.
Develop and maintain different internal applications and dashboards.
Together with the Analytics team, you will develop and promote actionable insights to increase the profitability of the company.




Skills




You thrive on data and have a highly analytical mind.
Degree in computer science or mathematical sciences.
Managing and prioritising workload, taking ownership of all assigned tasks.
You feel comfortable retrieving, cleaning, tidying and processing data from different sources and formats. You have a general understanding of how web applications work.
You have programming experience in Python.
You are familiar with SQL and Git.
Experience with advanced statistical methodology, data and datasets is a plus.
Strong verbal and written communication skills.
The desire and agility to work in a fast-paced and ever evolving environment.
You thrive on data and have a highly analytical mind.
Degree in computer science or mathematical sciences.
Managing and prioritising workload, taking ownership of all assigned tasks.
You feel comfortable retrieving, cleaning, tidying and processing data from different sources and formats. You have a general understanding of how web applications work.
You have programming experience in Python.
You are familiar with SQL and Git.
Experience with advanced statistical methodology, data and datasets is a plus.
Strong verbal and written communication skills.
The desire and agility to work in a fast-paced and ever evolving environment.




What you'll find working at ExoClick:




We offer a position in a young, dynamic and international team with exceptional working conditions in unique offices high up in the Torre Mapfre, one of Barcelona's world-renowned landmarks, located right on the city's seafront.

Additionally, we offer the opportunity for permanent training, personal development, ambitious career growth, and a competitive salary.




Most of all, we offer a position in a team that thrives on achievement, success, and leadership within our industry. Our core company value is innovation: where people and creativity drive innovative technology. If you have an innovative, winning mentality, this position is for you!




Our company benefits:




Flexitime and summer schedule;
Private health insurance;
Your Birthday off as a paid holiday;
Flexible compensation plan: travel, meals & childcare;
Additional internal and external training through our EXOGROUP University program;
English, Portuguese & Spanish classes;
training budget & study leave;
Employee referral program bonus - You can earn 2500Eur by referring someone!
Exciting team buildings in locations such as Ibiza;
Office games room/chill-out zone;
Organic fruit;
Wednesday team breakfast;
Yoga classes;
Massages;
Subsidized catering;
Flexible remote work;
Home office set up budget of 500 Eur;




Is this not the right role for you? Then make sure to check out all other roles we have open for you on our careers website.




The companies that are part of EXOGROUP are the data controllers regarding your personal data, in order to consider your application for present or future vacancies in our organization. For more information about the processing of your personal data and on how to exercise your rights of access, rectification, suppression, limitation, portability and opposition please visit the Protection Informative Clause Candidates.

Title: Junior Data Analyst – Power Platform
Description:
🚀¿Te interesa el mundo del dato, la automatización y las herramientas low-code? ¡Tenemos una gran oportunidad para ti!.




Desde Adecco, nos encontramos en la búsqueda de un perfil Junior Data Analyst con foco en Power Platform para incorporar en un entorno internacional, innovador y con proyectos punteros de visualización y automatización.




🎁 ¿Qué se ofrece?




💼 Contratación directa e indefinida por cliente final.

🏢Modelo híbrido.

📍Ubicación en Málaga.

🌍 Entorno internacional, dinámico y en crecimiento.




💡 ¿Qué harás en este rol?




🔹 Participarás en la automatización de procesos y recogida de requisitos de negocio.

🔹 Desarrollarás dashboards, KPIs y modelos de datos (estrella, copo de nieve).

🔹 Crearás flujos en Power Automate y aplicaciones con Power Apps.

🔹 Modelarás y transformarás datos para facilitar su explotación en Power BI.

🔹 Colaborarás en la definición de roles de acceso y seguridad en visualizaciones.




🎯 Requisitos clave:




✅ Grado o titulación técnica relacionada con Tecnología o Informática.

✅ Conocimiento en Power BI, Power Apps y Power Automate.

✅ Experiencia (académica o práctica) con modelos de datos relacionales.

✅ Metodologías Agile (Jira, Confluence, DevOps).

✅ Español fluido (C1) e inglés intermedio (B2).




🌟 Será un plus si cuentas con:




🔹 Conocimientos en Location Intelligence, Data Governance y visualización avanzada (D3.js, JS).

🔹 Experiencia en pipelines CI/CD (Jenkins) y gestión de calidad del dato.




Si cumples con los requisitos y quieres un nuevo reto, ¡inscríbete ahora! 📩

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About us

For more than 20 years, our global network of passionate technologists and pioneering craftspeople has delivered cutting-edge technology and game-changing consulting to companies on the brink of AI driven digital transformation. Since 2001, we have grown into a full service digital consulting company with 5500+ professionals working on a worldwide ambition. Driven by the desire to make a difference, we keep innovating. Fuelling the growth of our company with our knowledge worker culture. When teaming up with Xebia, expect in-depth expertise based on an authentic, value-led, and high quality way of working that inspires all we do.




About the Role

We are looking for a seasoned Analyst and Data Visualisation Expert to support the data science and analytics team focused on Direct To Consumer data products. The ideal candidate is a great storyteller and strong technical contributor who has experience solving business problems with data-driven tools. You will be responsible for delivering a suite of analytical products including analyses, dashboards, insights, and recommendations with especial focus on clickstream data. You will collect, analyze, and present data to improve strategic decision making and to track the benefits unlocked by the data products. You should have a high degree of curiosity about the business and the skills to discover impactful insights from data. You should be able to communicate those insights in a way that builds confidence and enables decisions that drive business value.




Responsibilities

Conduct analysis to estimate expected value of data products. Measure and track benefits created by data products, and convert them to financial or key KPI metrics
Support business stakeholders and regional data analysts by understanding their needs and providing guidance and support.
Create dashboards to track adoption and business impact of features and data product launched.
Dive deep into complex business problems and provide insights on digital features and AI model performance through hypothesis testing. Partner with cross functional teams on implementation.
Partner with data science, data analytics and product managers on planning, goal setting and prioritization.
Partner with data and engineering teams to improve instrumentation and product/models health reporting, pre/post analysis and business debugging.
Partner with A/B test team to design experiments and post-hoc analysis of results.
Bring data to life through storytelling in a clear and meaningful way to audiences with mixed levels of technical expertise and informing key strategic decisions.
Promote a culture of data driven technical excellence, ownership, collaboration.




Your background

3+ years of professional experience analysing complex data, drawing conclusions, and making recommendations.
3+ years of applied data visualization experience. Tableau and PowerBI as main visualization tools.
3+ years of experience in extracting & manipulating large data sets from various relational databases using SQL (Amazon Redshift, Oracle, Google BigQuery).
Coding skills in at least one statistical or programming language (R or Python preferred) to import, summarise, and analyse data.
Hands on experience working with big data, ideally clickstream data, in big data volume sectors such as ecommerce, gaming, social network etc. e-commerce platforms are a plus.
Ability to translate and present complex analysis in executive summaries. Clear and effective written and verbal communication and strong interpersonal skills.
Strong problem solving skills.
Bachelor's in economics, Statistics, Data, Data Science and Engineering (Masters is a plus) or equivalent experience.
Show more

For more than 20 years, our global network of passionate technologists and pioneering craftspeople has delivered cutting-edge technology and game-changing consulting to companies on the brink of AI driven digital transformation.   • Conduct analysis to estimate expected value of data products. Measure and track benefits created by data products, and convert them to financial or key KPI metrics
  • Support business stakeholders and regional data analysts by understanding their needs and providing guidance and support.

  • Bring data to life through storytelling in a clear and meaningful way to audiences with mixed levels of technical expertise and informing key strategic decisions.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Join Extia, where people come first! Since 2007, we’ve combined performance with well-being at work — and it shows: #1 Great Place to Work® in France (2024-25) and among the Best Workplaces in Europe for 7 years running..




At Extia, it’s “First who, then what.” So, let’s move forward together!




Estamos en búsqueda de un/a Data Analyst para colaborar en un proyecto de desarrollo de dashboards de calidad de servicio (QoS), enfocados en el seguimiento del rendimiento de aplicaciones, eventos de logs y KPIs de negocio.

El objetivo del puesto es transformar datos en insights accionables mediante el uso de herramientas avanzadas de visualización, modelado y análisis.




📍 Ubicación: Madrid

📅 Incorporación: Inmediata




Responsabilidades:

1. Recogida de necesidades & Coordinación

Entender las necesidades funcionales del negocio.
Colaborar con equipos técnicos (integración de datos y Data Lake) para asegurar la correcta disponibilidad de los datos.




2. Análisis & Visualización

Modelado y transformación de datos con Power BI y DAX.
Diseño y mantenimiento de dashboards interactivos e intuitivos.
Aplicación de cálculos, filtros y reglas de negocio según los requisitos funcionales.




3. Entregables esperados

Modelos de datos claros y estructurados para facilitar el análisis.
Dashboards de Power BI conectados a cubos de datos en Azure Analysis Services.
Documentación funcional y técnica de los análisis realizados.




Perfil buscado:

Experiencia mínima: 2 años como Data Analyst o en un rol similar.

Herramientas requeridas:

Dominio de Power BI y DAX.
Conocimiento práctico de Azure Analysis Services y nociones de Databricks son altamente valoradas.
Capacidad analítica, atención al detalle y orientación a resultados.
Se valoran perfiles intermedios, avanzados o expertos.




¿Qué ofrecemos?

Proyecto con fuerte componente de análisis de datos y visualización.
Uso de tecnologías modernas y trabajo con grandes volúmenes de datos.
Colaboración en un entorno dinámico con enfoque en la mejora continua.




¿Te interesa?

Envíanos tu CV directamente a través de LinkedIn.

Title: Data Analyst BI
Description:
Country: Portugal

Formação Base: Licenciatura em Engenharia Informática, Matemática Aplicada e Computação ou formação equiparada

Competências Requeridas:


Sólidos conhecimentos em exploração e tratamento de dados (ORACLE SQL e PL\SQL, SAS Guide, etc)
Experiência na limpeza e estruturação de dados provenientes de várias fontes, nomeadamente origens não estruturadas
Familiaridade com construção de representações gráficas de dados, através de estatística descritiva e correlações
Preparação de dados para visualização e divulgação a outras áreas da empresa
Criatividade e espírito crítico na busca, interpretação e transformação de dados para utilizações não triviais


Competências Valorizadas:


Experiência académica ou profissional em análises multivariadas, inferência estatística, testes de hipóteses, redução de dimensionalidade, etc
Experiência em ferramentas de visualização de dados, tais como Power BI


Se possuis estes conhecimentos e competências, então esta oportunidade é para ti!

No Santander cada um de nós é “Risk Pro”. Isto significa ter a responsabilidade pessoal de identificar, avaliar, gerir e reportar eventuais riscos para o banco decorrentes do desempenho das nossas funções.

Vamos dar-lhe o conhecimento e as ferramentas para ser Risk Pro em todas as situações. Esta cultura de riscos é fundamental para o Santander Way, a nossa forma de trabalhar.

O Banco dispõe, nos termos do previsto na Lei nº 93/2021 de 20 de dezembro, de um canal de denúncias – Canal Aberto, acessível através do link https://secure.ethicspoint.eu/domain/media/pteu/gui/105862/index.html
Show more

Title: Analista de Dados Reporting e Tranformação
Description:
Muito Gosto! Somos o Grupo DATA!

O nosso propósito é simplificar a vida dos nossos clientes e fazemos isso em todo o mundo, através das nossas soluções de TI.

Somos uma multinacional, que opera ativamente em Portugal, e estamos em constante expansão!

Adoramos trabalhar com grandes empresas e fazer crescer as empresas com as quais colaboramos.

Comprometemo-nos a ser a mudança que queremos ver nas grandes corporações do mercado, começando por valorizar as pessoas e as suas ideias.

Já percebemos que não existe apenas uma maneira de fazer as coisas funcionarem, que cada um dos nossos colaboradores tem características únicas e que, para trabalhar em equipa, precisamos realmente de nos conhecer.

Quem procuramos?

Principais Tarefas a Desenvolver


Acompanhar e monitorizar a performance de operações, de forma a assegurar a qualidade do serviço prestado end-to-end.
Recolher e sistematizar dados operacionais das diferentes áreas da DGR, elaborando relatórios para diferentes intervenientes (i.e. controlo interno, clientes, fornecedores, etc.)
Desenvolver e implementar procedimentos para auditorias aleatórias e regulares das intervenções no terreno, incluindo atividades como a preparação de checklists de auditoria, a programação de auditorias e a análise inicial dos resultados.
Identificar os equipamentos xTM que não cumprem os requisitos mínimos de rede
Acompanhar o estado atual do hardware dos componentes e terminais, identificando falhas ou necessidades de atualizações para garantir a operacionalidade
Gerir o funcionamento da rede xTM, i.e, atualização na rede das últimas versões de software autorizadas para xTM, e controlo e verificação de BIOS, bitlockers, templates, lista de fallbacks e IMs ativos
Auxiliar na análise das funcionalidades críticas dos sistemas de suporte à operação, contribuindo com insights para garantir a escalabilidade e flexibilidade
Identificar, criar e acompanhar as evoluções (EVs) junto das equipas de desenvolvimento.


Competências e Conhecimentos Técnicos Obrigatórios


Domínio de ferramentas Microsoft Office (preferencialmente Access e Excel)
Capacidade de comunicação oral e escrita e domínio da língua Inglesa;
Conhecimentos de POWER BI.


Competências e Conhecimentos Técnicos Desejáveis


Análise Crítica: capacidade de identificar e questionar a precisão e relevância das informações observadas, sendo capaz de identificar tendências, padrões e anomalias
Capacidade Analítica: capacidade de analisar as relações entre as diferentes partes de uma situação, estabelecendo ligações causais, nomeadamente ao nível dos sistemas de suporte à operação
Conhecimento Técnico: deve ter profundo conhecimento das especificações, funcionamento e requisitos técnicos dos sistemas de xTM. bem como do negócio da DGR
Domínio de Sistemas: capacidade de utilizar e profundo conhecimento das ferramentas que suportam a gestão e análise de dados, nomeadamente Excel e Access e Power BI
Resolução de Problemas: capacidade de gerir incidentes de forma totalmente autónoma considerando todas as informações e agindo de forma adequada face aos incidentes identificados
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Req Number: 88940

Time Type: Full Time

PLEASE REMEMBER TO CLICK "APPLY" BUTTON AFTER SAVING YOUR PROFILE TO COMPLETE YOUR APPLICATION PROCESS.

Your responsibilities:



Perform in-depth data profiling and analysis to uncover patterns, anomalies, and inconsistencies in data.
Collaborate with data engineers, data scientists, and business analysts to define data requirements and ensure data quality.
Develop and execute data validation and verification processes to document and improve data integrity and quality.
Create detailed reports and visualizations to communicate data profiling results and insights.
Provide recommendations for improving data quality, consistency, and usability.



Our requirements:



Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, or a related field.
Minimum 2–4 years of experience in data profiling, data analysis, or a similar role.
Proficiency in SQL for querying and analysing large datasets.
Experience with data profiling tools (e.g., Databricks, or similar).
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with attention to detail.
Excellent communication skills to effectively present findings to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Familiarity with data quality frameworks and concepts such as data cleansing, data governance, and master data management.
Knowledge of programming languages like Python or R for data analysis (preferred). Excellent level of written and spoken English



What we offer:



Challenges in an international environment
Career development opportunities
Internal training catalogue
Permanent contract
Private medical care
Comprehensive onboarding program
Buddy
Scandinavian work culture
Work-life balance
Culture of feedback
Work schedule 35h/week
Hybrid and flexible work
Good access to public transports



DSV - Transporte Global e Logística

A DSV é um local de trabalho dinâmico que promove a inclusão e a diversidade. Conduzimos os nossos negócios com integridade, respeitando as diferentes culturas, dignidade e os direitos dos indivíduos. Ao ingressar na DSV, você estará a trabalhar para uma das empresas com melhor desempenho no setor de transporte e logística. Você irá juntar-se a uma equipe talentosa com aproximadamente 75.000 colaboradores em mais de 80 países, trabalhando com paixão para oferecer ótimas experiências aos clientes e serviços de alta qualidade. A DSV aspira liderar o caminho para um futuro mais sustentável para nossa indústria e está comprometida em negociar respeitando os termos da natureza.

Promovemos a colaboração e transparência e esforçamo-nos para atrair, motivar e reter pessoas talentosas numa cultura de respeito. Se você é motivado, talentoso e deseja fazer parte de uma organização progressiva e versátil, apoiá-lo-emos nas suas necessidades para alcançar o seu potencial e avançar na sua carreira.

Visite dsv.com e siga-nos no LinkedIn, Facebook e Twitter.

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
Noesis Is Looking For Candidates With The Following Profile

  • Bachelor’s degree or higher in Mathematics, Computer Science, Management Informatics or equivalent;
  • Minimum 2 years of professional experience mining data as a Data Analyst;
  • Good analytics skills, including mining, modelling logical and conceptual, evaluation and data visualization;
  • Strong Power BI, SQL or Excel skills, with aptitude for learning other analytics tools;
  • Dynamism, proactivity and ability to work in a team;
  • Customer oriented;
  • Fluency in English will be valued.

If you meet these conditions and would like to join an innovative organization that continuously invests in training its talents, send us your application.

Join us. Let's innovate together!

All our recruitment and selection processes are based on equal opportunities, valuing the competence and potential of each person and ensuring that no candidate is discriminated on the grounds of gender, ethnicity, sexual orientation, age, religion or physical condition.

Title: Data Analyst (Arch Data) (M/F) - Remote
HTML:
Sysmatch is an IT Consultancy and Outsourcing Company with a wide range of technological skills, resulting from the accumulation of know-how and the experience of our consultants, allowing the implementation of solutions adapted to the needs of our clients, privileging their robustness and scalability.More than two decades in the IT market, we present ourselves as a flexible, adaptable, innovative and forward-looking Company.At the moment we are looking for the following candidate:Data Analyst (Arch Data) (m/f)

  • RemoteMandatory:Experience with Data Analysis and Data Governace; Experience withPython, SQL, and any Dashboard/ Reporting tool; Experience withArch Data.What we offer:- A dynamic project in a well-regarded client at an international level;
  • Salary classification according to the experience shown;
  • Career development with intervention in ambitious and innovative technological projects;

Title: Business, Data Analytics and Insights Associate
Description:
HOW MIGHT YOU DEFY IMAGINATION?

The Amgen Capability Center in Lisbon, Portugal (ACCP), number 1 company in Best Workplaces - https://www.greatplacetowork.pt/ - ranking in Portugal (category 201-500 employees) by the Great Place to Work Institute. is home to over 300 talented people and more than 35 different nationalities, diverse areas of expertise and professional experience that are shaping the future of healthcare. This is your chance to explore a world of opportunities in different areas such as Cybersecurity, Data & Analytics, Digital, Technology and Innovation, Finance, General & Admin, Human Resources, Regulatory Affairs and many more. In Lisbon's city center, our AMGEN office fosters innovation, excellence, and inspiration. Come thrive with us at AMGEN, supporting our mission To Serve Patients. What we do at AMGEN matters in people’s lives.

Business, Data Analytics and Insights Senior Associate

LIVE

What You Will Do

You, as our Business, Data Analytics and Insights Associate, supports the delivery of day to day D&A activities. You are responsible for producing budgeting and planning reports, data analysis and supporting wider business Units within the ACCP.

Other responsibilities will include:


Supporting business planning and decision making through financial analysis.
Support long-term and short-term planning support activities.
Calculating scenarios based of expectations.
Collecting feedback and preparing communication plans to share outputs.
Taking ownership of complex calculations through understanding inputs and their relationships to the problem.
Upload, manage and store complex data.
Communicate competently with regional hubs.
Supporting ACCP continuous improvement activities.
Supporting wider business units on an ad hoc basis (Finance/FP&A/Business Enablement).


WIN

What We Expect Of You

Our ideal candidate is a team player with customer focus. He/she is problem solving and result oriented and has time and process management skills and can compile data.

Proven experience and skills needed:


University Degree in commerce, finance, economics, mathematics, healthcare or related field.
1+ years working in a finance/data related field ideally Data and Analytics.
Fluency in English, both in written and oral communication.
Strong Excel knowledge .


Preferred Requirements:


Working knowledge of IS systems (including demonstrated capability of other MS Office applications, SQL, Hyperion Pillar, Tableau, Anaplan).
Demonstrates a service-minded attitude.
Experience in the Pharmaceutical industry.
Clearly explains processes and procedures.
Fluency in multiple European languages.


THRIVE

What You Can Expect Of Us


Vast opportunities to learn, develop, and move up and across our global organization.
Diverse and inclusive community of belonging, where colleagues are empowered to bring ideas to the table, take risks, and act.
Generous Amgen Total Rewards Plan comprising healthcare, finance, wealth and career benefits.
Flexible work arrangements.


APPLY NOW

for a career that defies imagination

In our quest to serve patients above all else, Amgen is the first to imagine, and the last to doubt. Join us.

careers.amgen.com

EQUAL OPPORTUNITY STATEMENT

Amgen is an Equal Opportunity employer and will consider you without regard to your race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability status.

We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided a reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request an accommodation.

Title: Performance Analyst
Description:
Country: Portugal

Dia a dia da função de Performance Analyst


Participar no desenvolvimento de iniciativas de transformação e crescimento de negócio dentro da área de transforação digital, compreendendo e pensando o modelo de negócio com espírito crítico, e identificar oportunidades de melhoria
Dar apoio às squads de performance de forma a resolver problemas, realizar análises de cliente e negócio e facilitar a tomada de decisão
Criar dashboards para visualização de informação e geração de insights. Relatórios de objetivos, tráfego por fontes, visualização de funis, conversões, etc. Utilizar informação proveniente de diversas fontes (Google Analytics, Supermetrics, data lake, etc.)
Avaliar a performance de campanhas e outras jornadas de comunicação e comerciais
Acompanhar testes A/B
Colaborar com outras áreas da transformação digital


Formação


Percurso académico em Gestão, Economia, Engenharia ou semelhante


Competências Técnicas


Sólidos conhecimentos de Excel (valorizada experiência com Power Query e Power Pivot)
Sólidos conhecimentos de Web Analytics:
Identificação e implementação de métricas, dimensões e segmentos que permitam uma correta medição e análise;
Definição, auditoria, reporting e análise de funis de conversão (pageviews, eventos, e-commerce);
Análise de jornadas de utilizador/cliente;
Tracking e reporting de campanhas de Paid Media (Google Ads, Meta Ads, LinkedIn Ads, etc);
Acompanhamento e reporting de métricas de SEO (Nomeadamente, Google Search Console);
Definição e gestão de parâmetros UTM para identificação de origem de tráfego;
Certificação em ferramentas de web analytics, nomeadamente em Google Analytics (valorizada experiência com GA4)
Experiência com ferramentas de visualização de dados (Power BI, Data Studio) e criação de dashboards


Soft Skills


Perfil analítico com fortes capacidades para resolução de problemas
Autonomia, rigor, pró-ativo e orientado a resultados
Comunicação clara, empática e eficiente, adaptada aos diferentes stakeholders
Capacidade para trabalhar num ambiente multidisciplinar e colaborativo


At Santander each one of us is a "Risk Pro". This means taking personal responsibility for identifying, assessing, managing and reporting any risks to the bank arising from the performance of our duties. We will give you the knowledge and tools to be Risk Pro in all situations. This risk culture is fundamental to the Santander Way, our way of working.

Under the terms of Law 93/2021 of 20 December, the Bank has a denunciation channel – Canal Aberto, accessible via the link https://secure.ethicspoint.eu/domain/media/pteu/gui/105862/index.html.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
Qualitest Group is looking for a talented Data Analyst!

Qualitest, the largest quality assurance company in the world, is recruiting employees for a localization/software testing project in partnership with one of the world’s largest tech providers.

If you are a passionate tech savvy person, with analytical, communication, and time management skills, and proven ability to deliver technical solutions in JavaScript and Python you’re the one we’re looking for!

Responsibilities

  • Exploring and implementing new ways to automate process in Javascript and Python;
  • Perform Data Analysis to identify anomalies and patterns;
  • Find creative solutions to challenging problems.

Skills

  • Detail-oriented, organized, and able to work on multiple projects over the course of a day;
  • Proficiency (C1) in English;
  • Good demonstrable knowledge of Javascript, Python and SQL;
  • Excellent analytical skills, logical problem solving skills;
  • Creative, out-of-the-box thinking;
  • Experience troubleshooting complex problems;
  • Meticulously high level of attention to detail and accurate documentation of information;
  • Excellent interpersonal, communication and listening skills;
  • Team player with ability to work well in a cross-functional team environment;
  • High level of cultural sensitivity and awareness to work effectively with diverse teams.

Ready to make a difference? Join the Qualitest Team!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Número da Solicitação de Emprego: 88937

Horário: Full Time

PLEASE REMEMBER TO CLICK "APPLY" BUTTON AFTER SAVING YOUR PROFILE TO COMPLETE YOUR APPLICATION PROCESS.

Your responsibilities:



Data analysis – understand and document the usage of data in the values of the received data formats.
Technical analysis of different data formats received from different data sources.
Use documentation and examples related to data interfaces to understand data structure and provide translation specifications (mappings) from one data format to another.
Identify and document gaps between producing and consuming applications and the Enterprise Data Models based on translation specifications (mappings)
Development and maintenance of documentation
Technical and non-technical stakeholder management (incl. information architects, business change managers, data product owners, data engineers, product owners and tech leads)
Ensure version control and governance around workflow management is followed.
Continuously seek and suggest improvements/optimisations to the process



Our requirements:



Bachelor’s degree in a relevant subject
At least 3 years’ experience working in similar role.
Knowledge of TMS systems and data attribute analysis and mapping is advantages
Excellent analytical skills and an informed, evidence-based approach
Being detail-oriented and capable of delivering a high level of accuracy
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to talk and present to a range of audiences, facilitating interactions to gain insight into open questions
The ability to work under pressure delivering on agreed deadlines
A good understanding of information technology
Excellent level of written and spoken English



What we offer:



Challenges in an international environment
Career development opportunities
Internal training catalogue
Permanent contract
Private medical care
Comprehensive onboarding program
Buddy
Scandinavian work culture
Work-life balance
Culture of feedback
Work schedule 35h/week
Hybrid and flexible work
Good access to public transports



DSV - Transporte Global e Logística

A DSV é um local de trabalho dinâmico que promove a inclusão e a diversidade. Conduzimos os nossos negócios com integridade, respeitando as diferentes culturas, dignidade e os direitos dos indivíduos. Ao ingressar na DSV, você estará a trabalhar para uma das empresas com melhor desempenho no setor de transporte e logística. Você irá juntar-se a uma equipe talentosa com aproximadamente 75.000 colaboradores em mais de 80 países, trabalhando com paixão para oferecer ótimas experiências aos clientes e serviços de alta qualidade. A DSV aspira liderar o caminho para um futuro mais sustentável para nossa indústria e está comprometida em negociar respeitando os termos da natureza.

Promovemos a colaboração e transparência e esforçamo-nos para atrair, motivar e reter pessoas talentosas numa cultura de respeito. Se você é motivado, talentoso e deseja fazer parte de uma organização progressiva e versátil, apoiá-lo-emos nas suas necessidades para alcançar o seu potencial e avançar na sua carreira.

Visite dsv.com e siga-nos no LinkedIn, Facebook e Twitter.
Show more

Title: Analista de dados
Description:
Mutual Respect, Empathy, Innovation, and Professional Pride. Do you see yourself within these values?

Founded in 2006 with the mission "To Challenge Complexity", Closer Consulting is a Data Science company specializing in Business Intelligence, Advanced Analytics, and Artificial Intelligence.

Developing projects in the most diverse industries – Banking, Telecommunications, Healthcare, Retail, Energy, Insurance, and Aviation, among others –, we have created an environment where the brightest enquiring minds feel at home, providing our people with the means, opportunities and support they need to thrive and innovate.

We seek a Data Analyst willing to accept new challenges in our Closer team.


For this position, you must have a residency in Porto or Lisbon.


Are you the one?

Responsibilities


Analyze and interpret large datasets to generate valuable insights
Create interactive reports and dashboards to support decision-making
Collaborate closely with teams across different areas to solve strategic challenges
Ensure data quality and integrity


Requirements


Experience with tools like Excel, SQL, Power BI, or Tableau ️
Knowledge of Google Analytics and Big Data is a plus
Strong analytical skills and attention to detail
Good communication skills and ability to work in a team ️


We Believe We Are The Ones To, By

Providing a multidisciplinary Team.

Giving a home office kit with everything you need to perform remotely.

Ensuring a career plan alongside professional growth.

Providing you with a custom training plan.

Helping you reach happiness.

Oh… And By The Way, We Also Have

Several challenging complex projects.

Stimulating teams and leaders.

World-class Clients and Partners.

If you believe in this match as much as we do, send us your CV to margarida.novais@closer.pt and reach the closer side of life.

Closer is a company that values diversity and inclusion. We are committed to fostering an environment where everyone is treated with dignity and respect, regardless of race, gender, beliefs, sexual orientation, physical or mental disability, or other personal characteristics.

At Closer, we embrace the unique perspectives and experiences that everyone brings, and we believe that it is a fundamental driver for the success we've achieved.

Title: Data Analyst - Group HR
Description:
About The Job

People Analytics is the AI & Analytics center of expertise for HR. Our goal is to support HR teams in leveraging data to help strategically manage activities and improve employee experience. To achieve this, People Analytics use a AI & Analytics platforms for data processing, visualization and AI. People Analytics offers analyses, dashboards, predictive models, and digital solutions that meet the needs of senior management, HR teams, and business units.

Within People Analytics, you will join a dynamic and multidisciplinary team of about forty collaborators, working in Paris and Lisbon in an agile mode. You will work with other data experts (including data quality analysts, data engineers, data scientists) and will be in constant contact with other HR experts.

As a Data Analyst, you will build analyses and participate in the development of projects that help make strategic decisions for the function (e.g. Analyzing workforce trends for the general management).

Your Main Activities Are

In This Role, Your Missions Will Include

Understand the needs expressed by senior management, HR teams, or the business.

Translate them into an analytical roadmap (scope of analysis, metrics...) to help make decisions.

Develop dashboards (Power BI and Tableau) and written analyses (preparation, exploration, descriptive analysis, data visualization, clustering, machine learning, NLP...) in collaboration with data scientists and data engineers of the team.

Contribute to the monitoring and analysis of workforce trends, from data collection to the delivery of analyses to senior management.

Clearly communicate actionable recommendations orally and in writing through reliable and quality deliverables.

Your Team / Work Environment

This position is to be filled within the People Analytics team at Group HR;

You will join a dynamic and multidisciplinary team of about forty collaborators, working in an agile mode with all the AI&Analytics experts (Data Analyst, Data Engineer, AI Business Analyst, Data project manager, Data Scientist, Data quality analyst, Product Owner…), and will be in contact with other HR department collaborators.

And after? / FUTURE PROSPECTS:

The numerous contacts you will gain will allow you to develop your network and consider joining different teams within GHR or more broadly within the group's businesses.

Profile And Skills To Success

With a scientific background, you have experience as an analyst, management controller, auditor, consultant in a quantitative-oriented position.

Pedagogically, you can communicate your statistical analyses and results clearly and intelligibly to different stakeholders, both in writing and orally, adapting to the technical levels expected by your interlocutors.

You have significant experience in data visualization, data preparation and machine-learning.

Finally, we attach particular importance to our future collaborators acting with responsibility and professional ethics daily.

Your Required Skills

Business Skills:

Data Processing (Expert)

Data Analysis (Expert)

Knowledge of BNP Paribas organization (Proficient)

Knowledge of Human Resources (Proficient)

Knowledge of Data (Proficient)

Data Quality and Security (Expert)

Transversal Skills

Ability to understand, explain, and lead change (Proficient)

Analytical Skills (Expert)

Project Management Skills (Expert)

Ability to lead meetings, seminars, committees and trainings (Proficient)

Ability to define relevant performance indicators (Expert)

Behavioral Skills

Ability to synthesize/simplify (Expert)

Communication Skills – oral and written (Expert)

Adaptability (Proficient)

Results-oriented (Expert)

Problem-solving Skills (Proficient)

Languages

English (Advanced)

Tools / Technologies / Methodologies

DATA VIZ BLENDING ANALYTICS Tableau (Expert)

DATA VIZ BLENDING ANALYTICS DataIKU (Proficient)

DATA VIZ BLENDING ANALYTICS Power BI (Proficient)

Python (Proficient)

DATABASE MANAGEMENT Standard SQL (Proficient)

AGILE Methodology (Proficient)

MS OFFICE PACK MICROSOFT EXCEL Tools (Proficient)

Mobility is one of the core principles of BNP Paribas career and management strategy, which aims to meet our Employees’ needs for personal development along with ensuring that the company meets the overall business needs. For further details, we invite you to explore the mobility principles available on https://bwelcome.hr.bnpparibas/internalmobility. Before applying, please make sure you discuss it with your manager whose support is critical

English (Advanced)

Tools / Technologies / Methodologies

DATA VIZ BLENDING ANALYTICS Tableau (Expert)

Python (Proficient)
