Title: Capital Portfolio Management Data Analyst
Description:
About The Job


The Resource & Portfolio Management (RPM) Team is part of the Securitised Product Group (SPG), which combines all securitisation and other risk distribution activities within Global Banking EMEA – Capital Markets
The Securitisation Trade Manager is responsible for the booking of transactions and the management of their cash flows (calculation, monitoring of payments, etc.) and for their correct regulatory Capital calculation in the systems, to achieve optimum Capital savings for the bank
Acting as a point of contact with investors during the life of the transaction, as well as for regulatory reporting, the Securitisation Trade Manager will develop expertise in transaction management (Securitisation, SRT, Credit Default Swap, Credit Insurance) and most importantly in regulatory Capital of the Bank
The Candidate will work with data to assess the Capital savings on the transactions under management and should have an interest in learning Python/SQL languages. The Candidate will also be key to ensure that all the contractual commitments related to Resources & Portfolio Management transactions are fulfilled


Your Main Activities Are


Advisory role in pre-trade phase by actively liaising with the Origination and Structuring team, to assess the feasibility of a transaction
Booking of transactions in Front-Office systems
Perform monitoring and payment of invoices to Third Parties (Investors, Brokers and Insurers)
Calculate the correct Capital savings by ensuring the right Risk-Weighted Assets (RWA) are calculated during the quarterly Capital process
Perform quarterly updates of the capital structure of existing programs and quarterly coupon computation and validation, following instructions of underlying flow of funds
Identify claims based on rating triggers in underlying portfolios
Perform reporting to Validation Agent, Investors, Regulators, and internal stakeholders, acting as a point of contact for questions related to existing portfolios


Profile And Skills To Success


Master's degree in Engineering, Finance, Maths or Economics
Up to 3 years of relevant experience
Interest in VBA, Python, or data analytics tools such as SQL
Fluency in English both oral and written (mandatory)
Advanced knowledge of Office package (Excel)


#Hybrid

Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union’s leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centers providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group’s retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

HTML:
About The Job

  • The Resource & Portfolio Management (RPM) Team is part of the Securitised Product Group (SPG), which combines all securitisation and other risk distribution activities within Global Banking EMEA – Capital Markets
  • The Securitisation Trade Manager is responsible for the booking of transactions and the management of their cash flows (calculation, monitoring of payments, etc.) and for their correct regulatory Capital calculation in the systems, to achieve optimum Capital savings for the bank
  • Acting as a point of contact with investors during the life of the transaction, as well as for regulatory reporting, the Securitisation Trade Manager will develop expertise in transaction management (Securitisation, SRT, Credit Default Swap, Credit Insurance) and most importantly in regulatory Capital of the Bank
  • The Candidate will work with data to assess the Capital savings on the transactions under management and should have an interest in learning Python/SQL languages. The Candidate will also be key to ensure that all the contractual commitments related to Resources & Portfolio Management transactions are fulfilled

Your Main Activities Are

  • Advisory role in pre-trade phase by actively liaising with the Origination and Structuring team, to assess the feasibility of a transaction
  • Booking of transactions in Front-Office systems
  • Perform monitoring and payment of invoices to Third Parties (Investors, Brokers and Insurers)
  • Calculate the correct Capital savings by ensuring the right Risk-Weighted Assets (RWA) are calculated during the quarterly Capital process
  • Perform quarterly updates of the capital structure of existing programs and quarterly coupon computation and validation, following instructions of underlying flow of funds
  • Identify claims based on rating triggers in underlying portfolios
  • Perform reporting to Validation Agent, Investors, Regulators, and internal stakeholders, acting as a point of contact for questions related to existing portfolios

Profile And Skills To Success

  • Master's degree in Engineering, Finance, Maths or Economics
  • Up to 3 years of relevant experience
  • Interest in VBA, Python, or data analytics tools such as SQL
  • Fluency in English both oral and written (mandatory)
  • Advanced knowledge of Office package (Excel)

#Hybrid

Why joining BNP Paribas?

  • Leading banking institution

BNP Paribas is the European Union’s leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.

  • Our presence in Portugal

In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centers providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.

  • International reach

Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions

  • Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group’s retail activities and specialised business lines;
  • Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
  • Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
  • Diversity and Inclusion commitment

BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.

  • Commitment towards work/life balance

At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.

  • Remote Working Conditions

At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal

  • Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
  • In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

Title: Data Quality Analyst - Group HR
Description:
About The Job

People Analytics is the AI & Analytics center of expertise for HR. Our goal is to support HR teams in leveraging data to help strategically manage activities and improve employee experience. To achieve this, People Analytics use a AI & Analytics platforms for data processing, visualization and AI. People Analytics offers analyses, dashboards, predictive models, and digital solutions that meet the needs of senior management, HR teams, and business units.

Within People Analytics, you will join a dynamic and multidisciplinary team of about forty collaborators, working in Paris and Lisbon in an agile mode. You will work with other data experts (including data analysts, data engineers, data scientists) and will be in constant contact with other HR experts.

As a Data Quality Analyst, you will play a crucial role in managing and improving data quality within the organization. You will be responsible for implementing data quality control processes, identifying anomalies, proposing solutions to ensure data integrity and reliability and building HR activity monitoring dashboards.

Your Main Activities Are


Understanding the data quality needs expressed by various HR teams and the Data Analysts of the team;
Developing and implementing data quality strategies to ensure data accuracy, consistency, and reliability;
Conducting regular data audits to identify errors and inconsistencies;
Documenting data quality processes and training teams on best practices;
Clearly and concisely communicating data quality analysis results and recommendations to stakeholders;
Developing and updating monitoring or activity management dashboards (Power BI and Tableau).


Profile And Skills To Success

With a scientific background, you have significant experience as a data analyst, management controller, auditor, or consultant in a data quality-oriented position;

You hold excellent ability to analyze and interpret complex data;

You are a good communicator and can clearly and intelligibly convey your analyses and results to various stakeholders;

You have solid experience in data visualization and data preparation;

Finally, we place particular importance on our future collaborators acting with responsibility and professional ethics daily.

Your Team / Work Environment

This position is to be filled within the People Analytics team at Group HR;

You will join a dynamic and multidisciplinary team of about forty collaborators, working in an agile mode (Data Analyst, Data Engineer, Data Scientist, Product Owner) and will be in contact with other HR department collaborators.

And after? / FUTURE PROSPECTS:

The numerous contacts you will gain will allow you to develop your network and consider joining different teams within GHR or more broadly within the group's businesses.

Your Required Skills

Business Skills:

Data Processing (Expert)

Data Analysis (Expert)

Knowledge of BNP Paribas organization (Proficient)

Knowledge of human resources (Proficient)

Knowledge of Data (Proficient)

Data quality and security (Expert)

Transversal Skills

Ability to understand, explain, and lead change (Proficient)

Analytical skills (Expert)

Project management skills (Expert)

Ability to lead meetings, seminars, committees and training (Proficient)

Ability to define relevant performance indicators (Expert)

Behavioral Skills

Ability to synthesize/simplify (Expert)

Communication skills – oral and written (Expert)

Adaptability (Proficient)

Results-oriented (Expert)

Problem-solving skills (Proficient)

Languages

English (Advanced)

Tools / Technologies / Methodologies

DATA VIZ BLENDING ANALYTICS Tableau (Expert)

DATA VIZ BLENDING ANALYTICS DataIKU (Proficient)

DATA VIZ BLENDING ANALYTICS Power BI (Proficient)

DATABASE MANAGEMENT Standard SQL (Proficient)

AGILE Methodology (Proficient)

MS OFFICE PACK MICROSOFT EXCEL Tools (Proficient)

Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union’s leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centres providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group’s retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

Title: Business, Data Analytics and Insights Senior Associate
Description:
HOW MIGHT YOU DEFY IMAGINATION?

The Amgen Capability Center in Lisbon, Portugal (ACCP) is home to over 300 multi-national and multi-cultural employees, representing a broad range of cross functional capabilities, including Commercial, General and Administrative, Research and Development and more.

The ACCP offers rich career growth and development opportunities, regional and global exposure, and the opportunity to LIVE, WIN and THRIVE in one of Europe’s most attractive cities.

Our ACCP Office is located at Maleo – Sete Rios, Av. José Malhoa 19, 1070-040 Lisbon, in the vibrant city center of Lisbon.

If you feel like you’re part of something bigger, it’s because you are. At Amgen our shared mission—to serve patients—drives all that we do. It is key to our becoming one of the world’s leading biotechnology companies. We are global collaborators who achieve together—researching, manufacturing, and delivering ever-better products that read over 10 million patients worldwide. It’s time for a career you can be proud of. Join us.

Business, Data Analytics and Insights Senior Associate

LIVE

What You Will Do

You, as our Business, Data Analytics and Insights Senior Associate, will play a pivotal role as a strategic partner to Commercial leadership, offering data-backed insights crucial for driving commercial success. You will be responsible for forecasting, producing budgeting and planning reports, data analysis, and supporting wider Business Units within the ACCP.

Other responsibilities will include:


Understand business drivers to create, prepare, and maintain patient and demand-based forecasts and scenarios
Contribute to regular forecast cycles including multiple cycles of annual long-range forecast, and short-term forecast
Perform in-depth data analysis to build robust assumptions, scenarios, and forecast inputs
Present and defend forecast approach, methodology, assumptions, and outputs in team discussions
Collecting feedback and preparing communication plans to share outputs.
Taking ownership of complex calculations through understanding inputs and their relationships to the problem.
Supporting ACCP continuous improvement activities.
Supporting wider business units on an ad hoc basis (Finance/FP&A/Business Enablement).


WIN

What We Expect Of You

Our ideal candidate is a team player with customer focus. The ideal candidate is is problem solving and result oriented and has time and process management skills and can compile data.

Proven experience and skills needed:


University Degree in commerce, finance, economics, mathematics, healthcare or related field.
3+ years working in a finance/data related field ideally Data and Analytics.
Forecasting and Modelling experience
Fluency in English, both in written and oral communication.
Strong Excel knowledge


Preferred Requirements:


Working knowledge of IS systems (including demonstrated capability of other MS Office applications, SQL, Hyperion Pillar, Tableau, Anaplan).
Demonstrates a service-minded attitude.
Experience in the Pharmaceutical industry.
Clearly explains processes and procedures.
Fluency in multiple European languages.


THRIVE

What You Can Expect Of Us


Vast opportunities to learn, develop, and move up and across our global organization.
Diverse and inclusive community of belonging, where colleagues are empowered to bring ideas to the table, take risks, and act.
Generous Amgen Total Rewards Plan comprising healthcare, finance, wealth and career benefits.
Flexible work arrangements.


APPLY NOW

for a career that defies imagination

In our quest to serve patients above all else, Amgen is the first to imagine, and the last to doubt. Join us.

careers.amgen.com

EQUAL OPPORTUNITY STATEMENT

Amgen is an Equal Opportunity employer and will consider you without regard to your race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability status.

We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided a reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
A career in our Technology practice, will provide you with the opportunity to help clients seize essential advantages by working alongside business leaders to solve their toughest problems and capture their greatest opportunities.

The role - Data Engineer

Responsibilities

As a Data Engineer you will contribute to the design and build of required infrastructure to support optimal extraction, transformation, and load of data from various sources. Integration, setup, and maintenance of analytical tools. Pipeline maintenance, monitoring and performance. Your main responsibilities will include, but are not limited to:


Designing and delivering Azure data solutions across data strategy, ETL, analytics, and AI
Leading solution workshops and working hands-on with the latest Azure Data technologies
Building scalable, high-performance, and secure data platforms
Collaborating with Azure Architects and Engineers to deliver end-to-end enterprise solutions.


Your profile


You have completed a degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field
At least 2 years of professional experience in Data Engineering
Advanced proficiency in Python and SQL
Strong understanding of data modeling and data platform concepts
Expertise in both on-premises and cloud-based solutions
Hands-on experience with ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes and data quality engines
Proficient in Microsoft Azure technologies, such as Data Factory, Functions and ADL
Experience working with Databricks for big data processing and analytics
Certifications are an advantage: Azure Fundamentals, Azure Data Fundamentals, Azure Data Engineer Associate, Databricks Certified Data Engineer Associate / Professional.


We believe you have what it takes. Are you ready to join our “community of solvers”?

Be a part of The New Equation

 


Show more

Title: Data Understanding Specialist - (Third Party Associate) - Spanish Market- Portugal
Description:
Responsibilities

Important Note: Please be advised that this job posting is for informational purposes only. This is a 6 month temporary assignment managed by HYLegal. All contractual terms, including payroll and benefits, will be handled by HYLegal. By applying, you agree that the information provided in your application may be processed for recruitment purposes, shared with the third-party agency, and other purposes in accordance with ByteDance's Applicant Privacy Notice https://sf16-sg.tiktokcdn.com/obj/eden-sg/uvyloeh7vhonuhf/privacy/ByteDance_Global_Applicant_Privacy_Notice.pdf

TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok's global headquarters are in Los Angeles and Singapore, and its offices include New York, London, Dublin, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Jakarta, Seoul, and Tokyo.

Why Join Us

Creation is the core of TikTok's purpose. Our platform is built to help imaginations thrive. This is doubly true of the teams that make TikTok possible.

Together, we inspire creativity and bring joy - a mission we all believe in and aim towards achieving every day.

To us, every challenge, no matter how difficult, is an opportunity; to learn, to innovate, and to grow as one team. Status quo? Never. Courage? Always.

At TikTok, we create together and grow together. That's how we drive impact - for ourselves, our company, and the communities we serve.

Join us.

The Global Monetization Integrity team ensures safe and quality experiences for Advertisers to enable TikTok in its mission to inspire joy and creativity. The team is responsible for creating scalable and reliable solutions that allow TikTok Advertisers and businesses to interact in a trustworthy manner, always working to anticipate and protect against threats. They will do so by creating ad policies, managing content review processes, and more.

We are looking for talented multi-lingual individuals to join our team in Lisbon, Portugal. Whether you have existing experience in our industry or not, our expert teams will give you all the tools and support you need to learn how to grow your career in this incredibly important part of TikTok. In return, you'll help support the build up of ML capabilities for better advertising products. Watch your ambitions become reality as your inspiration brings infinite opportunities at TikTok.

This position will be responsible for meeting the Risk and Moderation demands. This means, as Global Operations Specialist, you will review & moderate advertisements entering the TikTok platform. By doing so, this will mitigate any risk to our community by supporting advertisers proactively, and effectively addressing violations of MI Policies.

Main Responsibilities


SOP Clarification and Training:
Work with the BPs to clarify and eliminate ambiguities in the requirements/SOPs
Provide simplified and straightforward tasks to labellers
Deliver training to labellers for complex requirements
Quality Improvement and Assurance:
Constantly monitor and review the quality of the labelled data
Identify the root cause of any issues and take appropriate remedial actions such as simplify or disambiguate the - - SOPs or provide additional training
Identify opportunities or areas for improvement for key metrics and propose experiments to support initiatives
Project Management:
Ensure timely delivery of projects
Coordinate effectively with key stakeholders
Provide project visibility and progress updates to stakeholders through data


Qualifications

Minimum qualifications:


Fluent in written and spoken required language plus business level English
1-3 years experience in operation for a tech or social media company data analytic experience but graduates also highly welcomed
Proficiency in data interpretation and analysis; Understanding of AI and Machine Learning concepts, particularly as they relate to data labelling is a plus
Excellent verbal and written communication skills for clear and effective communication with both requestors and labellers
Strong abilities in simplifying complex instructions and requirements, along with robust experience in training in a technical context
Experience in project management with strong organizational skills to manage multiple tasks concurrently, preferably in a data-intensive environment


Preferred Qualifications


Strong analytical and problem-solving skills to identify and resolve issues
Strong technical skills in SQL and scripting languages (Python, R) are a plus
Fluency in English (written and verbal) and an additional language


TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.
Show more
HTML:
Responsibilities

Important Note: Please be advised that this job posting is for informational purposes only. This is a 6 month temporary assignment managed by HYLegal. All contractual terms, including payroll and benefits, will be handled by HYLegal. By applying, you agree that the information provided in your application may be processed for recruitment purposes, shared with the third-party agency, and other purposes in accordance with ByteDance's Applicant Privacy Notice https://sf16-sg.tiktokcdn.com/obj/eden-sg/uvyloeh7vhonuhf/privacy/ByteDance_Global_Applicant_Privacy_Notice.pdf

TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok's global headquarters are in Los Angeles and Singapore, and its offices include New York, London, Dublin, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Jakarta, Seoul, and Tokyo.

Why Join Us

Creation is the core of TikTok's purpose. Our platform is built to help imaginations thrive. This is doubly true of the teams that make TikTok possible.

Together, we inspire creativity and bring joy - a mission we all believe in and aim towards achieving every day.

To us, every challenge, no matter how difficult, is an opportunity; to learn, to innovate, and to grow as one team. Status quo? Never. Courage? Always.

At TikTok, we create together and grow together. That's how we drive impact - for ourselves, our company, and the communities we serve.

Join us.

The Global Monetization Integrity team ensures safe and quality experiences for Advertisers to enable TikTok in its mission to inspire joy and creativity. The team is responsible for creating scalable and reliable solutions that allow TikTok Advertisers and businesses to interact in a trustworthy manner, always working to anticipate and protect against threats. They will do so by creating ad policies, managing content review processes, and more.

We are looking for talented multi-lingual individuals to join our team in Lisbon, Portugal. Whether you have existing experience in our industry or not, our expert teams will give you all the tools and support you need to learn how to grow your career in this incredibly important part of TikTok. In return, you'll help support the build up of ML capabilities for better advertising products. Watch your ambitions become reality as your inspiration brings infinite opportunities at TikTok.

This position will be responsible for meeting the Risk and Moderation demands. This means, as Global Operations Specialist, you will review & moderate advertisements entering the TikTok platform. By doing so, this will mitigate any risk to our community by supporting advertisers proactively, and effectively addressing violations of MI Policies.

Main Responsibilities

  • SOP Clarification and Training:
  • Work with the BPs to clarify and eliminate ambiguities in the requirements/SOPs
  • Provide simplified and straightforward tasks to labellers
  • Deliver training to labellers for complex requirements
  • Quality Improvement and Assurance:
  • Constantly monitor and review the quality of the labelled data
  • Identify the root cause of any issues and take appropriate remedial actions such as simplify or disambiguate the - - SOPs or provide additional training
  • Identify opportunities or areas for improvement for key metrics and propose experiments to support initiatives
  • Project Management:
  • Ensure timely delivery of projects
  • Coordinate effectively with key stakeholders
  • Provide project visibility and progress updates to stakeholders through data

Qualifications

Minimum qualifications:

  • Fluent in written and spoken required language plus business level English
  • 1-3 years experience in operation for a tech or social media company data analytic experience but graduates also highly welcomed
  • Proficiency in data interpretation and analysis; Understanding of AI and Machine Learning concepts, particularly as they relate to data labelling is a plus
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills for clear and effective communication with both requestors and labellers
  • Strong abilities in simplifying complex instructions and requirements, along with robust experience in training in a technical context
  • Experience in project management with strong organizational skills to manage multiple tasks concurrently, preferably in a data-intensive environment

Preferred Qualifications

  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills to identify and resolve issues
  • Strong technical skills in SQL and scripting languages (Python, R) are a plus
  • Fluency in English (written and verbal) and an additional language

TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.

Title: Real Time Analyst (WFM)
Description:
Navan is looking for a Real-Time Analyst (RTA) to support Workforce Management (WFM) for our 24/7/365 Travel Experience team. In this role, you will collaborate with cross-functional teams and leadership to optimize productivity and performance across multiple contact centers.

You will be responsible for managing real-time support volumes, making short-term scheduling adjustments, and ensuring data accuracy within our systems. This role requires a proactive, analytical, and detail-oriented professional who can effectively balance business needs with delivering an exceptional customer experience.

What You’ll Do


Monitor real-time volume across multiple contact center channels and skills.
Utilize WFM software and historical data to manage intra-day staffing levels.
Implement effective staffing adjustments to maintain service levels.
Identify emerging trends and assess their impact on business operations.
Translate data into actionable insights and recommendations.
Evaluate availability for training, special projects, and other initiatives.
Process and track time-off requests and schedule exceptions for agents.
Communicate tailored messaging to various teams and stakeholders.
Maintain and update WFM profiles to ensure accurate time tracking.
Investigate data anomalies and uncover root causes.
Foster a positive work environment that supports team success.
Continuously enhance personal skills and proficiency with WFM systems.
Perform additional duties as needed.


What We’re Looking For


1+ year of Workforce Management (WFM) experience as a Real-Time Analyst (RTA) – mandatory.
Experience in a multi-channel contact center environment.
Hands-on experience with workforce systems such as Aspect eWFM, Avaya CMS, IEX, Genesys, Teleopti, Calabrio, and/or Verint/Blue Pumpkin. (Genesys required for most cases)
Strong proficiency in Google Sheets and Microsoft Excel (e.g., advanced VLOOKUPs, pivot tables, complex formulas, and data analysis).
Ability to work a flexible schedule, including nights, weekends, and holidays as needed.
Strong quantitative, analytical, and problem-solving skills.
Proactive mindset to identify challenges, analyze business impact, and provide data-driven solutions.
Ability to build strong relationships across different levels of the organization.
High level of integrity and confidentiality when handling sensitive employee information.
Show more

Title: Quant / Data Scientist
Description:
Launched in 2020, Venus Protocol (a.k.a. “Venus”) pushed the edges of decentralized finance through its composition of two pre-existing solutions and deployment on BNB chain, lowering the barrier to entry for millions of new users around the globe. By combining the stablecoin minting facility introduced by Maker and algorithmic money markets developed by Compound, Venus simplified the user experience and provided core capabilities that enabled decentralized finance to flourish in a single application. As a result, Venus found remarkable success and quickly rose to be one of the most widely used decentralized applications in web3.

Job Responsibilities:


Run SQL queries and Python data science scripts to build business reports
Source data from disparate sources, including SQL databases, graphQL APIs, and blockchain nodes
Create reports highlighting key metrics
Collaborate with team leaders on business strategies and determining OKRs
Assist developers in implementing data collection and analysis tool improvements
Identify and advocate for team-wide areas of improvement and best practices



Job Requirements:


Job Requirements:
Advanced Degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering, Physics, or Economics
3+ years of experience in a similar role with at least 2 years working on a chain
Prior experience generating insights across protocol risk management, Tokenomics, or mechanism design
Capable of building predictive analytics, forecasting, or statistical modeling
Financial analysis experience affecting decisions regarding millions or billions of dollars in assets or investments
Advanced to expert SQL skills
Moderate to advanced Python data science skills
Knowledge of EVM based blockchains and smart contract mechanics



Good to have:


Experience with DeFi architecture
Experience with GraphQL
Experience with Solidity
Experience with cadCAD, or other systems modeling programs

Show more

Title: Advanced Analytics Consultant
HTML:
Queres integrar uma das maiores organizações na prestação de serviços profissionais do mercado?

Então a Deloitte é para ti. Aqui, vais ter a possibilidade de potenciar a tua carreira e de reforçar as tuas competências no nosso universo tecnológico.

Somos um Tech Hub internacional e estamos à procura dos melhores especialistas em Data para se juntarem aos nossos centros de excelência e à nossa comunidade. Na Deloitte, vais transformar o mundo como o conhecemos e desenvolver soluções únicas e inovadoras nos mais variados e complexos projetos de transformação, de Portugal para o mundo. Vamos reforçar a nossa área de Analytics e procuramos profissionais experientes que tenham gosto e aptidão natural para trabalhar em equipa e em ambiente multi-projeto. Podes descobrir todas as funções que vais desempenhar, de acordo com o teu perfil, para assim dares um salto na tua carreira!

Juntas-te a nós? Estamos à tua espera.

O teu dia a dia e responsabilidades:

  • Planear e executar com autonomia as atividades a realizar na elaboração dos diversos outputs no âmbito de um projeto;
  • Gerir responsavelmente e de acordo com a sua esfera de atuação as relações diárias com o cliente.


És tu quem procuramos?

  • Formação superior nas áreas de Engenharia Informática, Engenharia Eletrotécnica e de Computadores ou similar;
  • Anos de experiência: 2 a 5 anos em consultoria e em Business Intelligence/ Analytics;
  • Conhecimentos sólidos em data mining & Machine Learning;
  • Conhecimentos técnicos em R, Python, SAS Machine Learning e IBM Watson ou ferramentas similares;
  • Conhecimento da língua inglesa no domínio falado e escrito;
  • Conhecimento da língua portuguesa no domínio falado e escrito;
  • Orientação para o cliente e para resultados;
  • Comunicação, relacionamento interpessoal, trabalho em equipa e colaboração;
  • Resolução de problemas, capacidade analítica e espírito crítico;
  • Organização, planeamento e orientação para a qualidade dos projetos;
  • Orientação para o cliente e para resultados;
  • Residência em Portugal obrigatória.


Desenvolve uma carreira à tua medida

  • Num contexto de trabalho diverso que permite um desenvolvimento e aprendizagem contínuos;
  • Através de um plano de desenvolvimento de carreira personalizado (skills/ oportunidades técnicas e funcionais), adequado ao momento, às tuas necessidades e objetivos
  • Participando em projetos nacionais e internacionais, com dimensão e impacto relevante nesta área de especialização;
  • Acesso ilimitado às maiores plataformas de aprendizagem online (Linkedin Learning e Udemy);
  • Oportunidade de formações e certificações nas mais recentes tecnologias, nomeadamente em tecnologias Cloud.


Vive uma cultura de união

  • Uma cultura de inovação e excelência que nos torna líderes e precursores de tendências;
  • Um ambiente amigável, de respeito, confiança, transparência e informalidade;
  • Uma rede para a vida que te faz estar ligado ao melhor conhecimento ao lado de líderes e especialistas;
  • Uma oportunidade para fazeres parte das nossas comunidades (de Tech, inovação, desporto e outros interesses) e para participares ativamente em projetos de responsabilidade social.


Sobre a Deloitte

Na Deloitte nunca trabalharás sozinho. Terás a oportunidade de integrar diversos projetos de transformação e fazer parte de uma equipa que te vai inspirar e ajudar a desenvolver soluções diferenciadoras, num ambiente dinâmico e colaborativo, onde podes dar o melhor de ti e beneficiar das nossas iniciativas de bem-estar e flexibilidade. Somos mais de 5.500 pessoas em Portugal, das quais mais de 2.600 trabalham em áreas tecnológicas, a partir de escritórios e Digital Studios em Lisboa, Porto, Braga, Viseu, Coimbra e Faro e de polos tecnológicos em Braga. Além disso, as nossas equipas em Portugal têm projeção internacional, o que demonstra a nossa forte liderança global em low code/no code, em engenharia de redes de telecomunicações, em plataformas tecnológicas de transformação organizacional (ServiceNow e Apptio) e na indústria de serviços financeiros (Finastra, TIA e Guidewire).

Se tens interesse em explorar e desenvolver as tuas competências nalguma destas áreas em soluções tecnológicas – engenharia de software, cloud, integração de sistemas, data analytics & data science, cyber risk, engenharia de redes telecomunicações, UX design - e gostarias de trabalhar com tecnologias como AWS, Google, Oracle, Salesforce, SAP, Mulesoft, Feedzai e SAS, entre outras, então estás no lugar certo!

Keywords: Sobre a Deloitte; Technology; Consulting; Anos de Experiência

Title: Senior Data Analyst Fraud Process Optimization Team
Description:
Present in more than 30 countries, BNP Paribas Personal Finance leads the personal and consumer credit business. In some markets, we are leaders and we invest in innovation to open up new opportunities, in others we are a fast-growing business.

We are committed to promoting access to more responsible and sustainable consumption to support our customers and partners. To achieve this, we implement concrete actions, not only in the way we develop our business and enhance our sustainable growth, with the ambition to reduce our environmental footprint, but also in the way we support those who need it most.

BNPP Personal Finance is, by nature, exposed to Fraud, and relies heavily on quantitative models and strong analytics to manage it. Each day, millions of credit granting decisions are made, using hundreds of decision rules and models. The importance and complexity of these ecosystems at use within BNPP-PF keep on rising as the digital transformation accelerates.

In practice, your day-to-day


Credit Process Optimization team has been created in 2018 within Risk Personal Finance Global Credit Decision-making Policies, in Risk corporate teams. During first years, the team has realized numerous optimization projects, both on Fraud & Risk topics, and, capitalizing on them, has developed a first set of analytical modules to speed-up these projects locally.
This position is dedicated to support Germany’s local risk team by optimizing the fraud decision processes through an analytical approach. Responsibilities include analyzing fraud patterns, developing, and implementing measures to mitigate fraud and coordinating projects with both local and central stakeholders during the implementation of the new IT system. The main activities will be:
Contribute to the identification of optimization levers on risk & fraud decision process
Support the formalization and further development of effective strategies to manage and prevent fraud
Develop and optimize analyses and reports used to support management decisions
Define and modify necessary data sources and reports in collaboration with internal and external providers
Follow Risk & Fraud rules efficiency and find ways of optimizations through analytical methods and using our internal set of modules dedicated to optimization topics (RBO Toolkit)
Measure the added-value of each optimization project by the definition and valuation of key performance indicators
Provide contents for trainings to partners and employees
Maintain and optimize anti-fraud tools. Monitor their performance and prepare proposals to increase their effectiveness and efficiency
Advise internal stakeholders on fraud topics
Support communications departments in the procurement of contents that support internal and external partners in detecting and preventing fraud

The Mission is important, but working environment is also important!


Within BNP Paribas Personal Finance Central Risk Department is responsible for the relevance of risk rating models used within all local entities and for maintaining a high level of expertise with integrating new statistical techniques in new modelling environments. You will operate in a friendly and international work environment, designed to make the collaborating experience as pleasant as possible!
You will have regular exchanges with the Central (this will help to build up competence based on different cultures and levels of responsibility).
You will participate to projects and strategics activities, part of the Strategic Plan of BNPP PF.


What do we have to offer you?


The team is evolving in a strategic and challenging environment within Personal Finance and has interactions with different central and local directions. Working in an international environment, the Fraud Credit Process Optimization Data analyst develops his/her knowledge on local specificities: products, market, risk, ...


Are you the one we are looking for?


Have you a few experiences in Credit Risk Management, ideally in Fraud, with mathematical/statistical background and a few years of successful experience, preference in a Bank, a financial environment, or a digital business?
Have you monitored and analysed risk trends and/or fraud trends on applications and/or card payments and detect ways of optimization?
Are you able to work on several projects at the same time and are known for your rigor?
Are you comfortable communicating orally and in writing with different interlocutors and sharing information?
Are you doing everything you can to achieve your goals?
Do you know Python or other database language (SAS, SQL)?
Do you have a good knowledge in Excel and Power point?
Do you have important analytics & business skills as:
Applied Math and Algorithms
Data Processing, Data Knowledge
Descriptive Modelling and Predictive Modelling
Ability to understand, explain and support change
Analytical Ability
Ability to collaborate/Teamwork
Ability to Synthetise/Simplify
Do you speak English? German is a plus.
If you have all this, a lot of desire, energy, and good mood, then you are the one we are looking for …
We look forward to your application!

Our commitments


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer that is proud to provide equal employment opportunities to all job seekers. As a socially responsible company, we incorporate the principles of Diversity and Inclusion in our values and practices
To achieve all our goals, we intend to attract, develop, and retain different profiles, assuming diversity as an enabler and differentiator of innovation, fundamental in our organization


What makes us proud as reference employer?


Top Employer Portugal and Top Employer Europe certification, for the seventh consecutive year
92% of our employees identify BNP Paribas as a company with "an inclusive management that supports all kinds of differences (age, origins, sexual orientation ...)"
93% of employees identify with and benefit from the "Smart Working" policy, feeling comfortable in a hybrid work environment, and with the digital tools and workspaces available
71% of our customers are promoters of our brand
Show more

Title: Data Management Senior Associate
Description:
HOW MIGHT YOU DEFY IMAGINATION?

The Amgen Capability Center in Lisbon, Portugal (ACCP) is home to over 300 multi-national and multi-cultural employees, representing a broad range of cross functional capabilities, including Commercial, General and Administrative, Research and Development and more. The ACCP offers rich career growth and development opportunities, regional and global exposure, and the opportunity to LIVE, WIN and THRIVE in one of Europe’s most attractive cities. The ACCP has been ranked as the #1 company in Best Workplaces (https://www.greatplacetowork.pt/) ranking in Portugal for companies between 201-500 employees, by the Great Place to Work Institute.

Our ACCP Office is located at Maleo – Sete Rios, Av. José Malhoa 19, 1070-040 Lisbon, in the vibrant city center of Lisbon.

If you feel like you’re part of something bigger, it’s because you are. At Amgen our shared mission—to serve patients—drives all that we do. It is key to our becoming one of the world’s leading biotechnology companies. We are global collaborators who achieve together—researching, manufacturing, and delivering ever-better products that read over 10 million patients worldwide. It’s time for a career you can be proud of. Join us.

Data Management Senior Associate

LIVE

What You Will Do

The Master Data Management team at Amgen plays a pivotal role as a strategic partner to Commercial leadership, offering data-backed insights crucial for driving commercial success. As a Sr. Associate Data Management, you will be supporting master data connectivity across Amgen Enterprise functions - Commercial, Medical, Clinical, Operations & Corporate functions.

The individual in this role will need to ensure effective execution of business rules and accuracy of processes that enable data connectivity across key master data domains - Product, Provider, Payer, Patient and Consent.

You, as our Data Management Senior Associate, play a pivotal role working closely with cross functional data governance and operations teams to ensure timely and accurate Master Data for all commercial operations including field support, patient services, compliance, and supporting wider Business Units within the ACCP.

Other responsibilities will include:


Execution of master data integrations that enable cross-functional data connectivity
Effectively work with systems/tools to ensure integrity of master data connections & data quality
Develop business requirements and data mappings that enable cross-functional data across the broader CD&A organization
Communicate data/system related issues/updates to relevant partners
Responsible for System and User Acceptance testing of related system and integration implementations
Respond and resolve data inquiries from cross-functional stakeholders
Troubleshoot data issues affecting downstream systems.
Adhere to Compliance, Legal and Data Privacy guidelines and best practices
Supporting ACCP continuous improvement activities
Supporting local Data Stewards on their activities


WIN

What We Expect Of You

Our ideal candidate is a team player with customer focus. He/she is problem solving and result oriented and has time and process management skills and can compile data.

Proven experience and skills needed:


Minimum 3 years of experience in Pharma/Biotech data management, or computer science
OR Master’s degree and 3 years of data management experience, data management, business, engineering, computer science or related field experience
OR Bachelor’s degree and 5 years of data management experience, data management, business, engineering, computer science or related field experience
University Degree in business, computer science, mathematics, healthcare or related field.
Fluency in English, both in written and oral communication.
Excel knowledge and experience in SQL


Preferred Requirements:


Experience in the Pharmaceutical industry and working with master data and transactional information (commercial, medical, clinical, etc.)
Understanding of data management and ETL processes
Experience with IS data applications, data querying, and data quality tools
Adept at creating and overseeing project management plans, along with managing priorities and driving completion of assigned tasks
Highly skilled in working collaboratively in a team-based environment and gaining alignment across an organization.
Excellent communication skills with the ability to present complex data models to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Demonstrates a service-minded attitude.


THRIVE

What You Can Expect Of Us


Vast opportunities to learn, develop, and move up and across our global organization.
Diverse and inclusive community of belonging, where colleagues are empowered to bring ideas to the table, take risks, and act.
Generous Amgen Total Rewards Plan comprising healthcare, finance, wealth and career benefits.
Flexible work arrangements.


APPLY NOW

for a career that defies imagination

In our quest to serve patients above all else, Amgen is the first to imagine, and the last to doubt. Join us.

careers.amgen.com

EQUAL OPPORTUNITY STATEMENT

Amgen is an Equal Opportunity employer and will consider you without regard to your race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability status.

We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided a reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request an accommodation.

HOW MIGHT YOU DEFY IMAGINATION?

The Amgen Capability Center in Lisbon, Portugal (ACCP) is home to over 300 multi-national and multi-cultural employees, representing a broad range of cross functional capabilities, including Commercial, General and Administrative, Research and Development and more. The ACCP offers rich career growth and development opportunities, regional and global exposure, and the opportunity to LIVE, WIN and THRIVE in one of Europe’s most attractive cities. The ACCP has been ranked as the #1 company in Best Workplaces (https://www.greatplacetowork.pt/) ranking in Portugal for companies between 201-500 employees, by the Great Place to Work Institute.

Our ACCP Office is located at Maleo – Sete Rios, Av. José Malhoa 19, 1070-040 Lisbon, in the vibrant city center of Lisbon.

If you feel like you’re part of something bigger, it’s because you are. At Amgen our shared mission—to serve patients—drives all that we do. It is key to our becoming one of the world’s leading biotechnology companies. We are global collaborators who achieve together—researching, manufacturing, and delivering ever-better products that read over 10 million patients worldwide. It’s time for a career you can be proud of. Join us.

Title: AI & Automation Analyst
Description:
Job Description

The Position

AI & Automation Analyst

We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated AI &Automation Analyst to join our team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for identifying AI & Automation opportunities within our organization and designing a fit-for-purpose solution. This role involves working closely with cross-functional teams to understand business needs, analyze processes, and recommend AI-driven improvements.

Organon is a Women’s Health Company that believes in a better and healthier every day for every woman! We are a passionate, global community of thousands dedicated to redefining the future of women’s health. Our mission is to deliver impactful medicines and solutions for a healthier every day. But what really makes it work at Organon is our people.

We’re looking for real, passionate team players, curious innovators, forward thinkers, empowered by the idea of shaping their career, and ready to bring their fire to embrace change and the opportunities it brings for progress.

At Organon, you’ll get to enjoy the best of both worlds: the open, agile, collaborative culture of a start-up, and operating at the scale of a fortune 500 company with an international footprint that serves people in more than 140 markets.

It’s going to be an exciting future—come be a part of it!

Responsibilities


Identify AI & Automation Opportunities:
Collaborate with various departments to identify areas where AI can add value
Conduct research and analysis to stay updated on the latest AI trends and technologies
Document/map and evaluate current business processes to pinpoint inefficiencies and opportunities for AI & Automation
Technical Requirement Formulation:
Gather and document detailed business requirements for AI & Automation projects
Develop detailed documentation, including use cases, process diagrams, and technical requirements
Guarantee that all documented requirements are unambiguous, succinct, and in alignment with strategic business objectives
Stakeholder Engagement:
Act as a liaison between business units, technical teams, and external partners
Facilitate meetings and workshops to elicit requirements and validate solutions
Communicate effectively with stakeholders to manage expectations and project scope
Data Analysis:
Partner with Data & Analytics to identify AI-ready data sources
Develop dashboards to measure opportunities and support prioritization decisions
Training and Support:
Provide training and support to end-users on new AI systems and tools
Develop user guides and training materials
Troubleshoot and resolve issues related to AI & Automation solutions


Qualifications

Required Education, Experience, and Skills


Bachelor’s degree or higher in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related discipline and/or Technical certification with at least 2+ years AI analyst experience
Professional Experience: A track record of success as a Business and Technical Analyst, with a preference for those who have concentrated on AI & Automation technology projects
Analytical skills: Exceptional analytical abilities, capable of interpreting intricate data and formulating decisions based on data insights
Communication Excellence: Outstanding communication and interpersonal skills, ensuring effective interaction and collaboration
Technical Proficiency: Skilled in data analysis and visualization tools, such as Power BI, and whiteboarding tools such as Mural/Miro to conduct discovery and design session with business
AI Familiarity: A solid understanding of AI technologies and their practical applications within business contexts
Project Management Expertise: Robust project management capabilities, adept at juggling multiple projects and priorities efficiently


Secondary Job Description

Who We Are:

Organon delivers ingenious health solutions that enable people to live their best lives. We are a $6.5 billion global healthcare company focused on making a world of difference for women, their families and the communities they care for. We have an important portfolio and are growing it by investing in the unmet needs of Women’s Health, expanding access to leading biosimilars and touching lives with a diverse and trusted portfolio of health solutions. Our Vision is clear: A better and healthier every day for every woman.

As an equal opportunity employer, we welcome applications from candidates with a diverse background. We are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all our applicants.

Search Firm Representatives Please Read Carefully

Organon LLC, does not accept unsolicited assistance from search firms for employment opportunities. All CVs / resumes submitted by search firms to any employee at our company without a valid written search agreement in place for this position will be deemed the sole property of our company. No fee will be paid in the event a candidate is hired by our company as a result of an agency referral where no pre-existing agreement is in place. Where agency agreements are in place, introductions are position specific. Please, no phone calls or emails.

Annualized Salary Range

Annualized Salary Range (Global)

Annualized Salary Range (Canada)

Please Note: Pay ranges are specific to local market and therefore vary from country to country.

Employee Status

Regular

Relocation:

No relocation

VISA Sponsorship

No

Travel Requirements: Organon employees must be able to satisfy all applicable travel and credentialing requirements, including associated vaccination prerequisites

No Travel Required

Flexible Work Arrangements

Not Specified

Shift

Valid Driving License:

Hazardous Material(s)

Number of Openings:

1

Title: Professional Internship in Data Analytics
Description:
Avanade is the perfect stage to bring in your thoughtful, energetic and curious approach to technology consulting.

Come join us

As an Intern in Avanade, you will play an instrumental role in doing what Avanade does best: delivering outstanding, complex projects with global impact and helping our clients transform their businesses through digital innovation. We are a fast-growing, diverse group of more than 100 passionate enthusiasts and specialists in Microsoft technologies. We actively encourage learning, focus on progress, acknowledge and reward quality. We’re ambitious and curious and want to bring on more people with a similar passion for technology.

At Avanade, everyone has a Career Advisor who works with you to create a plan and guides you in choosing from the many training opportunities we offer, as well as being a mentor in making sure you thrive and feel valued. We have a strong focus on the career and development opportunities of all our people and making sure our employees are proud of working at Avanade is central to us!

Together we do what matters.

Skills And Experiences

You will be able to learn and work with the following technologies:


Structured Data Storage: Development of objects in Microsoft SQL Server databases. Data warehouse development and modeling
Connectivity with data sources, data processing and loading into the destination
Report generation and data visualization with Power BI
SQL, Azure, Power BI, Python, Databricks, JavaScript, C#.


About You


Live in Portugal, speak Portuguese and be willing to do a hybrid job
Have a degree in Computer Engineering, Biomedical Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Management Information Systems, Industrial Engineering or an equivalent field
Have teamwork and adaptability
Have passion for technology
Internships or academic experiences in technology projects are always welcome.


What You'll Do


As an intern, you will support colleagues to help catalyze the deployment of data analytics tools and techniques
You will have the opportunity to work on projects for a wide variety of clients, employing data analytics techniques to build models, analyze data and create visualizations
You will gain experience of working in a project-based environment and applying your data analytics skills to client assignments
Your assigned line manager will provide personal development to enhance your employability
You will be working in project teams to address real world problems.


Learn more

To learn more about the types of projects our teams work on, check out these case studies:


Centrica Trading credited with an industry-first migration to the cloud
Marston Holdings identifies significant cloud savings.


Interested in knowing what’s going on inside Avanade?

Check Out Our Blogs

Inside Avanade - explore what life is like working at Avanade.

Enjoy your career


Opportunity to work for Microsoft’s Global Alliance Partner of the Year (14 years in a row), with exceptional development and training
Real-time access to technical and skilled resources globally
Dedicated Career Advisor to encourage your growth
Engaged and helpful coworkers genuinely interested in you
Find out more about some of our benefits here - https://www.avanade.com/en/career/benefits.


A great place to work

As you bring your skills and abilities to Avanade, you’ll get distinctive experiences, limitless learning, and ambitious growth in return. As we continue to build our diverse and inclusive culture, we become even more innovative and creative, helping us better serve our clients and communities. You’ll join a community of smart, supportive collaborators to lift, mentor, and guide you, and to lean on your expertise. You get a company purpose-built for business-critical, leading-edge technology solutions, committed to improving the way humans work, interact, and live. It’s all here, so take a closer look!

We work hard to provide an inclusive, diverse culture with a deep sense of belonging for all our employees. Visit our Inclusion & Diversity page. 

 

Create a future for our people that focuses on 


Expanding your thinking  
Experimenting courageously  
Learning and pivoting 


  

Inspire greatness in our people by 


Empowering every voice  
Encouraging boldness  
Celebrating progress  


  

Accelerate the impact of our people by 


Amazing the client  
Prioritizing what matters   
Acting as one
Show more

Title: Business Analyst (Data Management)
Description:
At AXIANS we seek the right talent, for the right place. We work daily to involve our people in a collaborative and inclusive environment, with a culture of proximity. Also, part of our culture is our concern for the environment and the implementation of social and environmental corporate responsibility actions.

This could be your opportunity to join a company of international scope, with a project that needs you to meet the challenges of digital transformation.

💻 THE ROLE

We are looking for a #TechTalent to work as a Business Analyst (Data Management) for an international project.

🙂 YOUR DAY TO DAY


Analyze, align, and verify business needs and solutions
Engage project teams, prioritize requests, and monitor portfolios
Document and validate requirements efficiently
Contribute to testing and user tests
Support change management and deploy solutions
Identify and prepare action plans for business impacts


💡 WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FOR


Over 5 years of relevant professional experience
Team player demonstrating high performance, flexibility, and adaptability
Proficient in project management methodology, process analysis, design, and testing methods
Familiar with Business needs analysis and key challenges related to Data and its management
Mandatory proficiency in written and spoken English; fluency in Italian is a strong advantage


⭐ WHAT YOU CAN EXPECT FROM US

Stable professional career

Working with Axians projects becomes an asset to those of us who want to offer stability through a secure career.

Prospects for career advancement

You can access training and new certifications that will further elevate your skills. The 360° evaluation from managers and peers will also allow you to evolve.

Work Life Balance

By collaborating with Axians, you will be able to reconcile work and family requirements without neglecting either area.

Attractive, Evolving Compensation

When working with Axians, you will have access to performance bonuses in addition to an attractive salary pack (base salary + benefits). You are also entitled to health insurance and free psychology consultations.

Do you identify with this position?

If you think this position is the right fit for you and you have the #TechTalent we are looking for, send us your resume, preferably in English and in Europass format, to recrutamento.axianspt@axians.com with the subject BADM/AS/MO”.

Learn more about Axians
Show more
