Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Are you ready to revolutionise the world with TEKEVER? 🚀🌍

Join us, the European leader in unmanned technology, where cutting-edge advancements meet unparalleled innovation. We offer a unique surveillance-as-a-service solution that provides real-time intelligence, enhancing maritime safety and saving lives. TEKEVER is setting new standards in intelligence services, data and AI technologies.

Become part of a dynamic team transforming maritime surveillance and making a significant impact on global safety. 🌐

At TEKEVER, our mission is to provide limitless support through mission-oriented game-changers, delivering the right information at the right time to facilitate critical decisions.

If you’re passionate about technology and eager to shape the future, TEKEVER is the place for you! 👇🏻🎯

Job Overview

As a Data Engineer, you will play a critical role in designing, building and maintaining the data pipelines and systems that support our data-driven initiatives, as well as supporting the evolution of our Data & Analytics Platform. You will work closely with data scientists, analysts and other stakeholders to ensure that our data & AI infrastructure is robust, scalable and efficient. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in data engineering, with experience in data integration, ETL processes, database management and Data & Analytics Platform development.

What Will Be Your Responsibilities


Data Pipeline Development: Design, develop and maintain scalable and efficient data pipelines to collect, process and store large volumes of data from various sources.
ETL Processes: Implement ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes to ensure data is accurately and efficiently transformed and loaded into data storage systems.
Database Management: Manage and optimize databases and data warehouses to ensure data integrity, performance and availability.
Data Integration: Integrate data from multiple sources, including APIs, databases and external data providers, to create unified datasets for analysis.
Data & Analytics Platform development & expansion: support the expansion of our Data & Analytics Platform.
Data Quality Assurance: Implement data validation and quality assurance processes to ensure the accuracy and consistency of data.
Collaboration: Work closely with data scientists, analysts and other stakeholders to understand data requirements and provide the necessary data infrastructure and support.
Performance Optimization: Monitor and optimize the performance of data pipelines and databases to ensure efficient data processing and retrieval.
Documentation: Maintain comprehensive documentation of data pipelines, ETL processes and database schemas.


Profile And Requirements


Education: Bachelors or Masters degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Information Systems, or a related field.
Experience: 3+ years of experience in data engineering or a similar role.
Technical Skills:
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, Java, or Scala.
Experience with SQL and database management systems (e.g., MySQL, PostgreSQL, SQL Server).
Familiarity with big data technologies (e.g., Hadoop, Spark) and data warehousing solutions (e.g., Redshift, Snowflake).
Experience with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, Google Cloud) and their data services, with a focus on Google Cloud. Google Cloud certification is preferred.
Knowledge of data integration tools and frameworks (e.g., Apache Nifi, Talend, Informatica).
Experience with data modeling and schema design.
Experience with Iaac (e.g. Ansible, Terraform), data pipeline orchestration (e.g. Airflow), log exploration tools (e.g. Streamlit, Dash), data extraction (e.g. PostGIS, Kafka, Airflow, FastAPI), pandas, scikit-learn, Docker.
Basic understanding of DevOps best practices and tools: GIT, CI/CD, telemetry and monitoring, etc.
Analytical Skills: Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a focus on delivering scalable and efficient data solutions.
Communication: Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to effectively collaborate with technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Language Requirements: Advanced proficiency in Portuguese and English, with proven fluency at the C2 level in both languages.
Attention to Detail: High attention to detail and a commitment to ensuring data quality and accuracy.
Adaptability: Ability to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment and manage multiple priorities simultaneously.

What We Have To Offer You


An excellent work environment and an opportunity to create a real impact in the world;
A truly high-tech, state-of-the-art engineering company with flat structure and no politics;
Working with the very latest technologies in Data & AI, including Edge AI, Swarming - both within our software platforms and within our embedded on-board systems;
Flexible work arrangements;
Professional development opportunities;
Collaborative and inclusive work environment;
Salary compatible with the level of proven experience.


Do you want to know more about us ?

Visit our LinkedIn page at https://www.linkedin.com/company/tekever/
Show more
HTML:
Are you ready to revolutionise the world with TEKEVER? 🚀🌍

Join us, the European leader in unmanned technology, where cutting-edge advancements meet unparalleled innovation. We offer a unique surveillance-as-a-service solution that provides real-time intelligence, enhancing maritime safety and saving lives. TEKEVER is setting new standards in intelligence services, data and AI technologies.

Become part of a dynamic team transforming maritime surveillance and making a significant impact on global safety. 🌐

At TEKEVER, our mission is to provide limitless support through mission-oriented game-changers, delivering the right information at the right time to facilitate critical decisions.

If you’re passionate about technology and eager to shape the future, TEKEVER is the place for you! 👇🏻🎯

Job Overview

As a Data Engineer, you will play a critical role in designing, building and maintaining the data pipelines and systems that support our data-driven initiatives, as well as supporting the evolution of our Data & Analytics Platform. You will work closely with data scientists, analysts and other stakeholders to ensure that our data & AI infrastructure is robust, scalable and efficient. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in data engineering, with experience in data integration, ETL processes, database management and Data & Analytics Platform development.

What Will Be Your Responsibilities

  • Data Pipeline Development: Design, develop and maintain scalable and efficient data pipelines to collect, process and store large volumes of data from various sources.
  • ETL Processes: Implement ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes to ensure data is accurately and efficiently transformed and loaded into data storage systems.
  • Database Management: Manage and optimize databases and data warehouses to ensure data integrity, performance and availability.
  • Data Integration: Integrate data from multiple sources, including APIs, databases and external data providers, to create unified datasets for analysis.
  • Data & Analytics Platform development & expansion: support the expansion of our Data & Analytics Platform.
  • Data Quality Assurance: Implement data validation and quality assurance processes to ensure the accuracy and consistency of data.
  • Collaboration: Work closely with data scientists, analysts and other stakeholders to understand data requirements and provide the necessary data infrastructure and support.
  • Performance Optimization: Monitor and optimize the performance of data pipelines and databases to ensure efficient data processing and retrieval.
  • Documentation: Maintain comprehensive documentation of data pipelines, ETL processes and database schemas.

Profile And Requirements

  • Education: Bachelors or Masters degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Information Systems, or a related field.
  • Experience: 3+ years of experience in data engineering or a similar role.
  • Technical Skills:
    • Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, Java, or Scala.
    • Experience with SQL and database management systems (e.g., MySQL, PostgreSQL, SQL Server).
    • Familiarity with big data technologies (e.g., Hadoop, Spark) and data warehousing solutions (e.g., Redshift, Snowflake).
    • Experience with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, Google Cloud) and their data services, with a focus on Google Cloud. Google Cloud certification is preferred.
    • Knowledge of data integration tools and frameworks (e.g., Apache Nifi, Talend, Informatica).
    • Experience with data modeling and schema design.
    • Experience with Iaac (e.g. Ansible, Terraform), data pipeline orchestration (e.g. Airflow), log exploration tools (e.g. Streamlit, Dash), data extraction (e.g. PostGIS, Kafka, Airflow, FastAPI), pandas, scikit-learn, Docker.
    • Basic understanding of DevOps best practices and tools: GIT, CI/CD, telemetry and monitoring, etc.
  • Analytical Skills: Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a focus on delivering scalable and efficient data solutions.
  • Communication: Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to effectively collaborate with technical and non-technical stakeholders.
  • Language Requirements: Advanced proficiency in Portuguese and English, with proven fluency at the C2 level in both languages.
  • Attention to Detail: High attention to detail and a commitment to ensuring data quality and accuracy.
  • Adaptability: Ability to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment and manage multiple priorities simultaneously.
What We Have To Offer You

  • An excellent work environment and an opportunity to create a real impact in the world;
  • A truly high-tech, state-of-the-art engineering company with flat structure and no politics;
  • Working with the very latest technologies in Data & AI, including Edge AI, Swarming - both within our software platforms and within our embedded on-board systems;
  • Flexible work arrangements;
  • Professional development opportunities;
  • Collaborative and inclusive work environment;
  • Salary compatible with the level of proven experience.

Do you want to know more about us ?

Visit our LinkedIn page at https://www.linkedin.com/company/tekever/

Title: Data Scientist (m/f/d)
Description:
Linde Portugal, LDA

Data Scientist (m/f/d)

Porto or Lisboa, Portugal, Barcelona, Spain | req22905

What You Will Enjoy Doing


You will generate value out of data by identification, driving and implementing use cases in the area of analytics across all value streams/ regions/functions
Furthermore, you will provide profound business understanding combined with a strong skillset of advanced data engineering and data science to transform business questions into data driven insight in language such as SQL, R, Python etc
Together with the data science lead drive the concept of data insights and advanced analytics as a key and strategic area in the field of business analytics
You will support in definition and execution of global business analytics strategy, help to position business analytics team as central point of contact for all data analytics questions and use cases
Will be under your responsibility the execution/ management of projects within the area of advanced business analytics closely aligned with business and senior management
Also, you will ensure the Coaching and Training of virtual teams and functional areas within the core disciplines of analytics
You will actively participate in the processes of digitization and automation of tasks, contributing to the company's evolution towards digital transformation


What Makes You Great


You have 5-7 years of experience in analytical insights and data science and hold a master’s degree in STEM from a prestigious university
Also, you have a natural ability to turn concepts into computational systems and transform business questions into data-driven insights
In addition, you have strong expertise in Finance, Sales, and Supply Chain processes
You are an expert in data modeling, feature engineering, and have strong knowledge of SQL, R, R Shiny, and Python
Furthermore, you have a solid understanding of data and system architectures and their role in digital transformation
You possess excellent English communication skills and can effectively engage with technical and business teams
Also, you have experience in Scrum and Agile methodologies to manage projects and drive high-performing teams
Additionally you are willing to travel when necessary to support business initiatives
You are ready to face new challenges and actively contribute to the success of the company's digital transformation project
You are able to collect, interpret and use data effectively, driving digital transformation


Why you will love working with us

At Linde we identify ourselves with our products – either working for the technical or medical gases business. Being a company with a long tradition in the gases business, we not only care about our customers and high quality products, but most importantly about our employees. While working with us, expect a safe workplace, high safety standards and a true commitment from our managers to safety.

What we offer you!

At Linde, the sky is not the limit. If you’re looking to build a career where your work reaches beyond your job description and betters the people with whom you work, the communities we serve, and the world in which we all live, at Linde, your opportunities are limitless. Be Linde. Be Limitless.

This role is a full time position based on an unlimited contract. The standard weekly working hours will be from 08:00 hrs till 17:00 hrs.

Have we inspired you? Let´s talk about it

We are looking forward to receiving your complete application (motivation letter, CV, certificates) via our online job market.

Any designations used of course apply to persons of all genders. The form of speech used here is for simplicity only.

Linde acts responsibly towards its shareholders, business partners, employees, society and the environment in every one of its business areas, regions and locations across the globe. The company is committed to technologies and products that unite the goals of customer value and sustainable development.

Title: IT Business Analyst
Description:
Introduction to role

We are looking for hardworking Business Analysts with substantial experience in the business analysis capability, likely having several years’ business analysis experience within a global business including significant transformation. The role will include undertaking hands-on business analysis responsibilities on significant programmes, working with senior stakeholders from across our business to produce deliverables of the highest quality to delight our stakeholders.

You will also participate in the Core Functions business analysis capability through networking with peers from other functions in a broader capability network and undertaking professional development as appropriate. The Business Analyst role will report to the Business Analysis Lead and will be based in our Lisbon office.

Typical Accountabilities



Business Needs Identification - Operates at an enterprise level in assessing and defining business need and areas for improvement. Proactively seeks out opportunities to enhance and improve in line with strategic goals. Actively monitors and identifies capability gaps and proposes potential solutions through research internally and externally.
Business Analysis Planning - Selects the appropriate analysis approach to a piece of work depending on its complexity, level of risk, known assumptions, constraints, and dependencies. Proficient in scoping and recommending appropriate approaches. Capable of planning and managing their own and other team member’s activities to meet deliverables and deadlines. Accountable for performance and quality of analytical work delivered, both their own and the work of others.
Stakeholder Analysis & Change - Effectively identifies stakeholders from the Core Functions (primarily HR) and actively builds and maintains relationships according to individual stakeholder needs and levels of influence. Contributes to communication plans and change management for project and stakeholders.
Requirements Analysis and Design Definition - Responsible and accountable for requirements management plans including elicitation, approvals, processes, RAID, and scope impacts. Highly responsive to changing business priorities with the ability to plan ahead, accounting for potential changes and corrective actions. Advanced requirements elicitation and management skill-set; including traceability, testing, and validation. Leads the work with the business to identify functional and technical requirements, translating the requirements into design specifications reflecting Functional Design, User Interface Design, and Business Process Design. Closely partnering with the Architecture team, ensuring the technical solution will deliver the agreed business benefits.
Business Case Definition - Shapes and defines the business case, producing detailed business justification for investment including ROI and benefits realization.
Solution Evaluation - Highly proficient in analyzing and assessing solution proposals and able to articulate supporting reasoning. i.e., assessing business readiness, maximizing value vs. spend.
Work collaboratively with business stakeholders, IT Business Partners, business customers, process owners, IT Architecture, delivery, Test Lead and Change Management/Communication Lead.



Essential Skills/Experience



Degree in relevant discipline or formal certification in business analysis practice.
Proven experience of successfully deploying a variety of business analysis tools/techniques to enable business change.
Proven experience of working with complex integrated systems, using creative and strategic thinking to deliver exceptional results.
Strong engagement, communication, and stakeholder management skills, including excellent presentation and influencing skills.
Business acumen; challenge, negotiation, and influence.
Presentation, Communication & Facilitation skills.
Customer Focus; Stakeholder Management; Networking.
Benefits Management and Realisation.
Planning; Business Process Management; Requirements Management.
Experience of virtual collaboration to lead, shape, and develop innovative solutions.
Experience of mentoring, coaching or developing others.
Experience of working with and managing third-party suppliers/vendors.



Desirable Skills/Experience



Lean SIGMA training; Practical usage of Agile Methodology.
Experience of working in a global organisation with complex/geographical context.
Pharmaceutical business awareness/business domain knowledge.
HR business awareness/business domain knowledge including HR systems (e.g., Workday HCM, payroll, talent acquisition SaaS products).
User Centred Design (User Experience, User Interface Design, and Business Process Design).
Experience of working in a regulated environment.
Show more

recruta um SQL Developer para uma empresa cliente, premiada, especializada em projetos de consultoria e outsourcing em IT, em Lisboa.

Implementação de CRUD, modelos de dados, transacionalidade e tunning.
Modelação multidimensional.

Title: Data Engineer - Group HR
Description:
About The Job

People Analytics is the AI & Analytics center of expertise for HR. Our goal is to support HR teams in leveraging data to help strategically manage activities and improve employee experience. To achieve this, People Analytics use a AI & Analytics platforms for data processing, visualization and AI. People Analytics offers analyses, dashboards, predictive models, and digital solutions that meet the needs of senior management, HR teams, and business units.

Within People Analytics, you will join a dynamic and multidisciplinary team of about forty collaborators, working in Paris and Lisbon in an agile mode. You will work with other data experts (including data quality analysts, data engineers, data scientists) and will be in constant contact with other HR experts.

Your Main Activities Are

As a Data Engineer, you will be responsible for designing, building, and maintaining reliable data pipelines to industrialize HR analyses and models, following the agile methodology in a Data platform that meets the long-term needs of the function. You will work closely with Data Analysts, Data Scientists, and the IT team to understand data, security, and access needs by defining and applying standards that ensure data fluidity and trust in the produced analyses.

In this context, you will ensure compliance with Data and Analytics governance principles, as well as standards in terms of architecture, management, quality, integrity, and data protection. You will contribute to industrialization by setting up the validation process and paying particular attention to delivering robust, ethical, and trustworthy products. You will also maintain a continuous improvement dynamic.

Aditionally, you will continue to improve your expertise and contribute to the development of the Analytics transformation of the HR department. Finally, you will also clearly communicate actionable recommendations orally and in writing through reliable and quality deliverables.

Your Team / Work Environment

This position is to be filled within the People Analytics team at Group HR;

You will join a dynamic and multidisciplinary team of about forty collaborators, working in an agile mode with all the AI&Analytics experts (Data Analyst, Data Engineer, AI Business Analyst, Data project manager, Data Scientist, Data quality analyst, Product Owner…), and will be in contact with other HR department collaborators.

And after? / FUTURE PROSPECTS:

The numerous contacts you will gain will allow you to develop your network and consider joining different teams within GHR or more broadly within the group's businesses.

Profile And Skills To Success


With a scientific background and solid experience in IT development, you have carried out and brought into production Data Engineering projects that satisfied your clients/business units. You are motivated by transformation challenges and comfortable with the Agile methodology;
Pedagogical, you know how to communicate clearly and intelligibly, both in writing and orally, to different stakeholders by adapting to the technical levels expected by your interlocutors. You are assertive and eager to share your experiences and know-how;
You have good experience with data processing technologies (Dataiku), relational and non-relational databases (ORACLE), and programming languages (Python), and you are passionate about data;
Finally, we attach particular importance to our future collaborators acting with responsibility and professional ethics on a daily basis.


Your Required Skills

Business Skills:


IT Development (Expert)
Data Processing (Expert)
Architecture (Proficient)
Data Processing (Expert)
Data Quality and Security (Expert)
IT Infrastructure (Proficient)
IT / Business Relations (Expert)


Transversal Skills


Ability to define relevant performance indicators (Expert)
Analytical skills (Expert)
Ability to develop and adapt processes (Expert)
Project management skills (Expert)
Ability to understand, explain, and lead change (Proficient)


Behavioral Skills


Results-oriented (Expert)
Communication skills – oral and written (Expert)
Rigor (Expert)
Ability to synthesize/simplify (Expert)


Languages

English (Advanced)

Tools / Technologies / Methodologies


DATA VIZ BLENDING ANALYTICS DataIKU (Expert)
IT LANGUAGE PYTHON (Expert)
DATABASE MANAGEMENT Standard SQL (Expert)
DATA VIZ BLENDING ANALYTICS Tableau (Proficient)
DATABASE MANAGEMENT Oracle (Expert)
AGILE Methodology (Proficient)
Test and Learn Methodologies (Proficient)
DevOps Methodologies (Proficient)


Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union’s leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centres providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group’s retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.


Show more
HTML:
About The Job

People Analytics is the AI & Analytics center of expertise for HR. Our goal is to support HR teams in leveraging data to help strategically manage activities and improve employee experience. To achieve this, People Analytics use a AI & Analytics platforms for data processing, visualization and AI. People Analytics offers analyses, dashboards, predictive models, and digital solutions that meet the needs of senior management, HR teams, and business units.

Within People Analytics, you will join a dynamic and multidisciplinary team of about forty collaborators, working in Paris and Lisbon in an agile mode. You will work with other data experts (including data quality analysts, data engineers, data scientists) and will be in constant contact with other HR experts.

Your Main Activities Are

As a Data Engineer, you will be responsible for designing, building, and maintaining reliable data pipelines to industrialize HR analyses and models, following the agile methodology in a Data platform that meets the long-term needs of the function. You will work closely with Data Analysts, Data Scientists, and the IT team to understand data, security, and access needs by defining and applying standards that ensure data fluidity and trust in the produced analyses.

In this context, you will ensure compliance with Data and Analytics governance principles, as well as standards in terms of architecture, management, quality, integrity, and data protection. You will contribute to industrialization by setting up the validation process and paying particular attention to delivering robust, ethical, and trustworthy products. You will also maintain a continuous improvement dynamic.

Aditionally, you will continue to improve your expertise and contribute to the development of the Analytics transformation of the HR department. Finally, you will also clearly communicate actionable recommendations orally and in writing through reliable and quality deliverables.

Your Team / Work Environment

This position is to be filled within the People Analytics team at Group HR;

You will join a dynamic and multidisciplinary team of about forty collaborators, working in an agile mode with all the AI&Analytics experts (Data Analyst, Data Engineer, AI Business Analyst, Data project manager, Data Scientist, Data quality analyst, Product Owner…), and will be in contact with other HR department collaborators.

And after? / FUTURE PROSPECTS:

The numerous contacts you will gain will allow you to develop your network and consider joining different teams within GHR or more broadly within the group's businesses.

Profile And Skills To Success

  • With a scientific background and solid experience in IT development, you have carried out and brought into production Data Engineering projects that satisfied your clients/business units. You are motivated by transformation challenges and comfortable with the Agile methodology;
  • Pedagogical, you know how to communicate clearly and intelligibly, both in writing and orally, to different stakeholders by adapting to the technical levels expected by your interlocutors. You are assertive and eager to share your experiences and know-how;
  • You have good experience with data processing technologies (Dataiku), relational and non-relational databases (ORACLE), and programming languages (Python), and you are passionate about data;
  • Finally, we attach particular importance to our future collaborators acting with responsibility and professional ethics on a daily basis.

Your Required Skills

Business Skills:

  • IT Development (Expert)
  • Data Processing (Expert)
  • Architecture (Proficient)
  • Data Processing (Expert)
  • Data Quality and Security (Expert)
  • IT Infrastructure (Proficient)
  • IT / Business Relations (Expert)

Transversal Skills

  • Ability to define relevant performance indicators (Expert)
  • Analytical skills (Expert)
  • Ability to develop and adapt processes (Expert)
  • Project management skills (Expert)
  • Ability to understand, explain, and lead change (Proficient)

Behavioral Skills

  • Results-oriented (Expert)
  • Communication skills – oral and written (Expert)
  • Rigor (Expert)
  • Ability to synthesize/simplify (Expert)

Languages

English (Advanced)

Tools / Technologies / Methodologies

  • DATA VIZ BLENDING ANALYTICS DataIKU (Expert)
  • IT LANGUAGE PYTHON (Expert)
  • DATABASE MANAGEMENT Standard SQL (Expert)
  • DATA VIZ BLENDING ANALYTICS Tableau (Proficient)
  • DATABASE MANAGEMENT Oracle (Expert)
  • AGILE Methodology (Proficient)
  • Test and Learn Methodologies (Proficient)
  • DevOps Methodologies (Proficient)

Why joining BNP Paribas?

  • Leading banking institution

BNP Paribas is the European Union’s leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.

  • Our presence in Portugal

In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centres providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.

  • International reach

Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions

  • Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group’s retail activities and specialised business lines;
  • Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
  • Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
  • Diversity and Inclusion commitment

BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.

  • Commitment towards work/life balance

At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.

  • Remote Working Conditions

At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal

  • In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Explorer: Embark on Analysis Adventures! ⚙️

There's no secret to become number-one, it takes willingness to improve and determination to pursue it. At GRiT®, it’s all about the journey getting there. We trust talent and intelligence are important, yet passion and perseverance are key to achieving any goal.

We are Tech Passionate People with a Purpose, delivering solutions while building strong long-term relations.

Recognizing each person’s unique contribution to our collective success, we embrace inclusion and diversity, committed to creating a respectful and socially responsible environment.

People. Technology. Innovation. All-around it.

Are you GRiTTY enough to be part of our journey? Take the first step by applying now and let’s create our future together. 🌟

Must-Have


More than 1 year of experience as a Data Analyst
Analytical mindset, being able to drive insights to answer business questions with data and visualizations
Knowledge of Data Transformation and analysis tools (SSAS, SSIS, SSRS, PowerQuery, PowerPivot, PowerBI, MDX, Python, SQL, R)
Experience creating and managing data warehouses, as well as the ETL/ETL workflow
Experience working with Engineering on ETL pipelines
Ability to organize, autonomy, dynamism, pro-activity and teamwork
Sense of responsibility
Strong written and verbal English communication skills


Would Be Great If You Have


Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or similar
Effective visual communicator – you can communicate complex problems to business and technology stakeholders using visual collaboration tools
Background with Cloud Databases


What’s In It For You


Continuous Training and Certifications
GRiT Prizes: GRiT Baby Gift, GRiT Birthday Prize, GRiT Recommendation Prize
Exclusive Partnerships/Discounts: (Gym, Health, Well-being, Lifestyle, Financial, etc…)
Unique Events
Welcoming Office (Fruit, Coffee, Pool Table, etc.)
Competitive Compensation
Pay for Performance


#TechWithPassion - Fuel your fire, join our tech tribe! 🫀

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About Air Apps

At Air Apps, we believe in thinking bigger—and moving faster. We’re a family-founded company on a mission to create the world’s first AI-powered Personal & Entrepreneurial Resource Planner (PRP), and we need your passion and ambition to help us change how people plan, work, and live. Born in Lisbon, Portugal in 2018—and now with offices in both Lisbon and San Francisco—we’ve remained self-funded while reaching over 100 million downloads worldwide.

Our long-term focus drives us to challenge the status quo every day, pushing the boundaries of AI-driven solutions that truly make a difference. Here, you’ll be a creative force, shaping products that empower people across the globe.

Join us on this journey to redefine resource management—and change lives along the way.

The Role

As a Data Analyst at Air Apps, you will be responsible for analyzing and interpreting data to drive business insights and optimize product performance. You will create reports, dashboards, and performance metrics to help teams make informed decisions and improve user experience.

This role requires a data-driven mindset, strong analytical skills, and experience with visualization tools to turn complex data into actionable insights.

Responsibilities


Analyze user behavior, product performance, and key business metrics to identify trends and opportunities.
Create and maintain interactive dashboards and reports using tools like Tableau, Looker, Power BI, or Google Data Studio.
Collect, clean, and structure large datasets to ensure accuracy and usability.
Define and track KPIs for marketing, product, and business performance.
Work with SQL, Python, or R to extract, analyze, and manipulate data.
Collaborate with product managers, engineers, and marketing teams to provide data-driven insights.
Conduct A/B testing and experiment analysis to improve product features and user engagement.
Identify bottlenecks and opportunities in user journeys and customer funnels.
Present findings in a clear and compelling way to stakeholders and leadership teams.
Stay up to date with industry trends, analytics best practices, and emerging data tools.


Requirements


Around 3+ years of experience in data analysis, business intelligence, or a related field.
Proficiency in SQL for data querying and manipulation.
Experience with data visualization tools (Tableau, Looker, Power BI, Google Data Studio).
Strong analytical skills with experience in Python or R for data analysis.
Knowledge of A/B testing methodologies and statistical analysis.
Experience with Google Analytics, Mixpanel, Amplitude, or similar user analytics tools.
Strong problem-solving skills and ability to communicate insights to non-technical stakeholders.
Experience working with large datasets and cloud-based data warehouses (BigQuery, Redshift, Snowflake).
Familiarity with ETL processes and data pipeline optimization is a plus.
Ability to work in a fast-paced, data-driven environment and manage multiple projects.


What benefits are we offering?


Remote-first approach with flexible working hours.
Apple hardware ecosystem for work.
Flexible Paid Time Off (PTO) to support work-life balance.
Annual Bonus.
Top-tier Health Insurance for peace of mind.
Public Transportation Pass to support your commute needs.
Coverflex benefits package for meal allowances, well-being, and more.
Air Conference 2025 in Las Vegas - an opportunity to meet the team, collaborate, and grow together.


Diversity & Inclusion

At Air Apps, we are committed to fostering a diverse, inclusive, and equitable workplace. We enthusiastically welcome applicants from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We celebrate diversity in all its forms and believe that varied voices and experiences make us stronger.

Application Disclaimer

At Air Apps, we value transparency and integrity in our hiring process. Applicants must submit their own work without any AI-generated assistance. Any use of AI in application materials, assessments, or interviews will result in disqualification.

Title: Analista de Dados Reporting e Tranformação
Description:
Muito Gosto! Somos o Grupo DATA!

O nosso propósito é simplificar a vida dos nossos clientes e fazemos isso em todo o mundo, através das nossas soluções de TI.

Somos uma multinacional, que opera ativamente em Portugal, e estamos em constante expansão!

Adoramos trabalhar com grandes empresas e fazer crescer as empresas com as quais colaboramos.

Comprometemo-nos a ser a mudança que queremos ver nas grandes corporações do mercado, começando por valorizar as pessoas e as suas ideias.

Já percebemos que não existe apenas uma maneira de fazer as coisas funcionarem, que cada um dos nossos colaboradores tem características únicas e que, para trabalhar em equipa, precisamos realmente de nos conhecer.

Quem procuramos?

Principais Tarefas a Desenvolver


Acompanhar e monitorizar a performance de operações, de forma a assegurar a qualidade do serviço prestado end-to-end.
Recolher e sistematizar dados operacionais das diferentes áreas da DGR, elaborando relatórios para diferentes intervenientes (i.e. controlo interno, clientes, fornecedores, etc.)
Desenvolver e implementar procedimentos para auditorias aleatórias e regulares das intervenções no terreno, incluindo atividades como a preparação de checklists de auditoria, a programação de auditorias e a análise inicial dos resultados.
Identificar os equipamentos xTM que não cumprem os requisitos mínimos de rede
Acompanhar o estado atual do hardware dos componentes e terminais, identificando falhas ou necessidades de atualizações para garantir a operacionalidade
Gerir o funcionamento da rede xTM, i.e, atualização na rede das últimas versões de software autorizadas para xTM, e controlo e verificação de BIOS, bitlockers, templates, lista de fallbacks e IMs ativos
Auxiliar na análise das funcionalidades críticas dos sistemas de suporte à operação, contribuindo com insights para garantir a escalabilidade e flexibilidade
Identificar, criar e acompanhar as evoluções (EVs) junto das equipas de desenvolvimento.


Competências e Conhecimentos Técnicos Obrigatórios


Domínio de ferramentas Microsoft Office (preferencialmente Access e Excel)
Capacidade de comunicação oral e escrita e domínio da língua Inglesa;
Conhecimentos de POWER BI.


Competências e Conhecimentos Técnicos Desejáveis


Análise Crítica: capacidade de identificar e questionar a precisão e relevância das informações observadas, sendo capaz de identificar tendências, padrões e anomalias
Capacidade Analítica: capacidade de analisar as relações entre as diferentes partes de uma situação, estabelecendo ligações causais, nomeadamente ao nível dos sistemas de suporte à operação
Conhecimento Técnico: deve ter profundo conhecimento das especificações, funcionamento e requisitos técnicos dos sistemas de xTM. bem como do negócio da DGR
Domínio de Sistemas: capacidade de utilizar e profundo conhecimento das ferramentas que suportam a gestão e análise de dados, nomeadamente Excel e Access e Power BI
Resolução de Problemas: capacidade de gerir incidentes de forma totalmente autónoma considerando todas as informações e agindo de forma adequada face aos incidentes identificados
Show more

Title: Lead Data Analyst
Description:
At Gopuff, we’re not just delivering convenience—we’re redefining how the world shops. Since pioneering instant needs in 2013, we’ve empowered millions of customers across the U.S. and U.K. to reclaim their time through seamless, fast, and reliable delivery. Behind this transformative journey is our tech-first mindset, relentless obsession with customer experience and operational excellence.

Now, we’re building something even bigger. We’re establishing a core hub in Lisbon, Portugal and we’re looking for an exceptional Lead Data Analyst to shape the future of quick commerce.

This is not just a job—it’s a mission. As a Lead Data Analyst, you’ll own the transformation of raw data into game-changing insights, fuelling the decisions that drive our business forward.

You’ll partner with cross-functional teams, challenge the status quo and make high-impact recommendations that influence company-wide KPIs. With your mastery of SQL, Python and advanced analytics, you won’t just support decisions—you’ll lead them.

We believe great work happens through collaboration, not competition. You foster a culture of curiosity, respect, and shared success, ensuring data is a tool for empowerment, not gatekeeping. No room for arrogance—just a commitment to helping others and making an impact together.

If you’re a high-performer who thrives in fast-paced, high-impact environments, this is your chance to build, innovate, and leave a lasting mark on one of the most disruptive industries in the world.

Are you ready to shape the future of commerce? Let’s go. 🚀

You Will:


Analyse and enhance key metrics across customer acquisition, retention, and revenue generation to drive business efficiency, optimise cost-effectiveness, and elevate customer satisfaction.
Develop and maintain advanced data models using dbt to deliver transparency and clarity into core business performance metrics, ensuring alignment with strategic KPIs.
Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams—including Category Management, Growth, and Finance—to translate data insights into actionable strategies that improve processes and drive measurable outcomes.
Conduct deep dives into company performance to identify areas for improvement, uncover opportunities for efficiency, and ensure KPIs align with overarching business objectives.
Solve complex, real-world challenges by leveraging data to deliver practical solutions that enhance operational excellence and fuel company growth.
Present data insights in a clear and compelling manner to both technical and non-technical stakeholders, ensuring decisions are informed by robust analysis.


You Have:


Proven Data Analytics Expertise: 3-5 years of hands-on experience in data analytics, ideally in a fast-paced, high-growth e-commerce or retail environment, where you’ve delivered impactful insights that drive business success.
Fluency in English: Exceptional communication skills in English, enabling you to effectively collaborate with global teams and present complex data insights to diverse audiences.
Outstanding Technical Skills: Advanced proficiency in SQL, Python, Looker, and dbt, with a proven track record of querying large datasets, building complex reports, and developing scalable data models that empower decision-making.
Mastery of Data Visualisation and Reporting Tools: Deep familiarity with tools like Looker, Tableau, or Power BI, with a talent for transforming raw data into strategic insights and actionable recommendations.
Analytical Problem-Solver: A natural problem-solver with a passion for tackling complex business challenges, identifying opportunities for improvement, and delivering innovative, data-driven solutions.
High-Performing and Self-Motivated: A self-starter who thrives in dynamic environments, consistently pushing boundaries to deliver excellence and make a tangible impact on the business.
Strong Communicator: Ability to present data insights clearly and persuasively to both technical and non-technical stakeholders, including leadership.


Company Summary & EEOC Statement:

At Gopuff, we know that life can be unpredictable. Sometimes you forget the milk at the store, run out of pet food for Fido, or just really need ice cream at 11 pm. We get it—stuff happens. But that’s where we come in, delivering all your wants and needs in just minutes.

And now, we’re assembling a team of motivated people to help us drive forward that vision to bring a new age of convenience and predictability to an unpredictable world.

Like what you’re hearing? Then join us on Team Blue.

Gopuff is an equal employment opportunity employer, committed to an inclusive workplace where we do not discriminate on the basis of race, sex, gender, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital or familial status, age, ancestry, disability, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws. We believe in diversity and encourage any qualified individual to apply.
Show more

Since pioneering instant needs in 2013, we’ve empowered millions of customers across the U.S. and U.K. to reclaim their time through seamless, fast, and reliable delivery. Behind this transformative journey is our tech-first mindset, relentless obsession with customer experience and operational excellence.

Now, we’re building something even bigger. We’re establishing a core hub in Lisbon, Portugal and we’re looking for an exceptional Lead Data Analyst to shape the future of quick commerce.

This is not just a job—it’s a mission. As a Lead Data Analyst, you’ll own the transformation of raw data into game-changing insights, fuelling the decisions that drive our business forward.

You’ll partner with cross-functional teams, challenge the status quo and make high-impact recommendations that influence company-wide KPIs. With your mastery of SQL, Python and advanced analytics, you won’t just support decisions—you’ll lead them.

We believe great work happens through collaboration, not competition. You foster a culture of curiosity, respect, and shared success, ensuring data is a tool for empowerment, not gatekeeping. No room for arrogance—just a commitment to helping others and making an impact together.

If you’re a high-performer who thrives in fast-paced, high-impact environments, this is your chance to build, innovate, and leave a lasting mark on one of the most disruptive industries in the world.

Are you ready to shape the future of commerce? Let’s go. 🚀

You Will:

  • Analyse and enhance key metrics across customer acquisition, retention, and revenue generation to drive business efficiency, optimise cost-effectiveness, and elevate customer satisfaction.
  • Develop and maintain advanced data models using dbt to deliver transparency and clarity into core business performance metrics, ensuring alignment with strategic KPIs.
  • Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams—including Category Management, Growth, and Finance—to translate data insights into actionable strategies that improve processes and drive measurable outcomes.
  • Conduct deep dives into company performance to identify areas for improvement, uncover opportunities for efficiency, and ensure KPIs align with overarching business objectives.
  • Solve complex, real-world challenges by leveraging data to deliver practical solutions that enhance operational excellence and fuel company growth.
  • Present data insights in a clear and compelling manner to both technical and non-technical stakeholders, ensuring decisions are informed by robust analysis.

You Have:

  • Proven Data Analytics Expertise: 3-5 years of hands-on experience in data analytics, ideally in a fast-paced, high-growth e-commerce or retail environment, where you’ve delivered impactful insights that drive business success.
  • Fluency in English: Exceptional communication skills in English, enabling you to effectively collaborate with global teams and present complex data insights to diverse audiences.
  • Outstanding Technical Skills: Advanced proficiency in SQL, Python, Looker, and dbt, with a proven track record of querying large datasets, building complex reports, and developing scalable data models that empower decision-making.
  • Mastery of Data Visualisation and Reporting Tools: Deep familiarity with tools like Looker, Tableau, or Power BI, with a talent for transforming raw data into strategic insights and actionable recommendations.
  • Analytical Problem-Solver: A natural problem-solver with a passion for tackling complex business challenges, identifying opportunities for improvement, and delivering innovative, data-driven solutions.
  • High-Performing and Self-Motivated: A self-starter who thrives in dynamic environments, consistently pushing boundaries to deliver excellence and make a tangible impact on the business.
  • Strong Communicator: Ability to present data insights clearly and persuasively to both technical and non-technical stakeholders, including leadership.

Company Summary & EEOC Statement:

At Gopuff, we know that life can be unpredictable. Sometimes you forget the milk at the store, run out of pet food for Fido, or just really need ice cream at 11 pm. We get it—stuff happens. But that’s where we come in, delivering all your wants and needs in just minutes.

And now, we’re assembling a team of motivated people to help us drive forward that vision to bring a new age of convenience and predictability to an unpredictable world.

Like what you’re hearing? Then join us on Team Blue.

Gopuff is an equal employment opportunity employer, committed to an inclusive workplace where we do not discriminate on the basis of race, sex, gender, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital or familial status, age, ancestry, disability, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws. We believe in diversity and encourage any qualified individual to apply.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Req Number: 88940

Time Type: Full Time

PLEASE REMEMBER TO CLICK "APPLY" BUTTON AFTER SAVING YOUR PROFILE TO COMPLETE YOUR APPLICATION PROCESS.

Your responsibilities:



Perform in-depth data profiling and analysis to uncover patterns, anomalies, and inconsistencies in data.
Collaborate with data engineers, data scientists, and business analysts to define data requirements and ensure data quality.
Develop and execute data validation and verification processes to document and improve data integrity and quality.
Create detailed reports and visualizations to communicate data profiling results and insights.
Provide recommendations for improving data quality, consistency, and usability.



Our requirements:



Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, or a related field.
Minimum 2–4 years of experience in data profiling, data analysis, or a similar role.
Proficiency in SQL for querying and analysing large datasets.
Experience with data profiling tools (e.g., Databricks, or similar).
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with attention to detail.
Excellent communication skills to effectively present findings to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Familiarity with data quality frameworks and concepts such as data cleansing, data governance, and master data management.
Knowledge of programming languages like Python or R for data analysis (preferred). Excellent level of written and spoken English



What we offer:



Challenges in an international environment
Career development opportunities
Internal training catalogue
Permanent contract
Private medical care
Comprehensive onboarding program
Buddy
Scandinavian work culture
Work-life balance
Culture of feedback
Work schedule 35h/week
Hybrid and flexible work
Good access to public transports



DSV - Transporte Global e Logística

A DSV é um local de trabalho dinâmico que promove a inclusão e a diversidade. Conduzimos os nossos negócios com integridade, respeitando as diferentes culturas, dignidade e os direitos dos indivíduos. Ao ingressar na DSV, você estará a trabalhar para uma das empresas com melhor desempenho no setor de transporte e logística. Você irá juntar-se a uma equipe talentosa com aproximadamente 75.000 colaboradores em mais de 80 países, trabalhando com paixão para oferecer ótimas experiências aos clientes e serviços de alta qualidade. A DSV aspira liderar o caminho para um futuro mais sustentável para nossa indústria e está comprometida em negociar respeitando os termos da natureza.

Promovemos a colaboração e transparência e esforçamo-nos para atrair, motivar e reter pessoas talentosas numa cultura de respeito. Se você é motivado, talentoso e deseja fazer parte de uma organização progressiva e versátil, apoiá-lo-emos nas suas necessidades para alcançar o seu potencial e avançar na sua carreira.

Visite dsv.com e siga-nos no LinkedIn, Facebook e Twitter.

Title: Data Analyst (SAS)
HTML:
Your connection with Aubay starts in the following lines:

Aubay Portugal is a multinational French company, in Portugal since 2007. We have offices in Lisbon and Oporto and we are a specialized consultant in Management, Implementation, Development and Maintenance of Information Systems. We have more than 150 active partners and we operate in sectors such as banking, insurance, telecommunications, services, energy and transports.


What are we looking for?

  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field;
  • 1+ years of experience as a Data Analyst;
  • Experience in SAS Guide, SAS DIS, SQL, and SAS Programming;
  • Fluent in English.


What do we have to offer you?

  • Health Insurance;
  • Feedback&Coffee – the system that includes Aubay’s Performance Management Cycle, with regular moments of feedback and the Career Progression Model;
  • Working model: Hybrid;
  • A Training Academy designed to think of you and your needs. You can count on technical and behavioural training sessions (e-Learning and classroom), Meet&Techs, Webinars and Mentoring;
  • Events and Teambuildings.


What makes us different?

  • Our organizational culture is based on values such as transparency, team spirit, regular feedback and continuous learning;
  • Reference prizes and birthday present;
  • Lounge;
  • We don’t have a dress code;
  • We know your name and all address each other informally;
  • Coffee and varied snacks at your disposal;
  • You will grow in good company.Isn’t this one of the ways in which to develop professionally?


If we got your attention, we now hope to spark your enthusiasm. Ready for the first phase? We are waiting for you at daniela.lesco@aubay.pt.


Os dados pessoais recolhidos pela AUBAY PORTUGAL SA relativos à identificação, contacto e habilitação dos candidatos, enquanto responsável pelo tratamento e do co-responsável de tratamento usado no âmbito do presente procedimento, serão utilizados para efeitos de Candidatura para integração na equipa, considerando que os mesmos se destinam à execução de diligências pré-contratuais a pedido do titular dos dados;

Os dados remetidos através da presente aplicação, detido pela AUBAY serão mantidos durante o processo de recrutamento em curso, e serão guardados para as finalidades indicadas, enquanto considerados atualizados (um ano).

Os dados recolhidos poderão ser transmitidos ou incluir outras atividades de tratamento, mediante informação do respetivo titular, na decorrência normal de um processo de recrutamento e seleção, podendo igualmente vir a ser conservados para o cumprimento de quaisquer obrigações legais, pelo prazo previsto na legislação aplicável.

Para o exercício de qualquer direito relativo à proteção de dados pessoais, pode contactar a AUBAY PORTUGAL, com sede na Avenida Duque D`Ávila, nº46 em Lisboa ou o Encarregado de Proteção de Dados através do seu e-mail dpo@aubay.pt, podendo ainda exercer os seus direitos junto da Autoridade Nacional de Proteção de Dados competente – www.cnpd.pt.

(*Não incluir dados relativos a origem racial ou étnica, opiniões políticas, convicções religiosas ou filosóficas, filiação sindical, dados genéticos, dados biométricos, dados relativos à saúde, dados relativos à vida sexual ou orientação sexual ou relacionados com condenações penais e infracções)

Title: Business Intelligence Consultant
HTML:
Who are we:

Neotalent Conclusion is one of the leading Iberian specialists providing services in Information Technology and Engineering services. As part of the Netherlands-based organization Conclusion, which has an ecosystem of over 25 companies and 3,600 employees, we are focused on increasing the technological capacity of our clients and the digital transformation of their application ecosystems.

We are talent specialists, attracting the best people and combining them with the needs of the most ambitious projects, at the right time. Our success comes from our investments in innovation, our focus on results, and, above all, the guarantee that our people will have happy and rewarding careers.

With over 25 years of solid experience, Neotalent Conclusion has established its presence in key locations, including Lisbon, Porto, and Madrid. The company currently has more than 950 professionals in the different areas in which it operates.


Neotalent, the responsive people.


Find out more about us at www.neotalent.pt.


Role Overview:


We are looking for a BI Consultant to join our teams in one of the largest insurance groups in the world, present in 64 countries. Based in Lisbon (Hybrid). This professional will be responsible for an analytics area in digital transformation projects being integrated in a BI team with a strong component of information modeling, Big Data and dashboarding in PowerBI and to lead the creation of the reference architecture for IT solutions.


What you will do:

  • Develop, design, and implement ETL processes to integrate data from various sources;
  • Analyze business requirements, data sources, and data models to create data integration solutions;
  • Build and maintain data pipelines to move and transform data across systems;
  • Ensure data accuracy, completeness, and consistency across data sources;
  • Optimize ETL performance to improve data processing times;
  • Create and maintain documentation for ETL processes and data flows;
  • Develop and maintain reports and dashboards using Power BI;
  • Stay up to date with the latest BI tools, trends, and best practices to enhance data-driven decision making.


What you are like:

  • Professional experience in Business Intelligence projects with suite Microsoft;
  • Experience as a team leader in different contexts and clients;
  • Experience with SQL Server, SSIS, SSRS, SSAS, PowerBI and Azure Synapse;
  • Experience in the design and implementation of modern MCSFT BI architectures;
  • Experience in Fabric is highly preferred;
  • Excellent team collaboration skills;
  • Excellent problem-framing, problem-solving and project management skills
  • Fluency in written/spoken English and Portuguese.


Why join us:

  • Work on challenging projects for big clients
  • Learn more about emerging technologies
  • Possibility of working remotely
  • Design your career plan
  • Access to continuous training and certifications
  • Evolve through our internal mobility program
  • … and much more!

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
Noesis Is Looking For Candidates With The Following Profile

  • Bachelor’s degree or higher in Mathematics, Computer Science, Management Informatics or equivalent;
  • Minimum 2 years of professional experience mining data as a Data Analyst;
  • Good analytics skills, including mining, modelling logical and conceptual, evaluation and data visualization;
  • Strong Power BI, SQL or Excel skills, with aptitude for learning other analytics tools;
  • Dynamism, proactivity and ability to work in a team;
  • Customer oriented;
  • Fluency in English will be valued.

If you meet these conditions and would like to join an innovative organization that continuously invests in training its talents, send us your application.

Join us. Let's innovate together!

All our recruitment and selection processes are based on equal opportunities, valuing the competence and potential of each person and ensuring that no candidate is discriminated on the grounds of gender, ethnicity, sexual orientation, age, religion or physical condition.

Title: Data Analyst (Arch Data) (M/F) - Remote
HTML:
Sysmatch is an IT Consultancy and Outsourcing Company with a wide range of technological skills, resulting from the accumulation of know-how and the experience of our consultants, allowing the implementation of solutions adapted to the needs of our clients, privileging their robustness and scalability.More than two decades in the IT market, we present ourselves as a flexible, adaptable, innovative and forward-looking Company.At the moment we are looking for the following candidate:Data Analyst (Arch Data) (m/f)

  • RemoteMandatory:Experience with Data Analysis and Data Governace; Experience withPython, SQL, and any Dashboard/ Reporting tool; Experience withArch Data.What we offer:- A dynamic project in a well-regarded client at an international level;
  • Salary classification according to the experience shown;
  • Career development with intervention in ambitious and innovative technological projects;
  • Good working environment with young and dynamic teams;
  • Personalized follow-up to each consultant;
  • Integration into Sysmatch staff with access to all company activities;
  • You will be part of our trainings and Team Building events;
  • A network of hundreds of partnerships with companies in countless sectors that offer you exclusive discounts (health, wellness, travel, gastronomy, culture, leisure, training, etc).Recruitment, selection and integration process:The first contacts will be made by phone call or video call.We are prepared to ensure the monitoring and integration of new employees and support them in this new phase of their professional career.To respond to this opportunity, please send us your CV, indicating the reference PC/DA/E to the following email address ******

Title: Power BI Consultant
HTML:
Are you the NEX T Power BI Consultant?


What we value:

  • Minimum of 2 years' experience with Power BI;
  • Proficiency in SQL;
  • Experience with Agile methodologies;​
  • Portuguese is mandatory;
  • English language skills are valued.


What we offer you:

  • Dynamic and professional team;
  • Opportunity to participate in local or international projects;
  • Personalized support;
  • Training plan tailored to your needs;
  • Career progression and development guidance;
  • Opportunity to be oart of a rapidly growing team.


Email your CV to your@nextengineering.pt with the reference SMA.

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Farfetch is a leading global marketplace for the luxury fashion industry. The Farfetch Marketplace connects customers in over 190 countries and territories with items from more than 50 countries and over 1,400 of the world’s best brands, boutiques, and department stores, delivering a truly unique shopping experience and access to the most extensive selection of luxury on a global marketplace.

OPERATIONS
We're passionate about operational excellence, acting with our customers and partners always in our heart. Covering the entire order journey, we create our online content, secure payments and fraud process compliance, ensure order fulfilment and delivery, while providing customer and partner care. In a nutshell, we love to create seamless and memorable luxury experiences for our customers all around the world.

PORTO
Our office is near Porto, in the north of Portugal, and is located in a vibrant business hub. It offers a dynamic and welcoming environment where our employees can connect and network with a large community of tech professionals.

THE ROLE
Reporting to the Analytics Manager, you’ll help solve complex data challenges and work with a wide range of tools to build accurate, scalable and innovative data solutions. With your analytical expertise and strong problem solving skills you’ll help the FintechOps department make better decisions with data!

What You'll Do


Tackle complex data problems with a variety of tools and implement innovative and scalable solutions
Leverage your proficiency in tools such as BigQuery, dbt and Python to efficiently extract and transform raw datasets into structured and usable formats
Build and maintain data models, reports and dashboards in BigQuery and Looker to provide stakeholders with relevant and timely information
Apply advanced statistical and analytical techniques to extract meaningful insights from large datasets
Proactively identify and resolve data-related issues, ensuring the reliability and integrity of analytical outputs
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business requirements and to implement data-driven solutions
Communicate complex findings in a clear and understandable manner to both technical and non-technical stakeholders





Who You Are


A bachelor's degree and a minimum of two years of relevant experience are required. Equivalent combinations of education and experience will be considered
Proficiency in SQL (SQL Server, BigQuery, or similar)
Experience using data visualisation tools (Looker, PowerBI, Tableau, or similar)
Knowledge of statistical programming languages like Python and/or R is a nice to have
Ability to work autonomously in solving complex technical problems
Detail-oriented with a focus on data accuracy and quality
Excellent communication skills with the ability to convey technical concepts to a non-technical audience
Advanced in English, both written and oral





Rewards & Benefits


Health insurance for the whole family, flexible working environment and well-being support and tools
Extra days off, sabbatical program and days for you to give back for the community
Training opportunities and free access to Udemy
Flexible benefits program





EQUAL OPPORTUNITIES STATEMENT


FARFETCH is committed to being an inclusive workplace where diversity in all its forms is celebrated. We make employment decisions without regard to race, religious creed, color, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, ancestry, marital status, medical condition as defined by state law, physical or mental disability, military service or veteran status, pregnancy, childbirth and related medical conditions, genetic information or any other classification protected by applicable federal, state or local laws or ordinances. If you require special accommodation, please let us know





SCAM DISCLAIMER


It has come to our attention that there may be fraudulent activities involving individuals or organizations falsely claiming to represent Farfetch in order to attract candidates to a SCAM. Please be aware that Farfetch does not conduct recruitment processes through messaging apps or any unofficial communication channels, other than our official careers website. Additionally, Farfetch will never ask candidates for any form of payment during the recruitment process

  • Experience using data visualisation tools (Looker, PowerBI, Tableau, or similar)
  • Knowledge of statistical programming languages like Python and/or R
  • Ability to work autonomously in solving complex technical problems
  • Detail-oriented with a focus on data accuracy and quality
  • Excellent communication skills with the ability to convey technical concepts to a non-technical audience
  • Advanced in English, both written and oral




Rewards & Benefits

  • Health insurance for the whole family, flexible working environment and well-being support and tools
  • Extra days off, sabbatical program and days for you to give back for the community
  • Training opportunities and free access to Udemy
  • Flexible benefits program




EQUAL OPPORTUNITIES STATEMENT

  • FARFETCH is committed to being an inclusive workplace where diversity in all its forms is celebrated. We make employment decisions without regard to race, religious creed, color, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, ancestry, marital status, medical condition as defined by state law, physical or mental disability, military service or veteran status, pregnancy, childbirth and related medical conditions, genetic information or any other classification protected by applicable federal, state or local laws or ordinances. If you require special accommodation, please let us know




SCAM DISCLAIMER

  • It has come to our attention that there may be fraudulent activities involving individuals or organizations falsely claiming to represent Farfetch in order to attract candidates to a SCAM. Please be aware that Farfetch does not conduct recruitment processes through messaging apps or any unofficial communication channels, other than our official careers website. Additionally, Farfetch will never ask candidates for any form of payment during the recruitment process

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Back in 1966, in Marseilles, when the world was talking about Start Trek 🚀, Sodexo was serving its first customers, initiating our journey in the Quality-of-Life Services leaded by the bold Pierre Bellon.




Since then, we continued our adventure of offering everyday need solutions, improving the life of our users across the globe 🌎 supported by more than 400 thousand dedicated and brave colleagues, in 64 countries, that lead us to where we are today.




🇵🇹 Portugal is no exception and 5 years ago, our shared service center – Sodexo Business Services – SBS, was born! In here, you will have the chance to be part of several 📊🧾Financial teams like Record to Report, Order to Cash, Purchase to Pay, Financial Analysis, Master Data, among others, that support European markets, making sure the business continues to growth.







💥 Are you bold enough to join our crew, with your unique character and ideas, and make us even bigger?




💼 We are waiting for you! And so, your career!




In the meantime, check the opportunity below:




Senior Data Analyst




This position is responsible for gathering, analyzing, and interpreting complex data to help drive strategic decisions and optimize business processes. The role involves transforming raw data into actionable insights, developing reports and dashboards, and supporting the organization in identifying trends and opportunities for growth.




⚙ What will you do?

Primary tasks:

Create, restructure, and manage large datasets, files, and systems.
Develop clear and actionable visualizations through Power BI dashboards.
Filter, clean, and validate data, ensuring data accuracy and implementing performance indicators to identify and correct issues.
Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex datasets with minimal guidance.
Present her/his findings to stakeholders in a clear and concise communication.




Secondary tasks:

Work closely with management to prioritize business and information needs.
Build stakeholder understanding of data usage and its impact on business decisions.
Apply business logic to guide analysis, synthesize findings, and deliver clear, actionable insights.
Follow standardized processes established by the Sodexo Data Factory.
Document data processing decisions and summarize data quality in technical memos.Support implementation of continuous improvement processes for stakeholders.
Continuously enhance technical skills and explore new technologies to stay current with industry advancements.




🤙 What you'll need to succeed?:

Bachelor’s degree in statistics, mathematics, economics, education, social sciences, or related fields required with two or more years of relevant work experience. Master’s degree preferred.
5/8 years of experience as a Data Analyst or in a similar , with a record of analyzing large datasets and delivering actionable insights.
Strong experience in using business intelligence tools, especially Power BI for data visualization and reporting.
Proficient in data manipulation and query languages, particularly SQL.
Strong knowledge of DBT, Databricks, or other data transformation & pipeline tools.
Proven ability to translate business needs into data models and analytics solutions.
Prior experience working in a data-driven environment and contributing to decision-making through analytics
Strong analytical skills with attention to detail and accuracy.
Strong problem-solving abilities with the capacity to approach complex data challenges methodically.
Excellent communication skills to explain data insights and their business impact to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Ability to work independently and manage multiple tasks while maintaining clear focus on business outcomes.
A proactive mindset with a passion for continuous learning and staying updated on new technologies and methodologies.







🎉 What we have to offer you?

Hybrid working model;
Flexible working hours;
Health & Life Insurance;
Attractive Meal allowance paid in Meal Card;
Additional Days off: extra vacation day, employee’s birthday, volunteering day;
More than 6000 free online courses;
Opportunity to grow professionally inside the Company;
Possibility to participate in multicultural projects;
Several internal activities aiming to promote our team´s wellbeing.




We are waiting for you!




Send us your CV to our email Recruitment.SBS.Portugal@sodexo.com with the title of the role on the subject and check all the opportunities on our career website (https://www.sodexo.com/en/contact-us/sbs-porto/porto-jobs)




Find out more about Sodexo: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XX7PoE9kazU




Sodexo is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment.

At Sodexo we believe in Privacy and your Privacy is very important to us that´s why your personal data will only be used for the purpose of managing our recruitment process, will be processed in accordance to the GDPR and treated confidentially. For further information about how we process your personal data please reach out to privacy.sbs@sodexo.com.
