Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We’re looking for the special, unique and amazing YOU!

🚀 We’re looking for the special, unique, and amazing YOU! ✨

💡 @ KCS IT, we seek those who stand out 🌟, those who always strive to be better 💪 and fight for it 🏆. We value individuals who share our core principles:

🔥 Dedication

⚡ Energy

🤝 Integrity & Transparency

🔄 Flexibility

🛡️ Trust & Honesty

💼 Hard Work & Proactivity

👥 Teamwork

At KCS IT, we champion equality and embrace diversity 🌍🌈. We foster a safe, inclusive environment where opportunities are equal for all!

❌ We do not discriminate based on age, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender, disability, or any factor other than merit.

📩 All applications with relevant skills are welcome! 🚀

We are looking for an Amazing: Data analyst

Seniority: Middle senior

Type of position: Hybrid

The amazing you, will have:

4+ years of experience as a Data Analyst or in a similar role.
Proficiency in SSIS (SQL Server Integration Services) for ETL development.
Strong experience with SSAS (SQL Server Analysis Services) for data modeling.
Hands-on expertise in SSRS (SQL Server Reporting Services) for report generation.
Solid experience with SQL for data querying and manipulation.
Strong analytical mindset and ability to translate data into actionable insights.
Experience in working with large datasets and optimizing queries for performance.
Fluent in English (both written and spoken).

Preferred Skills

Experience with Power BI or other data visualization tools.
Familiarity with cloud platforms such as Azure or AWS.
Knowledge of data governance and best practices in data management.
Strong problem-solving and critical-thinking skills.




Why should you become part of our family?

You can develop a career that fits you: your career development is personalized, taking in consideration your needs and goals from a short to long term
Interesting Challenges Ahead: you can work for several clients from different sectors of activity
Free training programs: Our training and certification programs in languages, tech, behavior and business will help you to reach your full potential faster
International projects in Benelux: you can gain international experience in Benelux and balance a new way of living with work
Type of projects (depending on the project you might find one of this types of projects):
In hybrid Systems: Is important to balance work with socialization, that´s why a hybrid system works for us and for you
Full Remote projects: If you want to work while you enjoy the comfort of your home
Full Onsite projects: if you prefere the company of your colleagues!
Take care of your well-being: Enjoy our free nutrition, psicologist, general medicine appointments and our yoga and personal training days… all remote!







Who are we?

Founded in 2008 and based in Lisbon, KCS IT is a consulting company in the field of Information Technology and Services, focused on creating value for our clients through three main areas: Consulting, Outsourcing, Inovation and Training. Our commitment to talent development is unmistakable in the recent opening of the Porto, Leiria and Azores hubs, which aims to develop technology for the national and international market. Since 2018 we have been elected one of the 10 major companies in the “Index of Excellence”, an initiative that aims to reward organizations that invest most in the development and satisfaction of their employees.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Decskill, founded in 2014 as an IT Consulting Company, places paramount importance on its greatest asset: its people. Our main mission is to deliver value through knowledge and talent, and we achieve this by fostering a culture of excellence and investing in the development and well-being of our people. With over 600 dedicated professionals and offices in Lisbon, Porto, Madrid, and Luxembourg, Decskill operates across three core areas:




DECSKILL TALENT: We believe that our people are key to our success. Through Decskill Talent, we empower our team to embrace the digital transformation challenges of our clients. We collaborate with clients to drive innovation, ensuring project success and business growth
DECSKILL BOOST: Equipping our team with the latest tools and methodologies, we optimize Time-to-Market and deliver innovative solutions exceeding client expectations.
DECSKILL CONNECT: Our team collaborates closely with clients to implement and manage IT infrastructures that generate long-term value.







At Decskill, we believe that by nurturing and empowering our people to confront the challenges of digital transformation, we create value not only for our clients but also for our entire ecosystem, fostering a digital community dedicated to growth and progress.




We are looking for a Data Analyst to join us in Porto.




Requirements:

BS/MS Degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Applied Math, or a similar area.
Experience in data workflow creation (data preparation and data reconciliation) in Alteryx or similar data analytics tools, for example Dataiku, Knime.
Experience with Business Intelligence - Data visualization tools, mainly Power BI
Experience to develop and maintain Power Apps and Power Automate solutions
Good knowledge about SQL.
Good level of English - minimum B2
Able to be quickly autonomous, proactive
Desire to learn more about new technologies as Power Platform and Dataiku.
A real passion for learning, doing things better and helping others;
Availability to travel abroad for short periods of time, as required.




If you’re interested in this job please send your CV in English to goncalo.delgado@decskill.com with reference “GD / Data Analyst”.







Decskill is committed to equality and non-discrimination with all our talents. We recruit and promote talent, based on diversity and inclusion, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, race, nationality or any other form of discrimination incompatible with the dignity of the human being.

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
Missão: Planear, monitorizar e participar nas atividades e projetos de Análise de Dados no âmbito da sua área de atuação. Integrar equipas multidisciplinares e ágeis, no contexto de Expertise Center, que tenham por objetivo resolver desafios e problemas de negócio, através da tecnologia.


Principais Responsabilidades:

  • Desenvolvimento de Pipelines de ETL (Extract, Transform, Load): Criar processos para extrair dados de várias fontes, transformá-los conforme necessário (por exemplo, limpeza e formatação) e carregá-los em base de dados ou data lakes.
  • Automação de Fluxos de Dados: Automatizar o processamento de dados, assegurando que as informações são disponibilizadas aos clientes internos em tempo útil.
  • Criar e atualizar bases de dados eficientes e escaláveis, com domínio do SQL (Structured Query Language), permitindo que os dados sejam armazenados de forma estruturada e de fácil acesso.
  • Criar e manter data lakes e data warehouses, utilizando tecnologias como Microsoft Azure.
  • Identificar oportunidades para reduzir os custos associados ao armazenamento e processamento de um grande volume de dados (Big Data).


Perfil:

  • Licenciatura ou Mestrado em Engenharia Informática, Matemáticas Aplicadas ou Ciência de Computadores ou curso superior com especialização em análise de dados;
  • 2-3 anos de experiência em funções semelhantes;
  • Conhecimentos avançados de PowerBI;
  • Conhecimentos sólidos de Azure Data (Datalake; Data Factory; Databricks; Integrations Services e Analysis Services);
  • Conhecimentos em MySQL, PostgreSQL e NoSQL (preferencial);
  • Conhecimentos básicos de Python (preferencial);
  • Conhecimento em Google Data Studio (preferencial);
  • Domínio de arquiteturas de dados (ingestão, processamento, storage, exploração);
  • Metodologias ágeis de gestão de projetos (preferencial);
  • Autonomia, proatividade, criatividade, resiliência, capacidade de comunicação e empatia;
  • Foco na resolução de problemas;
  • Domínio do Inglês (falado e escrito).


Oferecemos:

Title: Data analyst
Description:
We’re looking for the special, unique and amazing YOU!

@ KCS IT, we look for the ones that stands out, for those that always wants to be better and fight for it, and for those who has the same values that we do: dedication, energy, integrity, transparency, flexibility, trust, honesty, hard work, proactivity, team work.

At KCS we stand for equality and value diversity. We create a safe, diverse environment where opportunities are equal for everyone! We do not discriminate based on age, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender, disability or any factor other than merit. All applications with skills for the position are welcome!

We are looking for an Amazing: Data analyst

Seniority: Junior (1-3 years)

Type of position: Hybrid model in Oporto. Candidates need to be already living in Portugal!

The amazing you, will have:


3+ years of experience as a Data Analyst.
Strong knowledge of SQL for querying, data extraction, and manipulation.
Familiarity with ETL processes (experience with Stambia is a plus).
Ability to work with large datasets and optimize data workflows.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Fluent in French and English (both written and spoken).
Experience with Google Cloud Platform (GCP).
Proficiency in Power BI or other data visualization tools.
Knowledge of data governance and data management best practices.
Ability to work independently in a fast-paced environment.




Why should you become part of our family?


You can develop a career that fits you: your career development is personalized, taking in consideration your needs and goals from a short to long term
Interesting Challenges Ahead: you can work for several clients from different sectors of activity
Free training programs: Our training and certification programs in languages, tech, behavior and business will help you to reach your full potential faster
International projects in Benelux: you can gain international experience in Benelux and balance a new way of living with work
Type of projects (depending on the project you might find one of this types of projects):
In hybrid Systems: Is important to balance work with socialization, that´s why a hybrid system works for us and for you
Full Remote projects: If you want to work while you enjoy the comfort of your home
Full Onsite projects: if you prefere the company of your colleagues!


Take care of your well-being: Enjoy our free nutrition, psicologist, general medicine appointments and our yoga and personal training days… all remote



Who are we?

Founded in 2008 and based in Lisbon, KCS IT is a consulting company in the field of Information Technology and Services, focused on creating value for our clients through three main areas: Consulting, Outsourcing, Inovation and Training. Our commitment to talent development is unmistakable in the recent opening of the Porto, Leiria and Azores hubs, which aims to develop technology for the national and international market. Since 2018 we have been elected one of the 10 major companies in the “Index of Excellence”, an initiative that aims to reward organizations that invest most in the development and satisfaction of their employees.

At KCS IT we defend equality and value diversity. We create a safe, diverse environment where opportunities are equal for all employees!

We do not discriminate based on age, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender, disability or any factor other than merit.

All applications with skills for the role are welcome!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
At AXIANS we seek the right talent, for the right place. We work daily to involve our people in a collaborative and inclusive environment, with a culture of proximity. Also, part of our culture is our concern for the environment and the implementation of social and environmental corporate responsibility actions.

This could be your opportunity to join a company of international scope, with a project that needs you to meet the challenges of digital transformation.

💻 THE ROLE

We are looking for a #TechTalent to work as a Data Analyst for an international project.

🙂 YOUR DAY TO DAY


Coordinate the data collection, and take in charge data analysis and transformation (ETL), and production of the data necessary for reports
Create and produce periodic or on-demand reports on Cybersecurity processes and data
Ensure data quality and continuous improvement
Take in charge some evolution topics This professional will also work closely with the Corporate IT organization and will have contact with all countries
Coordinate the data collection, and take in charge data analysis and transformation (ETL), and production of the data necessary for reports
Create and produce periodic or on-demand reports on Cybersecurity processes and data
Ensure data quality and continuous improvement
Take in charge some evolution topics
Work closely with the Corporate IT organization and will have contact with all countries.


💡 WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FOR


Academic degree in IT, Cybersecurity or other relevant area for the position
Very Good professional practice of English (French is a plus)
At least 5 years of professional experience in data analysis
Very good Expertise in Excel, Python and other ETL tools
Expertise in Power Bi is mandatory
Ability to be autonomous
Commitment to the job and the team objectives
Systematic, critical and logical thinking
Be committed, demanding and pedagogue
Strive continuously for customer satisfaction
Aim to deliver very high quality results
Respect the procedures, methodologies and directives
Good capability of managing stress and conflicts
Good listening and questioning ability
Ability to plan work ahead and to prioritize workload
Good team working ability


⭐ WHAT YOU CAN EXPECT FROM US

Stable professional career

Working with Axians projects becomes an asset to those of us who want to offer stability through a secure career.

Prospects for career advancement

You can access training and new certifications that will further elevate your skills. The 360° evaluation from managers and peers will also allow you to evolve.

Work Life Balance

By collaborating with Axians, you will be able to reconcile work and family requirements without neglecting either area.

Attractive, Evolving Compensation

When working with Axians, you will have access to performance bonuses in addition to an attractive salary pack (base salary + benefits). You are also entitled to health insurance and free psychology consultations.

Do you identify with this position?

If you think this position is the right fit for you and you have the #TechTalent we are looking for, send us your resume, preferably in English and in Europass format, to recrutamento.axianspt@axians.com with the subject DA/AS/MO”.

Learn more about Axians

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Decskill, founded in 2014 as an IT Consulting Company, places paramount importance on its greatest asset: its people. Our main mission is to deliver value through knowledge and talent, and we achieve this by fostering a culture of excellence and investing in the development and well-being of our people. With over 600 dedicated professionals and offices in Lisbon, Porto, Madrid, and Luxembourg, Decskill operates across three core areas:




DECSKILL TALENT: We believe that our people are key to our success. Through Decskill Talent, we empower our team to embrace the digital transformation challenges of our clients. We collaborate with clients to drive innovation, ensuring project success and business growth
DECSKILL BOOST: Equipping our team with the latest tools and methodologies, we optimize Time-to-Market and deliver innovative solutions exceeding client expectations.
DECSKILL CONNECT: Our team collaborates closely with clients to implement and manage IT infrastructures that generate long-term value.







At Decskill, we believe that by nurturing and empowering our people to confront the challenges of digital transformation, we create value not only for our clients but also for our entire ecosystem, fostering a digital community dedicated to growth and progress.




We are looking for a Data Analyst to join us in Porto.




Requirements:

Follow-up and coordination of scrum backlog features
Document the components and operation of application: Software Architecture, Technical Architecture and monitoring & alarmistic.
Have experience in L2 and L3 Support.
Good knowledge of scripting languages as Phyton or other data language.
Good knowledge of ticking system as Jira or service now.
Good knowledge of Power BI, Tableau.
Good knowledge of OLAP concepts, such as SSAS.
Good knowledge of Agile and Scrum methodologies.
Good knowledge of Data structures and algorithms.




If you’re interested in this job please send your CV in English to goncalo.delgado@decskill.com with reference “GD / Data Analyst”.







Decskill is committed to equality and non-discrimination with all our talents. We recruit and promote talent, based on diversity and inclusion, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, race, nationality or any other form of discrimination incompatible with the dignity of the human being.

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
Seeking a Data Analyst: Rhino, are you there?

At WE ARE META, we focus on finding the perfect match between our Rhinos and our clients.

Why join us?

  • Expand your network: As a consultant at We Are META, you’ll have access to a network of national and international partners across diverse sectors of the tech industry.
  • Enjoy our perks: When you join the crash you’ll have an array of benefits, to help you achieve the best work-life balance.
  • Get your perfect match: Our recruiters do their best to get the best position for you, whether in terms of working policy (remote, hybrid, on-site) or the company’s culture.
  • Personalized support: With our career coach, we assure that all your needs are being met and you’re being provided everything you need to excel in your professional life because the well-being of our Rhinos is our number one priority.

Perks Of Becoming a Rhino

  • You’ll get a welcome kit 📚
  • Opportunities for career progression 📈
  • Live on the edge with our health insurance 🏥
  • Watch your favorite shows and music with HBO and Spotify accounts 📺 🎵
  • Coverflex meal card 🍲 💳
  • Other protocols and special discounts ✨

For this position, the perfect Rhino should have the following skills:

  • BS/MS Degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Applied Math, or a similar area;
  • +5 years of experience in data workflow creation (data preparation and data reconciliation) in Alteryx or similar data analytics tools, for example Dataiku, Knime, etc;
  • Experience with Business Intelligence - Data visualization tools, mainly Power BI;
  • Experience to develop and maintain Power Apps and Power Automate solutions;
  • Good knowledge about SQL;
  • Desire to learn more about new technologies as Power Platform and Dataiku;
  • Fluency in English (C1 Level) is mandatory;
  • Fluency in French (B2 Level) is a plus;
  • Availability for a hybrid work model in Porto office's.

Become a part of the crash. In a world of unicorns, be a Rhino!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst (1 Year Maternity Cover)

€40,000 - €45,000 + 10% bonus + benefits

Porto (2 days per week in the office)




Our client




Our client is a global strategic technology and payments partner. They deliver seamless personalised shopping experiences to over 29m international shoppers, who in turn generate €22.9bn revenue.




With 2,000 employees spread across 50 countries, they integrate with 300,000 point of sale systems in a number of luxury retailers and brands including Harrods, Selfridges, John Lewis, Liberty’s, Apple, Cartier, De Beers, Hermès, Rolex, Dior and Jimmy Choo.




Their products include tax-free shopping, smart data and intelligence, marketing and sales, POS technology and payment solutions.




The role




The Data Analyst will help the business to understand customer needs and behaviours through the analysis of complex data sets and subsequent translation into meaningful, shareable insights and stories.




This role will be hands on with building visualisations in Tableau and ad hoc analysis (using SQL) to inform the optimisation of products and features.




As a Data Analyst, you will:




Monitor and report on key KPIs.
Deep-dive (using SQL) into customer data to provide product teams with detailed customer analysis.
Be hands-on with building visualisations in Tableau.
Identify data requirements, working with international data teams to ensure data is cleansed and prepared.
Support with the identification of new and innovative ways to leverage data to deliver new customer engagement opportunities, optimise channels and deliver economic efficiency.
Deliver enhanced customer profiling and segmentation.
Measure the effectiveness of customer-facing products, features and campaigns.
Provide ad-hoc analysis to inform the optimisation of customer-facing products, features and campaigns.
Advise on how advanced statistical and analytical techniques can further improve the understanding of customers.




To apply, you should have




Experience working as a Data Analyst with good exposure to statistical methodologies.
Intermediate SQL skills.
Advanced experience with Tableau (or a similar tool).
Advanced Excel skills.
Proven experience delivering impactful and actionable insights with a B2C environment.




Match Digital specialises in connecting talented individuals with businesses in the digital, tech, media and marcomms industries.

Show more

  • Experience working as a Data Analyst with good exposure to statistical methodologies.
  • Intermediate SQL skills.
  • Advanced experience with Tableau (or a similar tool).
  • Advanced Excel skills.
  • Proven experience delivering impactful and actionable insights with a B2C environment.


Match Digital specialises in connecting talented individuals with businesses in the digital, tech, media and marcomms industries.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Descrição da Empresa

Founded in 1995, we are an international tech consulting company certified by Great Place to Work and in second place in The Best Workplaces 23. We offer innovative solutions to support our clients in their digital transformation. We have over a thousand talents specialized in different technologies, with offices in Portugal, Spain, the Netherlands, Brazil, Ireland, and the USA. Over the years, we have grown and expanded, always staying true to our core values of excellence, innovation, and customer satisfaction. Today, we are a leading player in our industry, with a reputation for delivering cutting-edge solutions that exceed our client's expectations.

Descrição da Função

Noesis is looking for candidates with the following profile: * Bachelor’s degree or higher in Mathematics, Computer Science, Management Informatics or equivalent; * Minimum 2 years of professional experience mining data as a Data Analyst; * Good analytics skills, including mining, modelling logical and conceptual, evaluation and data visualization; * Strong Power BI, SQL or Excel skills, with aptitude for learning other analytics tools; * Dynamism, proactivity and ability to work in a team; * Customer oriented; * Fluency in English will be valued. If you meet these conditions and would like to join an innovative organization that continuously invests in training its talents, send us your application. Join us. Let's innovate together! All our recruitment and selection processes are based on equal opportunities, valuing the competence and potential of each person and ensuring that no candidate is discriminated against on the grounds of gender, ethnicity, sexual orientation, age, religion or physical condition.

Localização


Porto, Portugal

Title: Business/Data Analyst (Finance)
HTML:
Who are we:

Neotalent Conclusion is one of the leading Iberian specialists providing services in Information Technology and Engineering services. As part of the Netherlands-based organization Conclusion, which has an ecosystem of over 25 companies and 3,600 employees, we are focused on increasing the technological capacity of our clients and the digital transformation of their application ecosystems.

We are talent specialists, attracting the best people and combining them with the needs of the most ambitious projects, at the right time. Our success comes from our investments in innovation, our focus on results, and, above all, the guarantee that our people will have happy and rewarding careers.

With over 25 years of solid experience, Neotalent Conclusion has established its presence in key locations, including Lisbon, Porto, and Madrid. The company currently has more than 950 professionals in the different areas in which it operates.


Neotalent, the responsive people.


Find out more about us at www.neotalent.pt.


Role Overview:

We are looking for a Business/Data Analyst to join one of our biggest clients in the Porto area (Hybrid). A multinational financial services firm, one of the largest financial groups and among the 30 largest financial institution’s globally.


As a Business Analyst you will work in a Agile environment and you must be able to respond quickly and work on ad hoc requests from within and across teams regarding evolutionary maintenance tasks and production support.


What you will do:

  • Gather and analyze Business Requirements for new and ongoing projects;
  • Manage and respond to support requests;
  • Write specifications and user stories according to project requirements;
  • Define the plan for implementation of requests/projects;
  • Track and report project progress.


What you are like:

  • At least 2 years of experience as a Business Analyst;
  • Solid knowledge in financial products and market data;
  • Proven experience in IT Business Analysis or Analytics;
  • Knowledge in mathematics and statistics;
  • Good knowledge of Microsoft Excel (Python and R are a plus, but not mandatory)
  • Knowledge of Agile methodologies;
  • Knowledge of project management tools such as Jira and Confluence;
  • Good communication skills;
  • Ability to work in a team;
  • Good level of English – minimum B2 (mandatory);


Why join us

  • Work on challenging projects for big clients
  • Learn more about emerging technologies
  • Possibility of working remotely
  • Design your career plan
  • Access to continuous training and certifications
  • Evolve through our internal mobility program
  • … and much more!

Title: Data & Reporting Analyst
Description:
Decskill, founded in 2014 as an IT Consulting Company, places paramount importance on its greatest asset: its people. Our main mission is to deliver value through knowledge and talent, and we achieve this by fostering a culture of excellence and investing in the development and well-being of our people. With over 600 dedicated professionals and offices in Lisbon, Porto, Madrid, and Luxembourg, Decskill operates across three core areas:




DECSKILL TALENT: We believe that our people are key to our success. Through Decskill Talent, we empower our team to embrace the digital transformation challenges of our clients. We collaborate with clients to drive innovation, ensuring project success and business growth.
DECSKILL BOOST: Equipping our team with the latest tools and methodologies, we optimize Time-to-Market and deliver innovative solutions exceeding client expectations.
DECSKILL CONNECT: Our team collaborates closely with clients to implement and manage IT infrastructures that generate long-term value.




At Decskill, we believe that by nurturing and empowering our people to confront the challenges of digital transformation, we create value not only for our clients but also for our entire ecosystem, fostering a digital community dedicated to growth and progress.




We are searching for an Data & Reporting Analyst!




Requirements:

Academic degree in IT, Cybersecurity, or other relevant area for the position.
Very good professional practice of English (French is a plus).
At least 5 years of professional experience in data analysis.
Very good Expertise in Excel, Python and other ETL tools.
Expertise in Power Bi is mandatory.
Ability to be autonomous.
Commitment to the job and the team objectives.
Systematic, critical, and logical thinking.
Be committed, demanding and pedagogue.
Strive continuously for customer satisfaction.
Aim to deliver very high-quality results.
Respect the procedures, methodologies, and directives.
Good capability of managing stress and conflicts.
Good listening and questioning ability.
Ability to plan work ahead and to prioritize workload.
Good team working ability.
Rigorous.
Client oriented.
Collaborative working skills.
Adaptation capacity.
Analytical skills.
Very Good level of english.




If you’re interested in this job, please send your CV in to cesaltina.abreu@decskill.com with reference “CA/Data&Reporting”.




Thank You!




Decskill is committed to equality and non-discrimination with all our talents. We recruit and promote talent, based on diversity and inclusion, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, race, nationality or any other form of discrimination incompatible with the dignity of the human being.

Title: Data Analyst - Porto, Portugal
Description:
Come and work with us.

We are looking for a talented and accomplished Data Analyst to join our team. Your role will be to work across multiple systems to locate, organize, and correlate unstructured data, ensuring it is maintained and presented accurately.

As a Data Analyst, Your Daily Responsibilities Will Include

Strategy (non-exhaustive)


Collect, clean, and organize data from multiple systems across 10 countries in the Multilingual Region.
Ensure data consistency and correlation across various dimensions such as but not limited to headcount, languages, verticals, channels, and various other KPIs and benchmarks.
Maintain a structured repository of accurate and up-to-date data for regular access and reporting.
Compare and contrast data from different setups (e.g., B&M vs. WFH) to provide insights into strategy.
Benchmark against industry standards and highlight areas of differentiation.
Analyze pipeline trends and detect discrepancies (e.g., Salesforce data vs. ongoing opportunities).
Perform Lost/Win analyses, deal duration assessments, and revenue impact evaluations.
Provide forecasts and recalculations to reflect pipeline variations and trends accurately.
Translate complex data into clear, compelling insights and narratives that support client proposals and internal strategies.
Create visualizations and summaries that drive understanding and action among diverse stakeholders.
Liaise with stakeholders across Sales, Solutions, Operations, and other support teams to collect and validate data.
Partner with team members to provide tailored insights and analytics for specific projects or opportunities.
Work closely with the sales and solutions team to ensure that the latest analytics methodologies, case studies, and thinking are being featured in new proposals.
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment and manage multiple priorities effectively.
Work closely with internal teams (Reporting, CI, Operations, etc.) to uncover insights and trends.
Provide regular updates and reports to senior leadership on the progress and performance of our analytics initiatives and their impact on the business.


To succeed in the role, you will need to have : ‎


Native or proficient level of English (C2) - mandatory
Additional languages are valued
Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Excel - mandatory
Experience with data visualization tools (Power BI, Tableau, etc.).
Strong analytical and storytelling skills with the ability to derive actionable insights from data.
Exceptional organizational skills to manage diverse datasets and ensure consistency.
Ability to work proactively and independently across multiple systems to locate and understand data.
Strong cross-collaboration skills to work effectively with various teams and stakeholders.
Advanced Excel: pivot tables, complex formulas, macros, etc.- mandatory
Experience with CRM systems like Salesforce for pipeline analysis.
Familiarity with data visualization tools (Power BI or Tableau).
Familiarity with cloud-based collaboration tools (e.g., SharePoint; SharePoint Lists, etc.)
Knowledge of database query languages (e.g., SQL) is a plus.
Exposure to ETL tools/processes is desirable (advanced Excel or scripts like Python or R to mimic ETL processes is a plus).
Must hold EU citizenship or valid work permit for Portugal
Be a local candidate or willing to relocate to Porto, Portugal
Availability to work in our Porto Site


Education And Experience


Minimum 2 years of experience in data analysis, preferably within a sales, operations, or BPO environment.
Experience working with unstructured and multidimensional data sets across different systems
Familiarity with pipeline dynamics and CRM systems (Salesforce experience highly valued).


Benefits.


Competitive wages
Paid professional training
Employee discounts
Private healthcare & dental insurance (after six months of employment)
Growth opportunities through various development programs
Fun and engaging company-wide initiatives, including our EverBetter wellness program
Job stability
Life-long skills and experience
Excellent work culture


Go further with Foundever™

We believe in memorable associate experiences. Here, you can improve your quality of life and grow your career. 

Apply today!

Title: Data Analyst (Alteryx)
Description:
Are you driven by Technology? 🔴




If so, it's at Red IT that you should embrace your next challenge! We took our first steps in Innovation and Technology in 2016, and the desire to do more and better is always with us.

Red.it stands as a key element within Group RIT, a collaboration of technological enterprises focused on accelerating business growth through digital transformation. Our teams are experienced and certified IT professionals that work closely with clients, to provide fit-for-purpose solutions. From software development, next-generation cloud services, support in IT projects across multiple technological stacks, IT outsourcing, and many more, Group RIT will use the most advanced technology to accelerate and unleash the full potential of our client's business. With 6 Business Units, 11 offices in 8 countries and a global team of over 500 people, Group RIT is leading digital innovation, providing innovative solutions for multiple business sectors like Telecom, Healthcare, Finance, Retail and Manufacturing.




Red.it is dedicated to fostering a workplace that embraces diversity and inclusion. As an equal opportunity employer, it does not discriminate based on race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or any other legally protected status. We believe in creating an environment where all individuals are respected and valued for their unique perspectives and contributions.




Join the Wolfpack as a Data Analyst (Hybrid - Porto) ! 🐺







What skills do you need to have?




Bachelor's degree in Engineering/Computing/Science or similar field.
4 years' experience in data preparation and reconciliation.
Proficiency in Alteryx, VBA and SQL.
Availability for occasional travel.
Fluency in English:
French is highly valued.







Some of your responsibilities will be:




Collaborate with business users to solve business problems.
Develop and maintain Alteryx workflows for data processing.
Ensure compliance with software governance rules.
Estimate and manage data project tasks.







Red Code:




A team focused on achieving objectives, motivation will not be lacking! Red Team!

Red Training - We want to help you reach your potential.

Continuous career support and advice. Red Follow Up

Red Change - You love what you do, but want to explore other areas? No problem Wolf!

There is time for everything, and fun is not left out. Red Hours

Red Spirit - If you want to go fast, go alone. If you want to go far, GO TOGETHER!




Keywords: Data Analyst, Alteryx.




WHAT DRIVES YOU?




Apply here or through join.us@redit.pt and find out what moves us at www.redit.pt

Title: Data Analyst (Alteryx)
HTML:
Dellent is a consulting company focused in System Information and Telecommunications. Our goal is to help our candidates and consultants to take a step forward in their careers through projects that meet their needs and expectations.

This project is part of the business investment banking and financial services area, and currently has its technological hub in Porto and is working on the development of innovative solutions and support for all operations related to the business.

We are looking for a Data Analyst (Alteryx) to work in this project in Porto (Hybrid).

Requirements

  • Degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Applied Math, or a similar area;
  • Experience in data preparation and data reconciliation;
  • Proven experience in Alteryx and VBA;
  • Good Knowledge of SQL;
  • +2 years of experience with Alteryx;
  • Availability to travel abroad for short periods of time, as required;
  • Good level of English (mandatory).

We Offer

  • Health insurance;
  • A personalized training plan, with a budget to spend on the training and technical books you find necessary;
  • Constant feedback so you can grow professionally;
  • Remote onboarding process;
  • Team events every semester so you can live new adventures;
  • Culture of proximity and transparency. Your ideas and needs are heard and valued by us!

Apply

If the above sounds like the kind of job opportunity you would want to get involved with, then please do not hesitate to apply here. You can also explore our content about the job market here.

Title: Data Analyst / BI Developer - Porto
Description:
Hello, It's nice to have you here.

We know that the most valuable asset is your time, so let's get straight to the point.

This is the job: Senior Data Analyst / BI Developer - Porto

📍 Porto *only candidates who are already in Portugal will be considered

💻 Hybrid

🗣 Proficiency in English (Mandatory)




These are the essential skills:

Significant experience (5+ years) as a Data Analyst, Data Scientist, Data Engineer, or in a similar senior role.
Strong knowledge of business intelligence methodologies, particularly in data visualization (must have).
Proficiency in Power BI and experience in developing and managing BI reports.
Advanced SQL skills for data extraction, manipulation, and performance tuning.
Familiarity with programming languages such as Python or R for data analysis and modeling.




Plus:

French




Ok. So, you have reached the end of the checklist.

Time to introduce ourselves 👋

We're a Portuguese Tech Company specialized in software development. We have offices in Lisbon, Porto, Rio de Janeiro, and Geneva.

We are dedicated to producing exceptional deliverables and focused on continuous development, both in our code and in the growth of our people's careers, ensuring an exciting and enduring professional journey. We'll keep an eye on your performance and motivations through a personalized career plan and training program.

Our inspirational team comes from all over the world, and we love to get together, share knowledge, interests, experiences, and even become friends.

So... are you still here? Great! It's time to apply: joana.silva@velv.pt

Thanks for your time. Welcome to Velv 😎

Data Analyst (Arch Data) (m/f) - Remote Mandatory: Experience with Data Analysis and Data Governance;Experience with Python, SQL, and any Dashboard/ Reporting tool;Experience with Arch Data.What we offer: A dynamic project in a well-regarded client at an international level;Salary classification according to the experience shown;Career development with intervention in ambitious and innovative technological projects;Good working environment with young and dynamic teams;Personalized follow-up to each consultant;Integration into Sysmatch staff with access to all company activities;You will be part of our trainings and Team Building events;A network of hundreds of partnerships with companies in countless sectors that offer you exclusive discounts (health, wellness, travel, gastronomy, culture, leisure, training, etc).Recruitment, selection and integration process: The first contacts will be made by phone call or video call.

We are prepared to ensure the monitoring and integration of new employees and support them in this new phase of their professional career.

To respond to this opportunity, please send us your CV, indicating the reference PC/DA/E to the following email address ******

Employment typeFull-time

Title: Marketing Analyst - Customer Data Analyst
Description:
We have an exciting opportunity for you to join our team as a Customer Data Analyst.

Who We Are

FedEx is the largest express transportation company in the world, connecting more than 220 countries and territories. We work every moment to deliver the most important package of someone’s day. Our team of passionate people know their day-to-day work is invaluable in delivering outstanding experience to our customers. 530,000 team members strong, we are as diverse as the world we serve. We love what we do, and we do it well. Our reach is big, and so are our dreams. Join us and let's write our next chapter together.

What You Will Be Doing


Analyze Customer Data: Collect, analyze, and interpret customer data from various sources (e.g., CRM systems, web analytics, social media) using tools like SAS, Alteryx, and Databricks to identify trends, behaviors, and insights that drive engagement strategies.
Develop Audience Segmentation: Create and manage detailed audience segments based on customer data, using platforms such as Relay42 to tailor marketing strategies and campaigns to specific customer groups.
Support Marketing Automation: Develop and manage data-driven marketing automation strategies, including segmentation, lead scoring, and personalized campaigns, to enhance customer engagement and conversion rates.
Create and Maintain Dashboards: Design and maintain dashboards and reports that provide actionable insights into customer engagement metrics, campaign performance, and overall marketing effectiveness, utilizing visualization tools and data platforms.


Monitor and Optimize Campaign Performance: Track and analyze the performance of marketing automation campaigns, including those run through Relay42, providing insights and recommendations for optimization based on data analysis using SAS, Alteryx, and Databricks.

What Do You Bring With You

The ideal candidate would demonstrate:


Expertise in Data Analysis Tools: Proficiency in data analysis tools and platforms such as SAS, Alteryx, Databricks, SQL, Excel, and data visualization tools like Tableau or Power BI to analyze and present data.
Experience with Marketing Automation Platforms: Knowledge of marketing automation tools such as Relay42, HubSpot, Marketo, or Salesforce Marketing Cloud, including experience with setting up and managing automated workflows and campaigns.
Audience Creation and Management: Experience in creating and managing audience segments, leveraging data-driven insights to inform targeted marketing strategies and improve engagement.
Strong Analytical Skills: Ability to interpret complex data sets, identify patterns, and provide actionable insights that drive customer engagement and marketing effectiveness.


Communication and Reporting: Excellent skills in creating clear, concise reports and presentations to communicate findings and recommendations to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.

What Do We Offer


Attractive compensation package
Training to get you started and on-the-job learning opportunities
Extensive learning resources to further develop your skills and knowledge
Tuition Assistance Program (*applicable for FedEx positions with a permanent contract)
Employee Assistance Program for you and your family in difficult life situations
Employee reduced-rate shipping
Great career opportunities
FedEx is one of the worlds most admired companies and trusted brands year after year


Bring your ideas, individuality, and dreams to our global community. Feel good about where you work. Choose your career path - we’re ready to invest in your development. Join FedEx.

Title: Data Analyst | Retail
Description:
Make an impact by working for sectors where technology is the enabler, everything is ground-breaking and there’s a constant need to be innovative.

Create and enhance projects in Java, Pyhton, Angular, PHP, .NET and so much more while diving in the world of Blockchain, Artificial Intelligence, Data Science, Security and Internet of Things.

Be part of the team that combines business knowledge, technological edge and a design experience. Our different backgrounds and know-how are key in developing solutions and experiences for digital clients.

Face challenges and learn other ways of thinking and seeing the world - there’s always room for your energy and creativity.

About The Role

A Data Analyst is responsible for examining and interpreting complex data sets to derive meaningful insights and support business decision-making. Focused on descriptive and diagnostic analytics to answer questions of where your company has been, where it is now, why things are the way they are now and support the decision about what are the next steps.

Their mission involves organizing data, conducting statistical analysis, creating data models, and collecting data requirements from Business.

Data analysts collaborate with different teams to understand their analytical requirements, identify key metrics, and communicate data-driven findings to stakeholders effectively.

As a part of your job, you will:


Gathering and analyzing business requirements to determine the best solution for data reporting and analysis.
Designing data solutions such as data warehousing, data marts, dashboards, and reporting systems.
Developing and maintaining data models, reports, and visualizations.
Collaborating with IT teams to ensure proper data integration and management.
Assisting stakeholders in interpreting data insights and making informed business decisions.



What are we looking for?


Retail experience;
At least 8 years of experience in data analysis, with a demonstrated track record of delivering actionable insights and driving business impact;
Proficiency in SQL for data querying and analysis;
Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI, or matplotlib);
Knowledge of statistical analysis techniques and tools (e.g., R, Python libraries like pandas);
Ability to interpret and analyze complex data sets;
Familiarity with data cleansing and preparation techniques.



Personal traits


Ability to adapt to different contexts, teams, and Clients;
Teamwork skills but also a sense of autonomy;
Motivation for international projects and ok if travel is included;
Willingness to collaborate with other players;
Strong communication skills.



At Celfocus, we are committed to cultivate a diverse and inclusive workplace. As an equal-opportunity employer, we welcome applicants of all backgrounds, gender identities, and abilities. We are dedicated to providing reasonable accommodations for candidates with specific needs. If you require any adjustments during the selection process, please inform our Talent Acquisition Team.

Come join the Team!

Celfocus is a European high-tech system integrator, providing leading edge professional services focused on creating business value through Analytics and Cognitive solutions – addressing Telecommunications, Financial Services, Retail, Energy & Utilities, Pharmaceutical, and other markets' strategic opportunities.

As a highly specialised engineering company, Celfocus helps clients undergo their innovation path, providing technological solutions to extract value from data and make it actionable.

Serving clients in +25 countries, Celfocus delivers solutions that boost customer experience and enhance operational efficiency, via our Cognitive Automation, Data & Analytics and Digital offers.

Title: Data & Business Intelligence Officer
Description:
About The Job

Global Markets is BNP Paribas’ capital markets business within Corporate & Institutional Banking (CIB), delivering solutions across asset classes, and industry-leading services for clients including Institutionals, corporates, private banks and retail distribution networks. Our Portugal Platform (Porto and Lisbon) is a major HUB in Europe and certainly unique in the country by its size and its scope of activity, with all Front Office roles present (Trading, Sales, Research, Structuring, Quant & Engineering, Business Dev and Support, Marketing & Client Support, Risk Management, Data Analytics and Machine Learning…). We are growing fast with the ambition to become even more relevant for the worldwide activity, which presents many short and long term opportunities.

Your Main Activities Are

The purpose of the role is to Drive the Business Intelligence for FX+, including (but not limited to) reporting on the activity, tracking of the business case, management of the Revenue Sharing Agreements, pricing and booking models enhancements, business development and tracking of the operational quality.


Monitor the FX Payments activity and the revenue sharing
Monitor activity KPIs (volumes, revenues, pricing …) for all geographies / clients
Manage revenue sharing with TB / DM / IRB partners
Track the FX+ platform performance and operational quality
Support the business development with accurate ad-hoc data analysis (pricing analysis, campaigns targeting and follow-up…)
Build a state of the art industrial “Client Intelligence” solutio
Establish key metrics, reports and alerts and requirements in terms of digital business performance, in close collaboration with the businesses, to measure activity and revenues
Contribute to the management of the product roadmap for Client Intelligence (extension to new activities, new countries, new client segments and needs …)


Profile And Skills To Success


Academic background in Engineering, Mathematics, Finance, Economics or similar areas (preferential)
Experience in a similar Business Intelligence
An overall understanding and interest in the financial world
Strong appetite for Digital technologies, support and foster a culture of continuous improvement
Experienced in defining and sponsoring projects and project management: business case and scoping study, management of the delivery along with Business Lines / IT / Operations
Fluency in English (mandatory)
Excellent communication skills and client focus
Strong team work while being able to work autonomously
Ability to work under tight deadlines and organisational skills
Strong Excel knowledge
Tableau, PowerBI and other IT coding Skills – (Intermediate)
Contribute to the management of the product roadmap for Client Intelligence (extension to new activities, new countries, new client segments and needs Contribute to the management of the product roadmap for Client Intelligence (extension to new activities, new countries, new client segments and needs …)


Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union’s leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centres providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group’s retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

Title: Quantitative Data & BI Specialist - Tableau
Description:
🤔Who are we?




As the founding entity of RAINBOW PARTNERS, Quanteam is a consulting firm specializing in the fields of Banking, Finance, and Financial Services. Guided by our core values of closeness, teamwork, diversity, and excellence, our team of 980 expert consultants, representing 35 different nationalities, collaborates across 12 international offices: Paris, Lyon, New York, Montreal, London, Brussels, Geneva, Lisbon, Porto, Casablanca, Madrid and Singapore. Committed to sustainability (Ecovadis Gold), diversity (gender index: 92%), and quality of work life (Best Workplace Experience), Quanteam is a forward-thinking enterprise.




🚀 Our Expertise




With a dual expertise in both business and IT, Quanteam supports its corporate clients (investment banks, asset management companies, private and retail banks, custodians, etc.) across the entire Front-to-Back spectrum in evolving their business activities and transformation projects.




Our teams are organized into 5 expertise areas:

➡ Quantitative Finance

➡ Risk, Compliance, and Regulatory

➡ Operations and Finance

➡ Transformation and Organization

➡ Information Systems

In 2023, Quanteam generated a revenue of €74.6 million.







🔎We are looking for a Quantitative Data & BI Specialist - Tableau




MAIN TASKS:

Data Visualization:

Design and develop interactive Tableau dashboards and reports that provide actionable insights.
Ensure dashboards are user-friendly, visually appealing, and aligned with business requirements.

Data Management:

Collaborate with data engineers and analysts to ensure data accuracy, integrity, and availability.
Work with large datasets, perform data cleansing, and optimize data queries for performance.

Stakeholder Collaboration:

Engage with stakeholders to understand their data needs and provide solutions that meet their objectives.
Conduct training sessions and workshops to educate users on how to effectively use Tableau dashboards.

Maintenance and Support:

Troubleshoot and resolve technical issues related to Tableau dashboards and reports.
Continuously monitor and improve the performance of existing dashboards.

Documentation:

Maintain detailed documentation of all dashboards, reports, and data sources.

Keep up to date with the latest Tableau features and best practices.




YOUR PROFILE AND SKILLS:




Academic background in Computer Science, Information Technology, Data Science, or a related field.
Professional experience as a Tableau Developer (at least 2 years).




Technical Skills:

Proficiency in Tableau Desktop and Tableau Server.
Strong SQL skills and experience with databases (e.g., MS SQL Server, PostgreSQL, Oracle).
Familiarity with data warehousing concepts and ETL processes.
Professional experience in data analysis with programming, preferably Python (Pandas)
Knowledge of other BI tools (e.g., Power BI, QlikView) is a plus.

Analytical Skills:

Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Ability to interpret complex data and translate it into meaningful insights.

Communication Skills:

Excellent communication and presentation skills.
Ability to explain technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
Fluency in written and spoken English.

Other Skills:

Detail-oriented with a strong focus on data accuracy.
Strong organizational skills, with the ability to prioritize multiple projects and meet deadlines
Familiarity with agile methodologies and project management tools.
Knowledge in financial markets is a plus (fx, credit, rates, commodities).
Hybrid role based in Porto or Lisbon







🚀If you feel this opportunity is for you, send your CV and join our team!

YOUR PROFILE AND SKILLS:


  • Academic background in Computer Science, Information Technology, Data Science, or a related field.
  • Professional experience as a Tableau Developer (at least 2 years).


Technical Skills:

  • Proficiency in Tableau Desktop and Tableau Server.
  • Strong SQL skills and experience with databases (e.g., MS SQL Server, PostgreSQL, Oracle).
  • Familiarity with data warehousing concepts and ETL processes.
  • Professional experience in data analysis with programming, preferably Python (Pandas)
  • Knowledge of other BI tools (e.g., Power BI, QlikView) is a plus.

Analytical Skills:

  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
  • Ability to interpret complex data and translate it into meaningful insights.

Communication Skills:

  • Excellent communication and presentation skills.
  • Ability to explain technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
  • Fluency in written and spoken English.

Other Skills:

  • Detail-oriented with a strong focus on data accuracy.
  • Strong organizational skills, with the ability to prioritize multiple projects and meet deadlines
  • Familiarity with agile methodologies and project management tools.
  • Knowledge in financial markets is a plus (fx, credit, rates, commodities).
  • Hybrid role based in Porto or Lisbon



🚀If you feel this opportunity is for you, send your CV and join our team!

Title: Business Intelligence Associate
Description:
Who we are




Metyis is a global and forward-thinking firm operating across a wide range of industries, developing and delivering AI & Data, Digital Commerce, Marketing & Design solutions and Advisory services. At Metyis, our long-term partnership model brings long-lasting impact and growth to our business partners and clients through extensive execution capabilities.

With our team, you can experience a collaborative environment with highly skilled multidisciplinary experts, where everyone has room to build bigger and bolder ideas. Being part of Metyis means you can speak your mind and be creative with your knowledge. Imagine the things you can achieve with a team that encourages you to be the best version of yourself.

We are Metyis. Partners for Impact.




What We Offer







A balanced work environment where you will have autonomy, responsibility, and ownership while working with a vibrant and dynamic team.
A modern office with everything you need (including food and beverages).
Become part of a fast-growing international and diverse team.




What You Will Do




Design visually appealing and business useful reports.
Understand client requirement and suggest right technical architecture.
Developing technically efficient, fast, useful and appealing reports.
Technical problem solving - good knowledge of DAX and data modelling.
Preparing and facilitating workshops.
Managing stakeholders and communicating with executives.




What you’ll bring




3+ years of experience in PowerBI/ BI design and development.
Prior experience in customer facing role across functions is good to have.
In-depth understand of data modelling and basics of azure environment.
Solid understanding and working experience of other BI tools and powerapps.
Profound knowledge of the English language.




In a changing world, diversity and inclusion are core values for team well-being and performance. At Metyis, we want to welcome and retain all talents, regardless of gender, age, origin or sexual orientation, and irrespective of whether or not they are living with a disability, as each of them has their own experience and identity.

Title: Data Analyst (Alteryx)
Description:
Are you driven by Technology?

If so, it's at Red IT that you should embrace your next challenge!

We took our first steps in Innovation and Technology in 2016, and the desire to do more and better is always with us.

Red.It stands as a key element within Group RIT, a collaboration of technological enterprises focused on accelerating business growth through digital transformation.

Our teams are experienced and certified IT professionals that work closely with clients, to provide fit-for-purpose solutions.

From software development, next-generation cloud services, support in IT projects across multiple technological stacks, IT outsourcing, and many more, Group RIT will use the most advanced technology to accelerate and unleash the full potential of our client's business.

With 6 Business Units, 11 offices in 8 countries and a global team of over 500 people, Group RIT is leading digital innovation, providing innovative solutions for multiple business sectors like Telecom, Healthcare, Finance, Retail and Manufacturing.

Red.It is dedicated to fostering a workplace that embraces diversity and inclusion.

As an equal opportunity employer, it does not discriminate based on race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or any other legally protected status.

We believe in creating an environment where all individuals are respected and valued for their unique perspectives and contributions.

Join the Wolfpack as a Data Analyst (Hybrid - Porto) !

What skills do you need to have?

Bachelor's degree in Engineering/Computing/Science or similar field.

4 years' experience in data preparation and reconciliation.

Proficiency in Alteryx, VBA and SQL.

Availability for occasional travel.

Fluency in English: French is highly valued.

Some of your responsibilities will be: Collaborate with business users to solve business problems.

Develop and maintain Alteryx workflows for data processing.

Ensure compliance with software governance rules.

Estimate and manage data project tasks.

Red Code: A team focused on achieving objectives, motivation will not be lacking!

Red Team!

Red Training - We want to help you reach your potential.

Continuous career support and advice.

Red Follow Up Red Change - You love what you do, but want to explore other areas?

No problem Wolf!

There is time for everything, and fun is not left out.

Red Hours Red Spirit - If you want to go fast, go alone.

If you want to go far, GO TOGETHER!

Keywords: Data Analyst, Alteryx.

WHAT DRIVES YOU?

Apply here or through ****** and find out what moves us at

Title: Business Analyst - Spark
Description:
Company Description

Natixis in Portugal is a Centre of Expertise whose mission is to transform traditional banking by developing innovative solutions for the business, operations and work culture of Groupe BPCE worldwide.

Natixis in Portugal is part of the Global Financial Services division, where it applies technology for the development of financial expertise in its two global business lines – Corporate & Investment Banking and Asset & Wealth Management – and, transversally, for the entities of Groupe BPCE.

The Centre of Expertise, based in Porto, currently has more than 2,400 employees from over 30 nationalities, organised in three main departments: Information Technology, Banking Support Activities and Compliance. These teams work in an integrated, inclusive and transversal way, supporting and creating value for all the business lines and platforms of the group. The project in Porto is one of the biggest investments in Human Resources ever made by Groupe BPCE worldwide.

A disruptive mindset and a culture of proximity and agility identify Natixis in Portugal Team and reflect the company's mission to transform traditional banking at a global scale: a perfect match in the Portuguese dynamics and entrepreneurial ecosystem.

In 2024, Top Employers Institute has awarded Natixis in Portugal the Top Employer Portugal accreditation for the second time. This certification recognizes excellence in people practices, following the example of our head office, in France, who was certified Top Employer France for the eight year in a row.

Job Description

As a Business Analyst for Limits & ROE team, your role will include:


Gathering user requirements, performing requirements’ analysis and writing functional specifications
Pilot and follow the technical implementation
Performing quality assurance, by defining and executing test cases
Developing positive relationships with internal clients and stakeholders
Designing, documenting and maintaining system processes
Providing users with first line support
Applying best practices for effective communication and problem-solving.
Working in an Agile environment with a Scrum framework


 

Qualifications

Functional Skills


Professional / Academic knowledge in Economics/Finance/Risk Management/Banking (must have)
Experience as business analyst or having worked on IT projects in Financial Institutions must have)


Technical Skills


SQL knowledge (nice to have)


Soft Skills


Ability to work in a fast-paced, highly demanding, and dynamic environment
Autonomous, structured and proactive
Client-centric mindset
Great communication and organization skills
Willingness to learn


Languages


English: Fluent (must have)
French (nice to have) 


 

Additional Information

At Natixis, we are committed to fostering a working environment where each and every one of our people is treated with dignity and respect and where every voice is heard. Our differences make us collectively stronger and are a source of fulfilment, innovation and performance.

In the framework of its Diversity, Equity & Inclusion policy, Natixis in Portugal has implemented a Blind CV Screening process, with the purpose of reducing hiring bias. A blind CV excludes any personal details which refer to the applicant’s gender, age or ethnicity. When applying for our positions, please submit a blind CV, that is, with no picture, name, gender, age, nationality, ethnicity and address. Your personal statement, work experience, courses and certifications, education, skills and contact information is what matters to us.

#MuchMoreThanJustAJob

Early morning. Campo 24 de Agosto. In 4 minutes, you are clocking in at the office. Start your day having breakfast with the Team and grab fresh fruit on the way to your seat, in one of Porto’s most typical neighborhoods. This Purple Day is going to be a busy one: daily meeting ensuring all team members are on the same page regarding work status, priorities and blockers, language class and, just after, a Talent Management meeting with your manager, discussing your career path.

Lunch break. Today, your Team is onboarding newcomers, but also welcoming French colleagues: the perfect excuse to walk downtown and bond over a francesinha. When returning, inhale nature and peace of mind in Natixis Urban Garden (look at the crops; ready to harvest!).

Back inside. Brainstorming session on a new, exciting project in our disruptive and immersive Manaus Village. The afternoon went flying (tasks, meetings, some jokes with your teammates). End it on a high note: celebrating cultural diversity with a Diwali, the Indian festival of lights.

Tomorrow, you attend a conference led by influential speakers in your industry and, the day after, you will work from home, benefitting from some focus time to complete that report and soft skills course on LinkedIn Learning. Once you are done with your work for the day, strike the right note playing with Natixis band or be part of a board games session. If that is too steady for you, meet your colleagues to catch some waves or sail the Douro river during golden hour.

Title: Técnico de Business Intelligence e Reporting
HTML:
AVELEDA | A Aveleda é uma empresa de vinhos com 150 anos de história, afirmando-se como um dos maiores produtores e exportadores de vinhos em Portugal. Produz vinhos em cinco regiões: Douro, Vinhos Verdes, Bairrada, Lisboa e Algarve, e está presente em mais de 80 países com marcas líder em vários mercados. No seu portfolio, encontram-se grandes marcas como Casal Garcia, Aveleda, Adega Velha, Quinta Vale D. Maria, Quinta D'Aguieira, Villa Alvor e, mais recentemente, o Mandriola de Lisboa!

Para além do vinho, a Aveleda aposta no turismo, aproveitando o potencial da sua envolvente natural, da sua longa história e dos seus jardins, um referencial do legado desta casa e desta família.


MISSÃO | Integrado na equipa de IT, o Técnico de Business Intelligence e Reporting terá como principal missão desenvolver soluções de BI e reporting, contribuindo para a otimização da tomada de decisão e inovação nos processos da empresa.


PRINCIPAIS RESPONSABILIDADES

  • Apoiar a equipa de IT na criação e desenvolvimento de relatórios de gestão;
  • Desenvolver e manter o Data Warehouse e soluções de BI;
  • Pesquisar e implementar soluções inovadoras consoante os diferentes desafios;
  • Garantir a qualidade, segurança e disponibilidade dos dados para análise e reporting.


QUEM PROCURAMOS

  • CET – Curso de Especialização Tecnológica ou Formação Superior em tecnologias de informação, informática ou áreas afins;
  • Experiência profissional mínima de 2 anos em funções similares;
  • Conhecimento de Microsoft Dynamics BC e gestão do Office 365;
  • Conhecimentos em algoritmia, estrutura e funcionamento de bases de dados;
  • Domínio de linguagens de programação WEB (.NET, C#, JavaScript, HTML, CSS, XML, PL SQL);
  • Experiência com SQL Server, Reporting Services, Power BI, Microsoft Excel e Power Query;
  • Conhecimento de integrações entre sistemas e redes informáticas;
  • Bons conhecimentos de inglês.


CARACTERÍSTICAS CRÍTICAS

  • Postura proativa, energética e dinâmica;
  • Autonomia, organização e planeamento;
  • Capacidade analítica e sentido crítico;
  • Orientação para resultados;
  • Versatilidade e capacidade de adaptação.


IDENTIFICAÇÃO COM OS VALORES AVELEDA:

Ética | Excelência | Paixão


Aveleda, Onde os Sonhos se Cultivam.

Title: Data Engineer & Analyst
Description:
Sobre a Empresa: A Sysmatch é uma empresa de Consultoria e Outsourcing de IT com uma vasta gama de competências tecnológicas, resultantes da acumulação de know-how e da experiência dos nossos consultores, permitindo a implementação de soluções adaptadas às necessidades dos nossos clientes, privilegiando a sua robustez e expansão. Com mais de duas décadas no mercado, apresentamo-nos como uma empresa flexível, adaptável, inovadora e virada para o futuro.




Sobre o Cargo: Data Engineer & Analyst




Regime: Regime híbrido na Trofa




Descrição da Função: O candidato ideal terá um perfil híbrido, combinando capacidades técnicas de engenharia de dados com fortes competências analíticas e de negócio. Será responsável por desenvolver, gerir e otimizar pipelines de dados, bem como por realizar análises estratégicas para apoiar a tomada de decisão da empresa, lidando com vários stakeholders internos.

Responsabilidades:

Conceber, desenvolver e manter pipelines de dados eficientes e escaláveis.
Assegurar a qualidade, integridade e governança dos dados, garantindo a conformidade com os princípios de Data Governance.
Trabalhar com equipas de negócio para compreender requisitos e traduzir necessidades em soluções analíticas eficazes.
Criar e manter dashboards interativos e relatórios no Power BI para dar suporte à tomada de decisão.
Desenvolver modelos preditivos e análises de forecasting para otimizar processos e antecipar tendências.
Extrair, transformar e carregar (ETL) dados a partir de diferentes fontes e garantir a sua usabilidade para análises.
Automatizar processos de ingestão e tratamento de dados para melhorar a eficiência e reduzir tempos de resposta.
Garantir a segurança e conformidade dos dados, alinhando-se com as melhores práticas de proteção e privacidade.
Trabalhar com equipas multidisciplinares para implementar estratégias data-driven.

Requisitos:

Licenciatura/Mestrado em Engenharia Informática, Ciência de Dados, Gestão de Informação ou áreas relacionadas.
Experiência mínima de 2-3 anos em funções de Data Engineer, Data Analyst ou Business Intelligence.
Forte experiência em ferramentas de visualização e análise de dados, nomeadamente Power BI.
Conhecimentos sólidos de bases de dados relacionais e não relacionais
Experiência em processos de ETL e manipulação de grandes volumes de dados.
Domínio de linguagens de desenvolvimento para análise e manipulação de dados.
Conhecimento de princípios de Data Governance e melhores práticas de qualidade de dados (valorizam-se certificações)
Experiência na criação de modelos de previsão e análises estatísticas aplicadas ao negócio.
Capacidade de levantamento de requisitos e tradução de necessidades do negócio para soluções técnicas.
Boa capacidade de comunicação e interação com diferentes stakeholders.

O que te oferecemos:

Um projeto dinâmico num cliente bem-conceituado a nível Internacional;
Enquadramento salarial de acordo com a experiência demonstrada;
Evolução de carreira com intervenção em projetos tecnológicos ambiciosos e inovadores;
Integração em equipa dinâmica e heterogénea;
Acompanhamento personalizado a cada consultor;
Integração nos quadros Sysmatch com acesso a todas as atividades da empresa;
Serás parte das nossas formações e dos nossos eventos Team Building;
Uma rede de centenas de parcerias com empresas de inúmeros setores que te oferecem descontos exclusivos (saúde, bem-estar, viagens, gastronomia, cultura, lazer, formação, etc).




Processo de recrutamento, seleção e integração:

Os primeiros contactos serão realizados através de chamada telefónica ou vídeo conferência.

Estamos preparados para assegurar o acompanhamento e a integração dos novos colaboradores e apoiá-los nesta nova fase da sua carreira profissional.

Estamos preparados para assegurar o acompanhamento e a integração dos novos colaboradores e apoiá-los nesta nova fase da sua carreira profissional.

Title: Suporte Aplicacional - Business Intelligence
HTML:
Temos um desafio para ti –Suporte Aplicacional - Business Intelligence – Modelo Híbrido



O que procuramos:


- Formação Superior em Engenharia Informática;

- Experiência em Business Intelligence;

- Experiência com Data warehouse;

- Fortes conhecimentos de SQL / PLSQL;

- Experiência em Reporting (Microstrategy, Analysis services, outras similares);

- Experiência em ETL (Datastage, Databricks, SQL Server Integration Services, outras similares)

- Conhecimentos em Big Data (Hive, impala, spark, hbase, cloud – CDP, Oozie);

- Experiência com RAID;

- Experiência com Linguagens de programação (Shell script, python/pyspark) ;

- Experiência com Microsoft Azure.


O que oferecemos:


- Acesso a formação técnica e metodologias sólidas de avaliação de desempenho e gestão de carreiras;

- Perspetiva de crescimento de carreira a nível nacional e internacional;

- Parcerias nas áreas de Telecomunicações, Ensino, Turismo, Desporto e muito mais.
